00064 /********************************************************************\
00065 *                                                                    *
00066 *            Shared Memory Allocation                                *
00067 *                                                                    *
00068 \********************************************************************/
00069 
00070 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00071 void *malloc_key(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, INT size)
00072 {
00073    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pfound, *pprev = NULL;
00074 
00075    if (size == 0)
00076       return NULL;
00077 
00078    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00079    size = ALIGN8(size);
00080 
00081    /* search for free block */
00082    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00083 
00084    while (pfree->size < size && pfree->next_free) {
00085       pprev = pfree;
00086       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00087    }
00088 
00089    /* return if not enough memory */
00090    if (pfree->size < size)
00091       return 0;
00092 
00093    pfound = pfree;
00094 
00095    /* if found block is first in list, correct pheader */
00096    if (pfree == (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key)) {
00097       if (size < pfree->size) {
00098          /* free block is only used partially */
00099          pheader->first_free_key += size;
00100          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00101 
00102          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00103          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00104       } else {
00105          /* free block is used totally */
00106          pheader->first_free_key = pfree->next_free;
00107       }
00108    } else {
00109       /* check if free block is used totally */
00110       if (pfound->size - size < (int) sizeof(FREE_DESCRIP)) {
00111          /* skip block totally */
00112          pprev->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00113       } else {
00114          /* decrease free block */
00115          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pfound + size);
00116 
00117          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00118          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00119 
00120          pprev->next_free = (POINTER_T) pfree - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00121       }
00122    }
00123 
00124 
00125    memset(pfound, 0, size);
00126 
00127    return pfound;
00128 }
00129 
00130 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00131 void free_key(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, void *address, INT size)
00132 {
00133    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pprev, *pnext;
00134 
00135    if (size == 0)
00136       return;
00137 
00138    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00139    size = ALIGN8(size);
00140 
00141    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) address;
00142    pprev = NULL;
00143 
00144    /* clear current block */
00145    memset(address, 0, size);
00146 
00147    /* if key comes before first free block, adjust pheader */
00148    if ((POINTER_T) address - (POINTER_T) pheader < pheader->first_free_key) {
00149       pfree->size = size;
00150       pfree->next_free = pheader->first_free_key;
00151       pheader->first_free_key = (POINTER_T) address - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00152    } else {
00153       /* find last free block before current block */
00154       pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00155 
00156       while (pprev->next_free < (POINTER_T) address - (POINTER_T) pheader) {
00157          if (pprev->next_free <= 0) {
00158             cm_msg(MERROR, "free_key",
00159                    "database is corrupted: pprev=0x%x, pprev->next_free=%d", pprev, pprev->next_free);
00160             return;
00161          }
00162          pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pprev->next_free);
00163       }
00164 
00165       pfree->size = size;
00166       pfree->next_free = pprev->next_free;
00167 
00168       pprev->next_free = (POINTER_T) pfree - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00169    }
00170 
00171    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks after current block */
00172    pnext = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00173    if ((POINTER_T) pnext == (POINTER_T) pfree + pfree->size) {
00174       pfree->size += pnext->size;
00175       pfree->next_free = pnext->next_free;
00176 
00177       memset(pnext, 0, pnext->size);
00178    }
00179 
00180    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks before current block */
00181    if (pprev && pprev->next_free == (POINTER_T) pprev - (POINTER_T) pheader + pprev->size) {
00182       pprev->size += pfree->size;
00183       pprev->next_free = pfree->next_free;
00184 
00185       memset(pfree, 0, pfree->size);
00186    }
00187 }
00188 
00189 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00190 void *malloc_data(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, INT size)
00191 {
00192    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pfound, *pprev = NULL;
00193 
00194    if (size == 0)
00195       return NULL;
00196 
00197    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00198    size = ALIGN8(size);
00199 
00200    /* search for free block */
00201    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00202 
00203    while (pfree->size < size && pfree->next_free) {
00204       pprev = pfree;
00205       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00206    }
00207 
00208    /* return if not enough memory */
00209    if (pfree->size < size)
00210       return 0;
00211 
00212    pfound = pfree;
00213 
00214    /* if found block is first in list, correct pheader */
00215    if (pfree == (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data)) {
00216       if (size < pfree->size) {
00217          /* free block is only used partially */
00218          pheader->first_free_data += size;
00219          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00220 
00221          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00222          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00223       } else {
00224          /* free block is used totally */
00225          pheader->first_free_data = pfree->next_free;
00226       }
00227    } else {
00228       /* check if free block is used totally */
00229       if (pfound->size - size < (int) sizeof(FREE_DESCRIP)) {
00230          /* skip block totally */
00231          pprev->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00232       } else {
00233          /* decrease free block */
00234          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pfound + size);
00235 
00236          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00237          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00238 
00239          pprev->next_free = (POINTER_T) pfree - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00240       }
00241    }
00242 
00243    /* zero memeory */
00244    memset(pfound, 0, size);
00245 
00246    return pfound;
00247 }
00248 
00249 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00250 void free_data(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, void *address, INT size)
00251 {
00252    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pprev, *pnext;
00253 
00254    if (size == 0)
00255       return;
00256 
00257    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00258    size = ALIGN8(size);
00259 
00260    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) address;
00261    pprev = NULL;
00262 
00263    /* clear current block */
00264    memset(address, 0, size);
00265 
00266    /* if data comes before first free block, adjust pheader */
00267    if ((POINTER_T) address - (POINTER_T) pheader < pheader->first_free_data) {
00268       pfree->size = size;
00269       pfree->next_free = pheader->first_free_data;
00270       pheader->first_free_data = (POINTER_T) address - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00271    } else {
00272       /* find last free block before current block */
00273       pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00274 
00275       while (pprev->next_free < (POINTER_T) address - (POINTER_T) pheader) {
00276          if (pprev->next_free <= 0) {
00277             cm_msg(MERROR, "free_data",
00278                    "database is corrupted: pprev=0x%x, pprev->next_free=%d", pprev, pprev->next_free);
00279             return;
00280          }
00281 
00282          pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pprev->next_free);
00283       }
00284 
00285       pfree->size = size;
00286       pfree->next_free = pprev->next_free;
00287 
00288       pprev->next_free = (POINTER_T) pfree - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00289    }
00290 
00291    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks after current block */
00292    pnext = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00293    if ((POINTER_T) pnext == (POINTER_T) pfree + pfree->size) {
00294       pfree->size += pnext->size;
00295       pfree->next_free = pnext->next_free;
00296 
00297       memset(pnext, 0, pnext->size);
00298    }
00299 
00300    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks before current block */
00301    if (pprev && pprev->next_free == (POINTER_T) pprev - (POINTER_T) pheader + pprev->size) {
00302       pprev->size += pfree->size;
00303       pprev->next_free = pfree->next_free;
00304 
00305       memset(pfree, 0, pfree->size);
00306    }
00307 }
00308 
00309 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00310 void *realloc_data(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, void *address, INT old_size, INT new_size)
00311 {
00312    void *tmp = NULL, *pnew;
00313 
00314    if (old_size) {
00315       tmp = malloc(old_size);
00316       if (tmp == NULL)
00317          return NULL;
00318 
00319       memcpy(tmp, address, old_size);
00320       free_data(pheader, address, old_size);
00321    }
00322 
00323    pnew = malloc_data(pheader, new_size);
00324 
00325    if (pnew && old_size)
00326       memcpy(pnew, tmp, old_size < new_size ? old_size : new_size);
00327 
00328    if (old_size)
00329       free(tmp);
00330 
00331    return pnew;
00332 }
00333 
00334 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00335 char *strcomb(const char **list)
00336 /* convert list of strings into single string to be used by db_paste() */
00337 {
00338    INT i, j;
00339    static char *str = NULL;
00340 
00341    /* counter number of chars */
00342    for (i = 0, j = 0; list[i]; i++)
00343       j += strlen(list[i]) + 1;
00344    j += 1;
00345 
00346    if (str == NULL)
00347       str = (char *) malloc(j);
00348    else
00349       str = (char *) realloc(str, j);
00350 
00351    str[0] = 0;
00352    for (i = 0; list[i]; i++) {
00353       strcat(str, list[i]);
00354       strcat(str, "\n");
00355    }
00356 
00357    return str;
00358 }
00359 
00360 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00361 INT print_key_info(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * pkey, INT level, void *info)
00362 {
00363    int i;
00364    char *p;
00365 
00366    i = hDB;
00367    p = (char *) info;
00368 
00369    sprintf(p + strlen(p), "%08X  %08X  %04X    ",
00370            (int) (hKey - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)),
00371            (int) (pkey->data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)), (int) pkey->total_size);
00372 
00373    for (i = 0; i < level; i++)
00374       sprintf(p + strlen(p), "  ");
00375 
00376    sprintf(p + strlen(p), "%s\n", pkey->name);
00377 
00378    return SUCCESS;
00379 }
00380 
00381 INT db_show_mem(HNDLE hDB, char *result, INT buf_size, BOOL verbose)
00382 {
00383    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
00384    INT total_size_key, total_size_data;
00385    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree;
00386 
00387    /* avoid compiler warning */
00388    total_size_data = buf_size;
00389 
00390    db_lock_database(hDB);
00391 
00392    pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
00393 
00394    result[0] = 0;
00395    sprintf(result + strlen(result), "Database header size is 0x%04X, all following values are offset by this!\n", (int)sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00396    sprintf(result + strlen(result), "Key area  0x00000000 - 0x%08X, size %d bytes\n",  pheader->key_size - 1, pheader->key_size);
00397    sprintf(result + strlen(result), "Data area 0x%08X - 0x%08X, size %d bytes\n\n",    pheader->key_size, pheader->key_size + pheader->data_size, pheader->data_size);
00398 
00399    strcat(result, "Keylist:\n");
00400    strcat(result, "--------\n");
00401    total_size_key = 0;
00402    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00403 
00404    while ((POINTER_T) pfree != (POINTER_T) pheader) {
00405       total_size_key += pfree->size;
00406       sprintf(result + strlen(result),
00407               "Free block at 0x%08X, size 0x%08X, next 0x%08X\n",
00408               (int) ((POINTER_T) pfree - (POINTER_T) pheader - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)),
00409               pfree->size, pfree->next_free ? (int) (pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) : 0);
00410       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00411    }
00412 
00413    sprintf(result + strlen(result), "\nFree Key area: %d bytes out of %d bytes\n", total_size_key, pheader->key_size);
00414 
00415    strcat(result, "\nData:\n");
00416    strcat(result, "-----\n");
00417    total_size_data = 0;
00418    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00419 
00420    while ((POINTER_T) pfree != (POINTER_T) pheader) {
00421       total_size_data += pfree->size;
00422       sprintf(result + strlen(result),
00423               "Free block at 0x%08X, size 0x%08X, next 0x%08X\n",
00424               (int) ((POINTER_T) pfree - (POINTER_T) pheader - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)),
00425               pfree->size, pfree->next_free ? (int) (pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) : 0);
00426       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00427    }
00428 
00429    sprintf(result + strlen(result), "\nFree Data area: %d bytes out of %d bytes\n", total_size_data, pheader->data_size);
00430 
00431    sprintf(result + strlen(result),
00432            "\nFree: %1d (%1.1lf%%) keylist, %1d (%1.1lf%%) data\n",
00433            total_size_key,
00434            100 * (double) total_size_key / pheader->key_size,
00435            total_size_data, 100 * (double) total_size_data / pheader->data_size);
00436 
00437    if (verbose) {
00438       sprintf(result + strlen(result), "\n\n");
00439       sprintf(result + strlen(result), "Key       Data      Size\n");
00440       sprintf(result + strlen(result), "------------------------\n");
00441       db_scan_tree(hDB, pheader->root_key, 0, print_key_info, result);
00442    }
00443 
00444    db_unlock_database(hDB);
00445 
00446    return DB_SUCCESS;
00447 }
00448 
00449 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00450 static int db_validate_key_offset(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, int offset)
00451 /* check if key offset lies in valid range */
00452 {
00453    if (offset != 0 && offset < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER))
00454       return 0;
00455 
00456    if (offset > (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + pheader->key_size)
00457       return 0;
00458 
00459    return 1;
00460 }
00461 
00462 static int db_validate_data_offset(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, int offset)
00463 /* check if data offset lies in valid range */
00464 {
00465    if (offset != 0 && offset < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER))
00466       return 0;
00467 
00468    if (offset > (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + pheader->key_size + pheader->data_size)
00469       return 0;
00470 
00471    return 1;
00472 }
00473 
00474 static int db_validate_hkey(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, HNDLE hKey)
00475 {
00476    return db_validate_key_offset(pheader, hKey);
00477 }
00478 
00479 static int db_validate_key(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, int recurse, const char *path, KEY * pkey)
00480 {
00481    KEYLIST *pkeylist;
00482    int i;
00483    static time_t t_min = 0, t_max;
00484 
00485    if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader)) {
00486       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00487              "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", data 0x%08X", path, pkey->data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00488       return 0;
00489    }
00490 
00491    if (!db_validate_data_offset(pheader, pkey->data)) {
00492       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00493              "Warning: database corruption, data \"%s\", data 0x%08X", path, pkey->data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00494       return 0;
00495    }
00496 #if 0
00497    /* correct invalid key type 0 */
00498    if (pkey->type == 0) {
00499       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00500              "Warning: invalid key type, key \"%s\", type %d, changed to type %d", path, pkey->type, TID_KEY);
00501       pkey->type = TID_KEY;
00502    }
00503 #endif
00504 
00505    /* check key type */
00506    if (pkey->type <= 0 || pkey->type >= TID_LAST) {
00507       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key", "Warning: invalid key type, key \"%s\", type %d", path, pkey->type);
00508       return 0;
00509    }
00510 
00511    /* check key sizes */
00512    if ((pkey->total_size < 0) || (pkey->total_size > pheader->key_size)) {
00513       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key", "Warning: invalid key \"%s\" total_size: %d", path, pkey->total_size);
00514       return 0;
00515    }
00516 
00517    if ((pkey->item_size < 0) || (pkey->item_size > pheader->key_size)) {
00518       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key", "Warning: invalid key \"%s\" item_size: %d", path, pkey->item_size);
00519       return 0;
00520    }
00521 
00522    if ((pkey->num_values < 0) || (pkey->num_values > pheader->key_size)) {
00523       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key", "Warning: invalid key \"%s\" num_values: %d", path, pkey->num_values);
00524       return 0;
00525    }
00526 
00527    /* check and correct key size */
00528    if (pkey->total_size != pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values) {
00529       cm_msg(MINFO, "db_validate_key",
00530              "Warning: corrected key \"%s\" size: total_size=%d, should be %d*%d=%d",
00531              path, pkey->total_size, pkey->item_size, pkey->num_values, pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values);
00532       pkey->total_size = pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values;
00533    }
00534 
00535    /* check access mode */
00536    if ((pkey->access_mode & ~(MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE | MODE_EXCLUSIVE | MODE_ALLOC))) {
00537       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key", "Warning: invalid access mode, key \"%s\", mode %d", path, pkey->access_mode);
00538       return 0;
00539    }
00540 
00541    /* check access time, consider valid if within +- 10 years */
00542    if (t_min == 0) {
00543       t_min = ss_time() - 3600 * 24 * 365 * 10;
00544       t_max = ss_time() + 3600 * 24 * 365 * 10;
00545    }
00546 
00547    if (pkey->last_written > 0 && (pkey->last_written < t_min || pkey->last_written > t_max)) {
00548       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key", "Warning: invalid access time, key \"%s\", time %d", path, pkey->last_written);
00549       return 0;
00550    }
00551 
00552    if (pkey->type == TID_KEY && recurse) {
00553       /* if key has subkeys, go through whole list */
00554 
00555       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
00556 
00557       if (pkeylist->num_keys != 0 &&
00558           (pkeylist->first_key == 0 || !db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkeylist->first_key))) {
00559          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00560                 "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", first_key 0x%08X",
00561                 path, pkeylist->first_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00562          return 0;
00563       }
00564 
00565       /* check if key is in keylist */
00566       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
00567 
00568       for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
00569          char buf[1024];
00570          sprintf(buf, "%s/%s", path, pkey->name);
00571 
00572          if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
00573             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00574                    "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
00575                    buf, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00576             return 0;
00577          }
00578 
00579          if (!db_validate_key(pheader, recurse + 1, buf, pkey))
00580             return 0;
00581 
00582          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
00583       }
00584    }
00585 
00586    return 1;
00587 }
00588 
00589 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00590 static void db_validate_sizes()
00591 {
00592    /* validate size of data structures (miscompiled, 32/64 bit mismatch, etc */
00593 
00594    if (0) {
00595 #define S(x) printf("assert(sizeof(%-20s) == %6d);\n", #x, (int)sizeof(x))
00596       // basic data types
00597       S(char *);
00598       S(char);
00599       S(int);
00600       S(long int);
00601       S(float);
00602       S(double);
00603       S(BOOL);
00604       S(WORD);
00605       S(DWORD);
00606       S(INT);
00607       S(POINTER_T);
00608       S(midas_thread_t);
00609       // data buffers
00610       S(EVENT_REQUEST);
00611       S(BUFFER_CLIENT);
00612       S(BUFFER_HEADER);
00613       // history files
00614       S(HIST_RECORD);
00615       S(DEF_RECORD);
00616       S(INDEX_RECORD);
00617       S(TAG);
00618       // ODB shared memory structures
00619       S(KEY);
00620       S(KEYLIST);
00621       S(OPEN_RECORD);
00622       S(DATABASE_CLIENT);
00623       S(DATABASE_HEADER);
00624       // misc structures
00625       S(EVENT_HEADER);
00626       S(EQUIPMENT_INFO);
00627       S(EQUIPMENT_STATS);
00628       S(BANK_HEADER);
00629       S(BANK);
00630       S(BANK32);
00631       S(ANA_OUTPUT_INFO);
00632       S(PROGRAM_INFO);
00633       S(ALARM_CLASS);
00634       S(ALARM);
00635       S(CHN_SETTINGS);
00636       S(CHN_STATISTICS);
00637 #undef S
00638    }
00639 #ifdef OS_LINUX
00640    assert(sizeof(EVENT_REQUEST) == 16); // ODB v3
00641    assert(sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT) == 256);
00642    assert(sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) == 16444);
00643    assert(sizeof(HIST_RECORD) == 20);
00644    assert(sizeof(DEF_RECORD) == 40);
00645    assert(sizeof(INDEX_RECORD) == 12);
00646    assert(sizeof(TAG) == 40);
00647    assert(sizeof(KEY) == 68);
00648    assert(sizeof(KEYLIST) == 12);
00649    assert(sizeof(OPEN_RECORD) == 8);
00650    assert(sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT) == 2112);
00651    assert(sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) == 135232);
00652    assert(sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) == 16);
00653    //assert(sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO) == 400); // ODB v3, midas.h before rev 4558
00654    assert(sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO) == 688); // ODB v3, midas.h after rev 4558
00655    assert(sizeof(EQUIPMENT_STATS) == 24);
00656    assert(sizeof(BANK_HEADER) == 8);
00657    assert(sizeof(BANK) == 8);
00658    assert(sizeof(BANK32) == 12);
00659    assert(sizeof(ANA_OUTPUT_INFO) == 792);
00660    assert(sizeof(PROGRAM_INFO) == 316);
00661    assert(sizeof(ALARM_CLASS) == 348);
00662    assert(sizeof(ALARM) == 452);
00663    assert(sizeof(CHN_SETTINGS) == 648); // ODB v3
00664    assert(sizeof(CHN_STATISTICS) == 56);        // ODB v3
00665 #endif
00666 }
00667 
00668 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00669 static int db_validate_db(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader)
00670 {
00671    int total_size_key = 0;
00672    int total_size_data = 0;
00673    double ratio;
00674    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree;
00675 
00676    /* validate size of data structures (miscompiled, 32/64 bit mismatch, etc */
00677 
00678    db_validate_sizes();
00679 
00680    /* validate the key free list */
00681 
00682    if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pheader->first_free_key)) {
00683       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00684              "Warning: database corruption, first_free_key 0x%08X", pheader->first_free_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00685       return 0;
00686    }
00687 
00688    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00689 
00690    while ((POINTER_T) pfree != (POINTER_T) pheader) {
00691       FREE_DESCRIP *nextpfree;
00692 
00693       if (pfree->next_free != 0 && !db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pfree->next_free)) {
00694          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00695                 "Warning: database corruption, key area next_free 0x%08X", pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00696          return 0;
00697       }
00698 
00699       total_size_key += pfree->size;
00700       nextpfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00701 
00702       if (pfree->next_free != 0 && nextpfree == pfree) {
00703          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00704                 "Warning: database corruption, key area next_free 0x%08X is same as current free",
00705                 pfree - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00706          return 0;
00707       }
00708 
00709       pfree = nextpfree;
00710    }
00711 
00712    ratio = ((double) (pheader->key_size - total_size_key)) / ((double) pheader->key_size);
00713    if (ratio > 0.9)
00714       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db", "Warning: database key area is %.0f%% full", ratio * 100.0);
00715 
00716    if (total_size_key > pheader->key_size) {
00717       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db", "Warning: database corruption, total_key_size 0x%08X", total_size_key);
00718       return 0;
00719    }
00720 
00721    /* validate the data free list */
00722 
00723    if (!db_validate_data_offset(pheader, pheader->first_free_data)) {
00724       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00725              "Warning: database corruption, first_free_data 0x%08X",
00726              pheader->first_free_data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00727       return 0;
00728    }
00729 
00730    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00731 
00732    while ((POINTER_T) pfree != (POINTER_T) pheader) {
00733       FREE_DESCRIP *nextpfree;
00734 
00735       if (pfree->next_free != 0 && !db_validate_data_offset(pheader, pfree->next_free)) {
00736          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00737                 "Warning: database corruption, data area next_free 0x%08X", pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00738          return 0;
00739       }
00740 
00741       total_size_data += pfree->size;
00742       nextpfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00743 
00744       if (pfree->next_free != 0 && nextpfree == pfree) {
00745          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00746                 "Warning: database corruption, data area next_free 0x%08X is same as current free",
00747                 pfree - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00748          return 0;
00749       }
00750 
00751       pfree = nextpfree;
00752    }
00753 
00754    ratio = ((double) (pheader->data_size - total_size_data)) / ((double) pheader->data_size);
00755    if (ratio > 0.9)
00756       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db", "Warning: database data area is %.0f%% full", ratio * 100.0);
00757 
00758    if (total_size_data > pheader->data_size) {
00759       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db", "Warning: database corruption, total_size_data 0x%08X", total_size_key);
00760       return 0;
00761    }
00762 
00763    /* validate the tree of keys, starting from the root key */
00764 
00765    if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pheader->root_key)) {
00766       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00767              "Warning: database corruption, root_key 0x%08X", pheader->root_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00768       return 0;
00769    }
00770 
00771    return db_validate_key(pheader, 1, "", (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->root_key));
00772 }
00773 
00774 /**dox***************************************************************/
00775 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00776 
00777 /********************************************************************/
00778 /**
00779 Open an online database
00780 @param database_name     Database name.
00781 @param database_size     Initial size of database if not existing
00782 @param client_name       Name of this application
00783 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
00784 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_CREATED, DB_INVALID_NAME, DB_NO_MEMORY, 
00785         DB_MEMSIZE_MISMATCH, DB_NO_SEMAPHORE, DB_INVALID_PARAM,
00786         RPC_NET_ERROR
00787 */
00788 INT db_open_database(const char *xdatabase_name, INT database_size, HNDLE * hDB, const char *client_name)
00789 {
00790    if (rpc_is_remote())
00791       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_OPEN_DATABASE, xdatabase_name, database_size, hDB, client_name);
00792 
00793 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
00794    {
00795       INT i, status;
00796       HNDLE handle;
00797       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
00798       BOOL shm_created;
00799       HNDLE shm_handle;
00800       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
00801       KEY *pkey;
00802       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
00803       FREE_DESCRIP *pfree;
00804       BOOL call_watchdog;
00805       DWORD timeout;
00806       char database_name[NAME_LENGTH];
00807       void *p;
00808 
00809       /* restrict name length */
00810       strlcpy(database_name, xdatabase_name, NAME_LENGTH);
00811 
00812       if (database_size < 0 || database_size > 10E7) {
00813          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "invalid database size");
00814          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
00815       }
00816 
00817       if (strlen(client_name) >= NAME_LENGTH) {
00818          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "client name \'%s\' is longer than %d characters", client_name, NAME_LENGTH-1);
00819          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
00820       }
00821 
00822       if (strchr(client_name, '/') != NULL) {
00823          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "client name \'%s\' should not contain the slash \'/\' character", client_name);
00824          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
00825       }
00826 
00827       /* allocate new space for the new database descriptor */
00828       if (_database_entries == 0) {
00829          _database = (DATABASE *) malloc(sizeof(DATABASE));
00830          memset(_database, 0, sizeof(DATABASE));
00831          if (_database == NULL) {
00832             *hDB = 0;
00833             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
00834          }
00835 
00836          _database_entries = 1;
00837          i = 0;
00838       } else {
00839          /* check if database already open */
00840          for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
00841             if (_database[i].attached && equal_ustring(_database[i].name, database_name)) {
00842                /* check if database belongs to this thread */
00843                if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_MTHREAD) {
00844                   if (_database[i].index == ss_gettid()) {
00845                      *hDB = i + 1;
00846                      return DB_SUCCESS;
00847                   }
00848                } else {
00849                   *hDB = i + 1;
00850                   return DB_SUCCESS;
00851                }
00852             }
00853 
00854          /* check for a deleted entry */
00855          for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
00856             if (!_database[i].attached)
00857                break;
00858 
00859          /* if not found, create new one */
00860          if (i == _database_entries) {
00861             _database = (DATABASE *) realloc(_database, sizeof(DATABASE) * (_database_entries + 1));
00862             memset(&_database[_database_entries], 0, sizeof(DATABASE));
00863 
00864             _database_entries++;
00865             if (_database == NULL) {
00866                _database_entries--;
00867                *hDB = 0;
00868                return DB_NO_MEMORY;
00869             }
00870          }
00871       }
00872 
00873       handle = (HNDLE) i;
00874 
00875       /* open shared memory region */
00876       status = ss_shm_open(database_name,
00877                            sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * ALIGN8(database_size / 2), &p, &shm_handle, TRUE);
00878 
00879       _database[(INT) handle].database_header = (DATABASE_HEADER *) p;
00880       if (status == SS_NO_MEMORY || status == SS_FILE_ERROR) {
00881          *hDB = 0;
00882          return DB_INVALID_NAME;
00883       }
00884 
00885       /* shortcut to header */
00886       pheader = _database[handle].database_header;
00887 
00888       /* save name */
00889       strcpy(_database[handle].name, database_name);
00890 
00891       shm_created = (status == SS_CREATED);
00892 
00893       /* clear memeory for debugging */
00894       /* memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2*ALIGN8(database_size/2)); */
00895 
00896       if (shm_created && pheader->name[0] == 0) {
00897          /* setup header info if database was created */
00898          memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * ALIGN8(database_size / 2));
00899 
00900          strcpy(pheader->name, database_name);
00901          pheader->version = DATABASE_VERSION;
00902          pheader->key_size = ALIGN8(database_size / 2);
00903          pheader->data_size = ALIGN8(database_size / 2);
00904          pheader->root_key = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER);
00905          pheader->first_free_key = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER);
00906          pheader->first_free_data = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + pheader->key_size;
00907 
00908          /* set up free list */
00909          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00910          pfree->size = pheader->key_size;
00911          pfree->next_free = 0;
00912 
00913          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00914          pfree->size = pheader->data_size;
00915          pfree->next_free = 0;
00916 
00917          /* create root key */
00918          pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
00919 
00920          /* set key properties */
00921          pkey->type = TID_KEY;
00922          pkey->num_values = 1;
00923          pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
00924          strcpy(pkey->name, "root");
00925          pkey->parent_keylist = 0;
00926 
00927          /* create keylist */
00928          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEYLIST));
00929 
00930          /* store keylist in data field */
00931          pkey->data = (POINTER_T) pkeylist - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00932          pkey->item_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
00933          pkey->total_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
00934 
00935          pkeylist->parent = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
00936          pkeylist->num_keys = 0;
00937          pkeylist->first_key = 0;
00938       }
00939 
00940       /* check database version */
00941       if (pheader->version != DATABASE_VERSION) {
00942          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database",
00943                 "Different database format: Shared memory is %d, program is %d", pheader->version, DATABASE_VERSION);
00944          return DB_VERSION_MISMATCH;
00945       }
00946 
00947       /* create semaphore for the database */
00948       status = ss_semaphore_create(database_name, &(_database[handle].semaphore));
00949       if (status != SS_SUCCESS && status != SS_CREATED) {
00950          *hDB = 0;
00951          return DB_NO_SEMAPHORE;
00952       }
00953       _database[handle].lock_cnt = 0;
00954 
00955       /* first lock database */
00956       status = db_lock_database(handle + 1);
00957       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
00958          return status;
00959 
00960       /*
00961          Now we have a DATABASE_HEADER, so let's setup a CLIENT
00962          structure in that database. The information there can also
00963          be seen by other processes.
00964        */
00965 
00966       /*
00967          update the client count
00968        */
00969       pheader->num_clients = 0;
00970       pheader->max_client_index = 0;
00971       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
00972          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
00973             continue;
00974          pheader->num_clients++;
00975          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
00976       }
00977 
00978       /*fprintf(stderr,"num_clients: %d, max_client: %d\n",pheader->num_clients,pheader->max_client_index); */
00979 
00980       /* remove dead clients */
00981 
00982 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00983 #ifdef ESRCH
00984       /* Only enable this for systems that define ESRCH and hope that
00985          they also support kill(pid,0) */
00986       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
00987          int k;
00988 
00989          errno = 0;
00990          kill(pheader->client[i].pid, 0);
00991          if (errno == ESRCH) {
00992            char client_name_tmp[NAME_LENGTH];
00993            int client_pid;
00994 
00995            strlcpy(client_name_tmp, pheader->client[i].name, sizeof(client_name_tmp));
00996            client_pid = pheader->client[i].pid;
00997 
00998             /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
00999             for (k = 0; k < pheader->client[i].max_index; k++)
01000                if (pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle) {
01001                   pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle);
01002                   if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
01003                      pkey->notify_count--;
01004 
01005                   if (pheader->client[i].open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
01006                      db_set_mode(handle + 1, pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle,
01007                                  (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
01008                }
01009 
01010             /* clear entry from client structure in database header */
01011             memset(&(pheader->client[i]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01012 
01013             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "Removed ODB client \'%s\', index %d because process pid %d does not exists", client_name_tmp, i, client_pid);
01014          }
01015       }
01016 #endif
01017 #endif
01018 
01019       /*
01020          Look for empty client slot
01021        */
01022       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++)
01023          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
01024             break;
01025 
01026       if (i == MAX_CLIENTS) {
01027          db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01028          *hDB = 0;
01029          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "maximum number of clients exceeded");
01030          return DB_NO_SLOT;
01031       }
01032 
01033       /* store slot index in _database structure */
01034       _database[handle].client_index = i;
01035 
01036       /*
01037          Save the index of the last client of that database so that later only
01038          the clients 0..max_client_index-1 have to be searched through.
01039        */
01040       pheader->num_clients++;
01041       if (i + 1 > pheader->max_client_index)
01042          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01043 
01044       /* setup database header and client structure */
01045       pclient = &pheader->client[i];
01046 
01047       memset(pclient, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01048       /* use client name previously set by bm_set_name */
01049       strlcpy(pclient->name, client_name, sizeof(pclient->name));
01050       pclient->pid = ss_getpid();
01051       pclient->num_open_records = 0;
01052 
01053       ss_suspend_get_port(&pclient->port);
01054 
01055       pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
01056 
01057       cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, &timeout);
01058       pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
01059 
01060       /* check ODB for corruption */
01061       if (!db_validate_db(pheader)) {
01062          /* do not treat corrupted odb as a fatal error- allow the user
01063             to preceed at own risk- the database is already corrupted,
01064             so no further harm can possibly be made. */
01065          /*
01066             db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01067             *hDB = 0;
01068             return DB_CORRUPTED;
01069           */
01070       }
01071 
01072       /* setup _database entry */
01073       _database[handle].database_data = _database[handle].database_header + 1;
01074       _database[handle].attached = TRUE;
01075       _database[handle].shm_handle = shm_handle;
01076       _database[handle].protect = FALSE;
01077 
01078       /* remember to which connection acutal buffer belongs */
01079       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE)
01080          _database[handle].index = rpc_get_server_acception();
01081       else
01082          _database[handle].index = ss_gettid();
01083 
01084       *hDB = (handle + 1);
01085 
01086       /* setup dispatcher for updated records */
01087       ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_IPC, 0, (int (*)(void)) cm_dispatch_ipc);
01088 
01089       db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01090 
01091       if (shm_created)
01092          return DB_CREATED;
01093    }
01094 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01095 
01096    return DB_SUCCESS;
01097 }
01098 
01099 /********************************************************************/
01100 /**
01101 Close a database
01102 @param   hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
01103 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, RPC_NET_ERROR 
01104 */
01105 INT db_close_database(HNDLE hDB)
01106 {
01107    if (rpc_is_remote())
01108       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CLOSE_DATABASE, hDB);
01109 
01110 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01111    else {
01112       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01113       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01114       INT idx, destroy_flag, i, j;
01115 
01116       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01117          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01118          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01119       }
01120 
01121       /*
01122          Check if database was opened by current thread. This is necessary
01123          in the server process where one thread may not close the database
01124          of other threads.
01125        */
01126 
01127       /* first lock database */
01128       db_lock_database(hDB);
01129 
01130       idx = _database[hDB - 1].client_index;
01131       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01132       pclient = &pheader->client[idx];
01133 
01134       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
01135           _database[hDB - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
01136          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01137          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01138       }
01139 
01140       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE && _database[hDB - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
01141          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01142          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01143       }
01144 
01145       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01146          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01147          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01148          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01149       }
01150 
01151       /* close all open records */
01152       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_index; i++)
01153          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle)
01154             db_remove_open_record(hDB, pclient->open_record[i].handle, FALSE);
01155 
01156       /* mark entry in _database as empty */
01157       _database[hDB - 1].attached = FALSE;
01158 
01159       /* clear entry from client structure in database header */
01160       memset(&(pheader->client[idx]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01161 
01162       /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
01163       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; i >= 0; i--)
01164          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
01165             break;
01166       pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01167 
01168       /* count new number of clients */
01169       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, j = 0; i >= 0; i--)
01170          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
01171             j++;
01172       pheader->num_clients = j;
01173 
01174       destroy_flag = (pheader->num_clients == 0);
01175 
01176       /* flush shared memory to disk */
01177       ss_shm_flush(pheader->name, pheader, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * pheader->data_size, _database[hDB - 1].shm_handle);
01178 
01179       /* unmap shared memory, delete it if we are the last */
01180       ss_shm_close(pheader->name, pheader, _database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, destroy_flag);
01181 
01182       /* unlock database */
01183       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01184 
01185       /* delete semaphore */
01186       ss_semaphore_delete(_database[hDB - 1].semaphore, destroy_flag);
01187 
01188       /* update _database_entries */
01189       if (hDB == _database_entries)
01190          _database_entries--;
01191 
01192       if (_database_entries > 0)
01193          _database = (DATABASE *) realloc(_database, sizeof(DATABASE) * (_database_entries));
01194       else {
01195          free(_database);
01196          _database = NULL;
01197       }
01198 
01199       /* if we are the last one, also delete other semaphores */
01200       if (destroy_flag) {
01201          extern INT _semaphore_elog, _semaphore_alarm, _semaphore_history, _semaphore_msg;
01202 
01203          if (_semaphore_elog)
01204             ss_semaphore_delete(_semaphore_elog, TRUE);
01205          if (_semaphore_alarm)
01206             ss_semaphore_delete(_semaphore_alarm, TRUE);
01207          if (_semaphore_history)
01208             ss_semaphore_delete(_semaphore_history, TRUE);
01209          if (_semaphore_msg)
01210             ss_semaphore_delete(_semaphore_msg, TRUE);
01211       }
01212 
01213    }
01214 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01215 
01216    return DB_SUCCESS;
01217 }
01218 
01219 /**dox***************************************************************/
01220 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01221 
01222 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01223 INT db_flush_database(HNDLE hDB)
01224 /********************************************************************\
01225 
01226   Routine: db_flush_database
01227 
01228   Purpose: Flushes the shared memory of a database to its disk file.
01229 
01230   Input:
01231     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database, which is used as
01232                             an index to the _database array.
01233 
01234   Output:
01235     none
01236 
01237   Function value:
01238     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01239     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
01240     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
01241 
01242 \********************************************************************/
01243 {
01244    if (rpc_is_remote())
01245       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FLUSH_DATABASE, hDB);
01246 
01247 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01248    else {
01249       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01250       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01251       INT idx;
01252 
01253       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01254          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01255          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01256       }
01257 
01258       /*
01259          Check if database was opened by current thread. This is necessary
01260          in the server process where one thread may not close the database
01261          of other threads.
01262        */
01263 
01264       db_lock_database(hDB);
01265       idx = _database[hDB - 1].client_index;
01266       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01267       pclient = &pheader->client[idx];
01268 
01269       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
01270           _database[hDB - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
01271          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01272          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01273       }
01274 
01275       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE && _database[hDB - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
01276          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01277          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01278       }
01279 
01280       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01281          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01282          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01283          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01284       }
01285 
01286       /* flush shared memory to disk */
01287       ss_shm_flush(pheader->name, pheader, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * pheader->data_size, _database[hDB - 1].shm_handle);
01288       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01289 
01290    }
01291 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01292 
01293    return DB_SUCCESS;
01294 }
01295 
01296 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01297 INT db_close_all_databases(void)
01298 /********************************************************************\
01299 
01300   Routine: db_close_all_databases
01301 
01302   Purpose: Close all open databases and open records
01303 
01304   Input:
01305     none
01306 
01307   Output:
01308     none
01309 
01310   Function value:
01311     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01312 
01313 \********************************************************************/
01314 {
01315    INT status;
01316 
01317    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
01318       status = rpc_call(RPC_DB_CLOSE_ALL_DATABASES);
01319       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01320          return status;
01321    }
01322 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01323    {
01324       INT i;
01325 
01326       for (i = _database_entries; i > 0; i--)
01327          db_close_database(i);
01328    }
01329 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01330 
01331    return db_close_all_records();
01332 }
01333 
01334 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01335 INT db_set_client_name(HNDLE hDB, const char *client_name)
01336 /********************************************************************\
01337 
01338   Routine: db_set_client_name
01339 
01340   Purpose: Set client name for a database. Used by cm_connect_experiment
01341            if a client name is duplicate and changed.
01342 
01343   Input:
01344     INT  hDB                Handle to database
01345     char *client_name       Name of this application
01346 
01347   Output:
01348 
01349   Function value:
01350     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01351     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
01352 
01353 \********************************************************************/
01354 {
01355    if (rpc_is_remote())
01356       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_CLIENT_NAME, hDB, client_name);
01357 
01358 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01359    {
01360       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01361       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01362       INT idx;
01363 
01364       idx = _database[hDB - 1].client_index;
01365       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01366       pclient = &pheader->client[idx];
01367 
01368       strcpy(pclient->name, client_name);
01369    }
01370 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01371 
01372    return DB_SUCCESS;
01373 }
01374 
01375 /**dox***************************************************************/
01376 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01377 
01378 /********************************************************************/
01379 /**
01380 Lock a database for exclusive access via system semaphore calls.
01381 @param hDB   Handle to the database to lock
01382 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TIMEOUT
01383 */
01384 
01385 /* Define CHECK_THREAD_ID to enable thread checking. This ensures that
01386    only the main thread does the locking/unlocking of the ODB. In multi-thread
01387    applications (slow control front-end for example), unexpected behaviour can
01388    occur if several threads lock/unlock the ODB at the same time, since the midas
01389    API is not thread safe. */
01390 #ifdef CHECK_THREAD_ID
01391 static int _lock_tid = 0;
01392 #endif
01393 
01394 INT db_lock_database(HNDLE hDB)
01395 {
01396 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01397    int status;
01398    void *p;
01399 
01400 #ifdef CHECK_THREAD_ID
01401    if (_lock_tid == 0)
01402       _lock_tid = ss_gettid();
01403 
01404    assert(_lock_tid == ss_gettid());
01405 #endif
01406 
01407    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01408       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "invalid database handle, aborting...");
01409       abort();
01410       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01411    }
01412 
01413    if (_database[hDB - 1].protect && _database[hDB - 1].database_header != NULL) {
01414       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "internal error: DB already locked, aborting...");
01415       abort();
01416       return DB_NO_SEMAPHORE;
01417    }
01418 
01419    _database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt++;
01420 
01421    if (_database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt == 1) {
01422       /* wait max. 5 minutes for semaphore (required if locking process is being debugged) */
01423       status = ss_semaphore_wait_for(_database[hDB - 1].semaphore, 5 * 60 * 1000);
01424       if (status == SS_TIMEOUT) {
01425          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "timeout obtaining lock for database, exiting...");
01426          exit(1);
01427          return DB_TIMEOUT;
01428       }
01429       if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
01430          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "cannot lock database, ss_semaphore_wait_for() status %d, aborting...", status);
01431          abort();
01432          return DB_NO_SEMAPHORE;
01433       }
01434    }
01435 
01436 #ifdef CHECK_LOCK_COUNT
01437    {
01438       char str[256];
01439 
01440       sprintf(str, "db_lock_database, lock_cnt=%d", _database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt);
01441       ss_stack_history_entry(str);
01442    }
01443 #endif
01444 
01445    if (_database[hDB - 1].protect) {
01446       if (_database[hDB - 1].database_header == NULL) {
01447          ss_shm_unprotect(_database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, &p);
01448          _database[hDB - 1].database_header = (DATABASE_HEADER *) p;
01449       }
01450    }
01451 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01452    return DB_SUCCESS;
01453 }
01454 
01455 /********************************************************************/
01456 /**
01457 Unlock a database via system semaphore calls.
01458 @param hDB   Handle to the database to unlock
01459 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
01460 */
01461 INT db_unlock_database(HNDLE hDB)
01462 {
01463 
01464 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01465 
01466 #ifdef CHECK_THREAD_ID
01467    if (_lock_tid == 0)
01468       _lock_tid = ss_gettid();
01469 
01470    assert(_lock_tid == ss_gettid());
01471 #endif
01472 
01473    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01474       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_unlock_database", "invalid database handle");
01475       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01476    }
01477 #ifdef CHECK_LOCK_COUNT
01478    {
01479       char str[256];
01480 
01481       sprintf(str, "db_unlock_database, lock_cnt=%d", _database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt);
01482       ss_stack_history_entry(str);
01483    }
01484 #endif
01485 
01486    if (_database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt == 1)
01487       ss_semaphore_release(_database[hDB - 1].semaphore);
01488 
01489    if (_database[hDB - 1].protect) {
01490       ss_shm_protect(_database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, _database[hDB - 1].database_header);
01491       _database[hDB - 1].database_header = NULL;
01492    }
01493 
01494    assert(_database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt > 0);
01495    _database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt--;
01496 
01497 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01498    return DB_SUCCESS;
01499 }
01500 
01501 /********************************************************************/
01502 
01503 INT db_get_lock_cnt(HNDLE hDB)
01504 {
01505 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01506 
01507    /* return zero if no ODB is open or we run remotely */
01508    if (_database_entries == 0)
01509       return 0;
01510 
01511    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01512       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "invalid database handle, aborting...");
01513       abort();
01514       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01515    }
01516 
01517    return _database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt;
01518 #else
01519    return 0;
01520 #endif
01521 }
01522 
01523 /********************************************************************/
01524 /**
01525 Protect a database for read/write access outside of the \b db_xxx functions
01526 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
01527 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
01528 */
01529 INT db_protect_database(HNDLE hDB)
01530 {
01531 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01532    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01533       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_unlock_database", "invalid database handle");
01534       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01535    }
01536 
01537    _database[hDB - 1].protect = TRUE;
01538    ss_shm_protect(_database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, _database[hDB - 1].database_header);
01539    _database[hDB - 1].database_header = NULL;
01540 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01541    return DB_SUCCESS;
01542 }
01543 
01544 /*---- helper routines ---------------------------------------------*/
01545 
01546 const char *extract_key(const char *key_list, char *key_name, int key_name_length)
01547 {
01548    int i = 0;
01549 
01550    if (*key_list == '/')
01551       key_list++;
01552 
01553    while (*key_list && *key_list != '/' && ++i < key_name_length)
01554       *key_name++ = *key_list++;
01555    *key_name = 0;
01556 
01557    return key_list;
01558 }
01559 
01560 BOOL equal_ustring(const char *str1, const char *str2)
01561 {
01562    if (str1 == NULL && str2 != NULL)
01563       return FALSE;
01564    if (str1 != NULL && str2 == NULL)
01565       return FALSE;
01566    if (str1 == NULL && str2 == NULL)
01567       return TRUE;
01568    if (strlen(str1) != strlen(str2))
01569       return FALSE;
01570 
01571    while (*str1)
01572       if (toupper(*str1++) != toupper(*str2++))
01573          return FALSE;
01574 
01575    if (*str2)
01576       return FALSE;
01577 
01578    return TRUE;
01579 }
01580 
01581 /********************************************************************/
01582 /**
01583 Create a new key in a database
01584 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
01585 @param hKey  Key handle to start with, 0 for root
01586 @param key_name    Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
01587 @param type        Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types)
01588 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_INVALID_PARAM, DB_FULL, DB_KEY_EXIST, DB_NO_ACCESS
01589 */
01590 INT db_create_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *key_name, DWORD type)
01591 {
01592    if (rpc_is_remote())
01593       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CREATE_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, type);
01594 
01595 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01596    {
01597       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01598       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
01599       KEY *pkey, *pprev_key, *pkeyparent;
01600       const char *pkey_name;
01601       char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
01602       INT i;
01603 
01604       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01605          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid database handle");
01606          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01607       }
01608 
01609       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01610          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid database handle");
01611          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01612       }
01613 
01614       /* check type */
01615       if (type <= 0 || type >= TID_LAST) {
01616          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid key type %d for \'%s\'", type, key_name);
01617          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01618       }
01619 
01620       /* lock database */
01621       db_lock_database(hDB);
01622 
01623       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01624       if (!hKey)
01625          hKey = pheader->root_key;
01626       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
01627 
01628       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
01629       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
01630          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01631          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01632       }
01633 
01634       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
01635          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01636          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "key has no subkeys");
01637          return DB_NO_KEY;
01638       }
01639       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01640 
01641       pkey_name = key_name;
01642       do {
01643          /* extract single key from key_name */
01644          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str, sizeof(str));
01645 
01646          /* do not allow empty names, like '/dir/dir//dir/' */
01647          if (str[0] == 0) {
01648             db_unlock_database(hDB);
01649             return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01650          }
01651 
01652          /* check if parent or current directory */
01653          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
01654             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
01655                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
01656                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
01657             }
01658             continue;
01659          }
01660          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
01661             continue;
01662 
01663          /* check if key is in keylist */
01664          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
01665          pprev_key = NULL;
01666 
01667          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
01668             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
01669                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01670                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key",
01671                       "Warning: database corruption, key %s, next_key 0x%08X",
01672                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
01673                return DB_CORRUPTED;
01674             }
01675 
01676             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
01677                break;
01678 
01679             pprev_key = pkey;
01680             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
01681          }
01682 
01683          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
01684             /* not found: create new key */
01685 
01686             /* check parent for write access */
01687             pkeyparent = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
01688             if (!(pkeyparent->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkeyparent->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
01689                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01690                return DB_NO_ACCESS;
01691             }
01692 
01693             pkeylist->num_keys++;
01694 
01695             if (*pkey_name == '/' || type == TID_KEY) {
01696                /* create new key with keylist */
01697                pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01698 
01699                if (pkey == NULL) {
01700                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01701                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01702                   return DB_FULL;
01703                }
01704 
01705                /* append key to key list */
01706                if (pprev_key)
01707                   pprev_key->next_key = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01708                else
01709                   pkeylist->first_key = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01710 
01711                /* set key properties */
01712                pkey->type = TID_KEY;
01713                pkey->num_values = 1;
01714                pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01715                strlcpy(pkey->name, str, sizeof(pkey->name));
01716                pkey->parent_keylist = (POINTER_T) pkeylist - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01717 
01718                /* find space for new keylist */
01719                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEYLIST));
01720 
01721                if (pkeylist == NULL) {
01722                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01723                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01724                   return DB_FULL;
01725                }
01726 
01727                /* store keylist in data field */
01728                pkey->data = (POINTER_T) pkeylist - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01729                pkey->item_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01730                pkey->total_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01731 
01732                pkeylist->parent = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01733                pkeylist->num_keys = 0;
01734                pkeylist->first_key = 0;
01735             } else {
01736                /* create new key with data */
01737                pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01738 
01739                if (pkey == NULL) {
01740                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01741                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01742                   return DB_FULL;
01743                }
01744 
01745                /* append key to key list */
01746                if (pprev_key)
01747                   pprev_key->next_key = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01748                else
01749                   pkeylist->first_key = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01750 
01751                pkey->type = type;
01752                pkey->num_values = 1;
01753                pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01754                strlcpy(pkey->name, str, sizeof(pkey->name));
01755                pkey->parent_keylist = (POINTER_T) pkeylist - (POINTER_T) pheader;
01756 
01757                /* zero data */
01758                if (type != TID_STRING && type != TID_LINK) {
01759                   pkey->item_size = rpc_tid_size(type);
01760                   pkey->data = (POINTER_T) malloc_data(pheader, pkey->item_size);
01761                   pkey->total_size = pkey->item_size;
01762 
01763                   if (pkey->data == 0) {
01764                      db_unlock_database(hDB);
01765                      cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01766                      return DB_FULL;
01767                   }
01768 
01769                   pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
01770                } else {
01771                   /* first data is empty */
01772                   pkey->item_size = 0;
01773                   pkey->total_size = 0;
01774                   pkey->data = 0;
01775                }
01776             }
01777          } else {
01778             /* key found: descend */
01779 
01780             /* resolve links */
01781             if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && pkey_name[0]) {
01782                /* copy destination, strip '/' */
01783                strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01784                if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
01785                   str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
01786 
01787                /* append rest of key name */
01788                strcat(str, pkey_name);
01789 
01790                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01791 
01792                return db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, type);
01793             }
01794 
01795             if (!(*pkey_name == '/')) {
01796                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01797 
01798                if ((WORD) pkey->type != type)
01799                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "redefinition of key type mismatch");
01800 
01801                return DB_KEY_EXIST;
01802             }
01803 
01804             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
01805                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01806                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "key used with value and as parent key");
01807                return DB_KEY_EXIST;
01808             }
01809 
01810             pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01811          }
01812       } while (*pkey_name == '/');
01813 
01814       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01815    }
01816 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01817 
01818    return DB_SUCCESS;
01819 }
01820 
01821 /********************************************************************/
01822 /**
01823 Create a link to a key or set the destination of and existing link.
01824 @param hDB           ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
01825 @param hKey          Key handle to start with, 0 for root
01826 @param link_name     Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
01827 @param destination   Destination of link in the form "/key/key/key"
01828 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_FULL, DB_KEY_EXIST, DB_NO_ACCESS
01829 */
01830 INT db_create_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *link_name, const char *destination)
01831 {
01832    HNDLE hkey;
01833    int status;
01834 
01835    if (rpc_is_remote())
01836       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CREATE_LINK, hDB, hKey, link_name, destination);
01837 
01838    /* check if destination exists */
01839    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, destination, &hkey);
01840    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01841       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_link", "Link destination \"%s\" does not exist", destination);
01842       return DB_NO_KEY;
01843    }
01844 
01845    return db_set_value(hDB, hKey, link_name, destination, strlen(destination) + 1, 1, TID_LINK);
01846 }
01847 
01848 /********************************************************************/
01849 /**
01850 Delete a subtree, using level information (only called internally by db_delete_key())
01851 @internal 
01852 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
01853 @param hKey  Key handle to start with, 0 for root
01854 @param level            Recursion level, must be zero when
01855 @param follow_links     Follow links when TRUE called from a user routine
01856 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_OPEN_RECORD
01857 */
01858 INT db_delete_key1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level, BOOL follow_links)
01859 {
01860 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01861    {
01862       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01863       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
01864       KEY *pkey, *pnext_key, *pkey_tmp;
01865       HNDLE hKeyLink;
01866       BOOL deny_delete;
01867       INT status;
01868       BOOL locked = FALSE;
01869 
01870       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01871          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "invalid database handle");
01872          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01873       }
01874 
01875       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01876          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "invalid database handle");
01877          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01878       }
01879 
01880       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
01881          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "invalid key handle");
01882          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01883       }
01884 
01885       /* lock database at the top level */
01886       if (level == 0) {
01887          db_lock_database(hDB);
01888          locked = TRUE;
01889       }
01890 
01891       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01892 
01893       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
01894 
01895       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
01896       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
01897          if (locked)
01898             db_unlock_database(hDB);
01899          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01900       }
01901 
01902       /* check if someone has opened key or parent */
01903       if (level == 0)
01904          do {
01905             if (pkey->notify_count) {
01906                if (locked)
01907                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01908                return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
01909             }
01910 
01911             if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0)
01912                break;
01913 
01914             pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
01915             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
01916          } while (TRUE);
01917 
01918       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
01919       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01920 
01921       deny_delete = FALSE;
01922 
01923       /* first recures subtree for keys */
01924       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY && pkeylist->first_key) {
01925          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
01926 
01927          do {
01928             pnext_key = (KEY *) (POINTER_T) pkey->next_key;
01929 
01930             status = db_delete_key1(hDB, (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader, level + 1, follow_links);
01931 
01932             if (status == DB_NO_ACCESS)
01933                deny_delete = TRUE;
01934 
01935             if (pnext_key)
01936                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + (POINTER_T) pnext_key);
01937          } while (pnext_key);
01938       }
01939 
01940       /* follow links if requested */
01941       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && follow_links) {
01942          status = db_find_key1(hDB, 0, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
01943          if (status == DB_SUCCESS && follow_links < 100)
01944             db_delete_key1(hDB, hKeyLink, level + 1, follow_links + 1);
01945 
01946          if (follow_links == 100)
01947             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "try to delete cyclic link");
01948       }
01949 
01950       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
01951 
01952       /* return if key was already deleted by cyclic link */
01953       if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0) {
01954          if (locked)
01955             db_unlock_database(hDB);
01956          return DB_SUCCESS;
01957       }
01958 
01959       /* now delete key */
01960       if (hKey != pheader->root_key) {
01961          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_DELETE) || deny_delete) {
01962             if (locked)
01963                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01964             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
01965          }
01966 
01967          if (pkey->notify_count) {
01968             if (locked)
01969                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01970             return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
01971          }
01972 
01973          /* delete key data */
01974          if (pkey->type == TID_KEY)
01975             free_key(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size);
01976          else
01977             free_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size);
01978 
01979          /* unlink key from list */
01980          pnext_key = (KEY *) (POINTER_T) pkey->next_key;
01981          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
01982 
01983          if ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key) == pkey) {
01984             /* key is first in list */
01985             pkeylist->first_key = (POINTER_T) pnext_key;
01986          } else {
01987             /* find predecessor */
01988             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
01989             while ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key) != pkey)
01990                pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
01991             pkey_tmp->next_key = (POINTER_T) pnext_key;
01992          }
01993 
01994          /* delete key */
01995          free_key(pheader, pkey, sizeof(KEY));
01996          pkeylist->num_keys--;
01997       }
01998 
01999       if (locked)
02000          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02001    }
02002 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02003 
02004    return DB_SUCCESS;
02005 }
02006 
02007 /********************************************************************/
02008 /**
02009 Delete a subtree in a database starting from a key (including this key).
02010 \code
02011 ...
02012     status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, str, &hkey);
02013     if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02014     {
02015       cm_msg(MINFO,"my_delete"," "Cannot find key %s", str);
02016       return;
02017     }
02018 
02019     status = db_delete_key(hDB, hkey, FALSE);
02020     if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02021     {
02022       cm_msg(MERROR,"my_delete"," "Cannot delete key %s", str);
02023       return;
02024     }
02025   ...
02026 \endcode
02027 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
02028 @param hKey         for key where search starts, zero for root.
02029 @param follow_links Follow links when TRUE.
02030 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_OPEN_RECORD
02031 */
02032 INT db_delete_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, BOOL follow_links)
02033 {
02034    if (rpc_is_remote())
02035       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_DELETE_KEY, hDB, hKey, follow_links);
02036 
02037    return db_delete_key1(hDB, hKey, 0, follow_links);
02038 }
02039 
02040 /********************************************************************/
02041 /**
02042 Returns key handle for a key with a specific name.
02043 
02044 Keys can be accessed by their name including the directory
02045 or by a handle. A key handle is an internal offset to the shared memory
02046 where the ODB lives and allows a much faster access to a key than via its
02047 name.
02048 
02049 The function db_find_key() must be used to convert a key name to a handle.
02050 Most other database functions use this key handle in various operations.
02051 \code
02052 HNDLE hkey, hsubkey;
02053 // use full name, start from root
02054 db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
02055 // start from subdirectory
02056 db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo", &hkey);
02057 db_find_key(hdb, hkey, "Run number", &hsubkey);
02058 \endcode
02059 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
02060 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
02061 @param key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
02062 @param subhKey Returned handle of key, zero if key cannot be found.
02063 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_NO_KEY
02064 */
02065 INT db_find_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02066 {
02067    if (rpc_is_remote())
02068       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02069 
02070 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02071    {
02072       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02073       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02074       KEY *pkey;
02075       const char *pkey_name;
02076       char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02077       INT i, status;
02078 
02079       *subhKey = 0;
02080 
02081       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02082          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02083          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02084       }
02085 
02086       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02087          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02088          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02089       }
02090 
02091       db_lock_database(hDB);
02092 
02093       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02094 
02095       if (!hKey)
02096          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02097 
02098       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02099 
02100       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02101       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02102          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02103          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02104       }
02105 
02106       if (pkey->type < 1 || pkey->type >= TID_LAST) {
02107          *subhKey = 0;
02108          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02109          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "hkey %d invalid key type %d", hKey, pkey->type);
02110          return DB_NO_KEY;
02111       }
02112 
02113       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02114          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02115          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
02116          *subhKey = 0;
02117          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "key \"%s\" has no subkeys", str);
02118          return DB_NO_KEY;
02119       }
02120       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02121 
02122       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02123          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02124             *subhKey = 0;
02125             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02126             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02127          }
02128 
02129          *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02130 
02131          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02132          return DB_SUCCESS;
02133       }
02134 
02135       pkey_name = key_name;
02136       do {
02137          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02138          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str, sizeof(str));
02139 
02140          /* strip trailing '[n]' */
02141          if (strchr(str, '[') && str[strlen(str) - 1] == ']')
02142             *strchr(str, '[') = 0;
02143 
02144          /* check if parent or current directory */
02145          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02146             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02147                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
