02148                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02149             }
02150             continue;
02151          }
02152          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02153             continue;
02154 
02155          /* check if key is in keylist */
02156          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02157 
02158          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02159             if (pkey->name[0] == 0 || !db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02160                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02161                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key",
02162                       "Warning: database corruption, key %s, next_key 0x%08X",
02163                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02164                *subhKey = 0;
02165                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02166             }
02167 
02168             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02169                break;
02170 
02171             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02172          }
02173 
02174          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02175             *subhKey = 0;
02176             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02177             return DB_NO_KEY;
02178          }
02179 
02180          /* resolve links */
02181          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
02182             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02183             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02184             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02185                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02186 
02187             /* if link is pointer to array index, return link instead of destination */
02188             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == ']')
02189                break;
02190 
02191             /* append rest of key name if existing */
02192             if (pkey_name[0]) {
02193                strcat(str, pkey_name);
02194                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02195                return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02196             } else {
02197                /* if last key in chain is a link, return its destination */
02198                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02199                status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02200                if (status == DB_NO_KEY)
02201                   return DB_INVALID_LINK;
02202                return status;
02203             }
02204          }
02205 
02206          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02207          if (*pkey_name == '/') {
02208             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02209                *subhKey = 0;
02210                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02211                return DB_NO_KEY;
02212             }
02213          }
02214 
02215          /* descend one level */
02216          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02217 
02218       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02219 
02220       *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02221 
02222       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02223    }
02224 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02225 
02226    return DB_SUCCESS;
02227 }
02228 
02229 /**dox***************************************************************/
02230 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02231 
02232 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02233 INT db_find_key1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02234 /********************************************************************\
02235 
02236   Routine: db_find_key1
02237 
02238   Purpose: Same as db_find_key, but without DB locking
02239 
02240   Input:
02241     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02242     HNDLE  hKey             Key handle to start the search
02243     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02244 
02245   Output:
02246     INT    *handle          Key handle
02247 
02248   Function value:
02249     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02250     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02251     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02252     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02253 
02254 \********************************************************************/
02255 {
02256    if (rpc_is_remote())
02257       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02258 
02259 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02260    {
02261       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02262       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02263       KEY *pkey;
02264       const char *pkey_name;
02265       char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02266       INT i;
02267 
02268       *subhKey = 0;
02269 
02270       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02271          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02272          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02273       }
02274 
02275       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02276          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02277          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02278       }
02279 
02280       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02281       if (!hKey)
02282          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02283       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02284 
02285       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02286       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02287          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02288       }
02289 
02290       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02291          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "key has no subkeys");
02292          *subhKey = 0;
02293          return DB_NO_KEY;
02294       }
02295       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02296 
02297       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02298          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02299             *subhKey = 0;
02300             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02301          }
02302 
02303          *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02304 
02305          return DB_SUCCESS;
02306       }
02307 
02308       pkey_name = key_name;
02309       do {
02310          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02311          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str, sizeof(str));
02312 
02313          /* check if parent or current directory */
02314          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02315             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02316                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02317                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02318             }
02319             continue;
02320          }
02321          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02322             continue;
02323 
02324          /* check if key is in keylist */
02325          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02326 
02327          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02328             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02329                break;
02330 
02331             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02332          }
02333 
02334          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02335             *subhKey = 0;
02336             return DB_NO_KEY;
02337          }
02338 
02339          /* resolve links */
02340          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
02341             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02342             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02343             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02344                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02345 
02346             /* append rest of key name if existing */
02347             if (pkey_name[0]) {
02348                strcat(str, pkey_name);
02349                return db_find_key1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02350             } else {
02351                /* if last key in chain is a link, return its destination */
02352                return db_find_link1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02353             }
02354          }
02355 
02356          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02357          if (*pkey_name == '/') {
02358             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02359                *subhKey = 0;
02360                return DB_NO_KEY;
02361             }
02362          }
02363 
02364          /* descend one level */
02365          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02366 
02367       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02368 
02369       *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02370    }
02371 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02372 
02373    return DB_SUCCESS;
02374 }
02375 
02376 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02377 INT db_find_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02378 /********************************************************************\
02379 
02380   Routine: db_find_link
02381 
02382   Purpose: Find a key or link by name and return its handle
02383            (internal address). The only difference of this routine
02384            compared with db_find_key is that if the LAST key in
02385            the chain is a link, it is NOT evaluated. Links not being
02386            the last in the chain are evaluated.
02387 
02388   Input:
02389     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02390     HNDLE  hKey       Key handle to start the search
02391     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02392 
02393   Output:
02394     INT    *handle          Key handle
02395 
02396   Function value:
02397     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02398     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02399     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02400     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02401 
02402 \********************************************************************/
02403 {
02404    if (rpc_is_remote())
02405       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_LINK, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02406 
02407 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02408    {
02409       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02410       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02411       KEY *pkey;
02412       const char *pkey_name;
02413       char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02414       INT i;
02415 
02416       *subhKey = 0;
02417 
02418       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02419          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "Invalid database handle");
02420          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02421       }
02422 
02423       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02424          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "invalid database handle");
02425          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02426       }
02427 
02428       db_lock_database(hDB);
02429 
02430       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02431       if (!hKey)
02432          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02433       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02434 
02435       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02436       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02437          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02438          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02439       }
02440 
02441       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02442          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02443          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "key has no subkeys");
02444          return DB_NO_KEY;
02445       }
02446       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02447 
02448       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02449          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02450             *subhKey = 0;
02451             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02452             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02453          }
02454 
02455          *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02456 
02457          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02458          return DB_SUCCESS;
02459       }
02460 
02461       pkey_name = key_name;
02462       do {
02463          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02464          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str, sizeof(str));
02465 
02466          /* check if parent or current directory */
02467          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02468             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02469                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02470                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02471             }
02472             continue;
02473          }
02474          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02475             continue;
02476 
02477          /* check if key is in keylist */
02478          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02479 
02480          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02481             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02482                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02483                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link",
02484                       "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
02485                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02486                *subhKey = 0;
02487                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02488             }
02489 
02490             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02491                break;
02492 
02493             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02494          }
02495 
02496          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02497             *subhKey = 0;
02498             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02499             return DB_NO_KEY;
02500          }
02501 
02502          /* resolve links if not last in chain */
02503          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && *pkey_name == '/') {
02504             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02505             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02506             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02507                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02508 
02509             /* append rest of key name */
02510             strcat(str, pkey_name);
02511             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02512             return db_find_link(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02513          }
02514 
02515          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02516          if ((*pkey_name == '/')) {
02517             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02518                *subhKey = 0;
02519                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02520                return DB_NO_KEY;
02521             }
02522          }
02523 
02524          /* descend one level */
02525          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02526 
02527       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02528 
02529       *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02530 
02531       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02532    }
02533 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02534 
02535    return DB_SUCCESS;
02536 }
02537 
02538 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02539 INT db_find_link1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02540 /********************************************************************\
02541 
02542   Routine: db_find_link1
02543 
02544   Purpose: Same ad db_find_link, but without DB locking
02545 
02546   Input:
02547     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02548     HNDLE  hKey       Key handle to start the search
02549     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02550 
02551   Output:
02552     INT    *handle          Key handle
02553 
02554   Function value:
02555     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02556     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02557     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02558     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02559 
02560 \********************************************************************/
02561 {
02562    if (rpc_is_remote())
02563       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_LINK, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02564 
02565 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02566    {
02567       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02568       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02569       KEY *pkey;
02570       const char *pkey_name;
02571       char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02572       INT i;
02573 
02574       *subhKey = 0;
02575 
02576       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02577          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "Invalid database handle");
02578          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02579       }
02580 
02581       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02582          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "invalid database handle");
02583          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02584       }
02585 
02586       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02587       if (!hKey)
02588          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02589       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02590 
02591       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02592       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02593          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02594       }
02595 
02596       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02597          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "key has no subkeys");
02598          return DB_NO_KEY;
02599       }
02600       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02601 
02602       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02603          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02604             *subhKey = 0;
02605             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02606          }
02607 
02608          *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02609 
02610          return DB_SUCCESS;
02611       }
02612 
02613       pkey_name = key_name;
02614       do {
02615          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02616          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str, sizeof(str));
02617 
02618          /* check if parent or current directory */
02619          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02620             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02621                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02622                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02623             }
02624             continue;
02625          }
02626          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02627             continue;
02628 
02629          /* check if key is in keylist */
02630          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02631 
02632          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02633             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02634                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link1",
02635                       "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
02636                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02637                *subhKey = 0;
02638                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02639             }
02640 
02641             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02642                break;
02643 
02644             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02645          }
02646 
02647          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02648             *subhKey = 0;
02649             return DB_NO_KEY;
02650          }
02651 
02652          /* resolve links if not last in chain */
02653          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && *pkey_name == '/') {
02654             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02655             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02656             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02657                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02658 
02659             /* append rest of key name */
02660             strcat(str, pkey_name);
02661             return db_find_link1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02662          }
02663 
02664          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02665          if ((*pkey_name == '/')) {
02666             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02667                *subhKey = 0;
02668                return DB_NO_KEY;
02669             }
02670          }
02671 
02672          /* descend one level */
02673          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02674 
02675       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02676 
02677       *subhKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
02678    }
02679 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02680 
02681    return DB_SUCCESS;
02682 }
02683 
02684 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02685 INT db_scan_tree(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level, INT(*callback) (HNDLE, HNDLE, KEY *, INT, void *), void *info)
02686 /********************************************************************\
02687 
02688   Routine: db_scan_tree
02689 
02690   Purpose: Scan a subtree recursively and call 'callback' for each key
02691 
02692   Input:
02693     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
02694     HNDLE  hKeyRoot         Key to start scan from, 0 for root
02695     INT    level            Recursion level
02696     void   *callback        Callback routine called with params:
02697                               hDB   Copy of hDB
02698                               hKey  Copy of hKey
02699                               key   Key associated with hKey
02700                               INT   Recursion level
02701                               info  Copy of *info
02702     void   *info            Optional data copied to callback routine
02703 
02704   Output:
02705     implicit via callback
02706 
02707   Function value:
02708     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02709     <all error codes of db_get_key>
02710 
02711 \********************************************************************/
02712 {
02713    HNDLE hSubkey;
02714    KEY key;
02715    INT i, status;
02716 
02717    status = db_get_link(hDB, hKey, &key);
02718    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02719       return status;
02720 
02721    status = callback(hDB, hKey, &key, level, info);
02722    if (status == 0)
02723       return status;
02724 
02725    if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
02726       for (i = 0;; i++) {
02727          db_enum_link(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
02728 
02729          if (!hSubkey)
02730             break;
02731 
02732          db_scan_tree(hDB, hSubkey, level + 1, callback, info);
02733       }
02734    }
02735 
02736    return DB_SUCCESS;
02737 }
02738 
02739 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02740 INT db_scan_tree_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level, void (*callback) (HNDLE, HNDLE, KEY *, INT, void *), void *info)
02741 /********************************************************************\
02742 
02743   Routine: db_scan_tree_link
02744 
02745   Purpose: Scan a subtree recursively and call 'callback' for each key.
02746            Similar to db_scan_tree but without follwing links.
02747 
02748   Input:
02749     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
02750     HNDLE  hKeyRoot         Key to start scan from, 0 for root
02751     INT    level            Recursion level
02752     void   *callback        Callback routine called with params:
02753                               hDB   Copy of hDB
02754                               hKey  Copy of hKey
02755                               key   Key associated with hKey
02756                               INT   Recursion level
02757                               info  Copy of *info
02758     void   *info            Optional data copied to callback routine
02759 
02760   Output:
02761     implicit via callback
02762 
02763   Function value:
02764     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02765     <all error codes of db_get_key>
02766 
02767 \********************************************************************/
02768 {
02769    HNDLE hSubkey;
02770    KEY key;
02771    INT i, status;
02772 
02773    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
02774    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02775       return status;
02776 
02777    callback(hDB, hKey, &key, level, info);
02778 
02779    if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
02780       for (i = 0;; i++) {
02781          db_enum_link(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
02782 
02783          if (!hSubkey)
02784             break;
02785 
02786          db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hSubkey, level + 1, callback, info);
02787       }
02788    }
02789 
02790    return DB_SUCCESS;
02791 }
02792 
02793 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02794 INT db_get_path(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *path, INT buf_size)
02795 /********************************************************************\
02796 
02797   Routine: db_get_path
02798 
02799   Purpose: Get full path of a key
02800 
02801   Input:
02802     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
02803     HNDLE  hKey             Key handle
02804     INT    buf_size         Maximum size of path buffer (including
02805                             trailing zero)
02806 
02807   Output:
02808     char   path[buf_size]   Path string
02809 
02810   Function value:
02811     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02812     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02813     DB_NO_MEMORY            path buffer is to small to contain full
02814                             string
02815 
02816 \********************************************************************/
02817 {
02818    if (rpc_is_remote())
02819       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_PATH, hDB, hKey, path, buf_size);
02820 
02821 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02822    {
02823       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02824       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02825       KEY *pkey;
02826       char str[MAX_ODB_PATH];
02827 
02828       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02829          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_path", "invalid database handle");
02830          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02831       }
02832 
02833       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02834          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_path", "invalid database handle");
02835          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02836       }
02837 
02838       db_lock_database(hDB);
02839 
02840       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02841       if (!hKey)
02842          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02843       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02844 
02845       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02846       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02847          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02848          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02849       }
02850 
02851       if (hKey == pheader->root_key) {
02852          strcpy(path, "/");
02853          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02854          return DB_SUCCESS;
02855       }
02856 
02857       *path = 0;
02858       do {
02859          /* add key name in front of path */
02860          strcpy(str, path);
02861          strcpy(path, "/");
02862          strcat(path, pkey->name);
02863 
02864          if (strlen(path) + strlen(str) + 1 > (DWORD) buf_size) {
02865             *path = 0;
02866             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02867             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
02868          }
02869          strcat(path, str);
02870 
02871          /* find parent key */
02872          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02873          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02874       } while (pkey->parent_keylist);
02875 
02876       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02877    }
02878 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02879 
02880    return DB_SUCCESS;
02881 }
02882 
02883 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02884 void db_find_open_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * key, INT level, void *result)
02885 {
02886 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02887    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02888    DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
02889    INT i, j;
02890    char line[256], str[80];
02891 
02892    /* avoid compiler warning */
02893    i = level;
02894 
02895    /* check if this key has notify count set */
02896    if (key->notify_count) {
02897       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
02898       sprintf(line, "%s open %d times by ", str, key->notify_count);
02899 
02900       db_lock_database(hDB);
02901       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02902 
02903       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++) {
02904          pclient = &pheader->client[i];
02905          for (j = 0; j < pclient->max_index; j++)
02906             if (pclient->open_record[j].handle == hKey)
02907                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s ", pclient->name);
02908       }
02909       strcat(line, "\n");
02910       strcat((char *) result, line);
02911 
02912       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02913    }
02914 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02915 }
02916 
02917 void db_fix_open_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * key, INT level, void *result)
02918 {
02919 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02920    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02921    DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
02922    INT i, j;
02923    char str[256];
02924    KEY *pkey;
02925 
02926    /* avoid compiler warning */
02927    i = level;
02928 
02929    /* check if this key has notify count set */
02930    if (key->notify_count) {
02931       db_lock_database(hDB);
02932       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02933 
02934       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++) {
02935          pclient = &pheader->client[i];
02936          for (j = 0; j < pclient->max_index; j++)
02937             if (pclient->open_record[j].handle == hKey)
02938                break;
02939          if (j < pclient->max_index)
02940             break;
02941       }
02942       if (i == pheader->max_client_index) {
02943          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
02944          strcat(str, " fixed\n");
02945          strcat((char *) result, str);
02946 
02947          /* reset notify count */
02948          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02949          pkey->notify_count = 0;
02950       }
02951 
02952       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02953    }
02954 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02955 }
02956 
02957 INT db_get_open_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *str, INT buf_size, BOOL fix)
02958 /********************************************************************\
02959 
02960   Routine: db_get_open_records
02961 
02962   Purpose: Return a string with all open records
02963 
02964   Input:
02965     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
02966     HNDLE  hKey             Key to start search from, 0 for root
02967     INT    buf_size         Size of string
02968     INT    fix              If TRUE, fix records which are open
02969                             but have no client belonging to it.
02970 
02971   Output:
02972     char   *str             Result string. Individual records are
02973                             separated with new lines.
02974 
02975   Function value:
02976     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02977 
02978 \********************************************************************/
02979 {
02980    str[0] = 0;
02981 
02982    if (rpc_is_remote())
02983       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_OPEN_RECORDS, hDB, hKey, str, buf_size);
02984 
02985    if (fix)
02986       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKey, 0, db_fix_open_records, str);
02987    else
02988       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKey, 0, db_find_open_records, str);
02989 
02990    return DB_SUCCESS;
02991 }
02992 
02993 /**dox***************************************************************/
02994 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02995 
02996 /********************************************************************/
02997 /**
02998 Set value of a single key.
02999 
03000 The function sets a single value or a whole array to a ODB key.
03001 Since the data buffer is of type void, no type checking can be performed by the
03002 compiler. Therefore the type has to be explicitly supplied, which is checked
03003 against the type stored in the ODB. key_name can contain the full path of a key
03004 (like: "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1") while hkey is zero which refers
03005 to the root, or hkey can refer to a sub-directory (like /Equipment/Trigger)
03006 and key_name is interpreted relative to that directory like "Settings/Level1".
03007 \code
03008 INT level1;
03009   db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1",
03010                           &level1, sizeof(level1), 1, TID_INT);
03011 \endcode
03012 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03013 @param hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
03014 @param key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
03015 @param data Address of data.
03016 @param data_size Size of data (in bytes).
03017 @param num_values Number of data elements.
03018 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types)
03019 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH
03020 */
03021 INT db_set_value(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, const char *key_name, const void *data,
03022                  INT data_size, INT num_values, DWORD type)
03023 {
03024    if (rpc_is_remote())
03025       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_VALUE, hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, data, data_size, num_values, type);
03026 
03027 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03028    {
03029       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03030       KEY *pkey;
03031       HNDLE hKey;
03032       INT status;
03033 
03034       if (num_values == 0)
03035          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
03036 
03037       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
03038       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
03039          db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, type);
03040          status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
03041       }
03042 
03043       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03044          return status;
03045 
03046       db_lock_database(hDB);
03047       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03048 
03049       /* get address from handle */
03050       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03051 
03052       /* check for write access */
03053       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
03054          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03055          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
03056       }
03057 
03058       if (pkey->type != type) {
03059          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03060          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
03061                 key_name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
03062          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03063       }
03064 
03065       /* keys cannot contain data */
03066       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
03067          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03068          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "key cannot contain data");
03069          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03070       }
03071 
03072       if (data_size == 0) {
03073          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03074          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "zero data size not allowed");
03075          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03076       }
03077 
03078       if (type != TID_STRING && type != TID_LINK && data_size != rpc_tid_size(type) * num_values) {
03079          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03080          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "data_size (%d) does not match num_values (%d)", data_size, num_values);
03081          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03082       }
03083 
03084       /* resize data size if necessary */
03085       if (pkey->total_size != data_size) {
03086          pkey->data = (POINTER_T) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size, data_size);
03087 
03088          if (pkey->data == 0) {
03089             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03090             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "online database full");
03091             return DB_FULL;
03092          }
03093 
03094          pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
03095          pkey->total_size = data_size;
03096       }
03097 
03098       /* set number of values */
03099       pkey->num_values = num_values;
03100 
03101       if (type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK)
03102          pkey->item_size = data_size / num_values;
03103       else
03104          pkey->item_size = rpc_tid_size(type);
03105 
03106       /* copy data */
03107       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, data, data_size);
03108 
03109       /* update time */
03110       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
03111 
03112       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
03113       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03114 
03115    }
03116 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03117 
03118    return DB_SUCCESS;
03119 }
03120 
03121 /********************************************************************/
03122 /**
03123 Set single value of an array.
03124 
03125 The function sets a single value of an ODB key which is an array.
03126 key_name can contain the full path of a key
03127 (like: "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1") while hkey is zero which refers
03128 to the root, or hkey can refer to a sub-directory (like /Equipment/Trigger)
03129 and key_name is interpreted relative to that directory like "Settings/Level1".
03130 \code
03131 INT level1;
03132   db_set_value_index(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1",
03133                           &level1, sizeof(level1), 15, TID_INT, FALSE);
03134 \endcode
03135 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03136 @param hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
03137 @param key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
03138 @param data Address of data.
03139 @param data_size Size of data (in bytes).
03140 @param index Array index of value.
03141 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types)
03142 @param truncate Truncate array to current index if TRUE
03143 @return <same as db_set_data_index>
03144 */
03145 INT db_set_value_index(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, const char *key_name, const void *data,
03146                        INT data_size, INT idx, DWORD type, BOOL trunc)
03147 {
03148    HNDLE hkey;
03149 
03150    db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hkey);
03151    if (!hkey) {
03152       db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, type);
03153       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hkey);
03154       assert(hkey);
03155    } else
03156       if (trunc)
03157          db_set_num_values(hDB, hkey, idx + 1);
03158 
03159    return db_set_data_index(hDB, hkey, data, data_size, idx, type);
03160 }
03161 
03162 /********************************************************************/
03163 /**
03164 Get value of a single key.
03165 
03166 The function returns single values or whole arrays which are contained
03167 in an ODB key. Since the data buffer is of type void, no type checking can be
03168 performed by the compiler. Therefore the type has to be explicitly supplied,
03169 which is checked against the type stored in the ODB. key_name can contain the
03170 full path of a key (like: "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1") while hkey is
03171 zero which refers to the root, or hkey can refer to a sub-directory
03172 (like: /Equipment/Trigger) and key_name is interpreted relative to that directory
03173 like "Settings/Level1".
03174 \code
03175 INT level1, size;
03176   size = sizeof(level1);
03177   db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1",
03178                                    &level1, &size, TID_INT, 0);
03179 \endcode
03180 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03181 @param hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
03182 @param key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
03183 @param data Address of data.
03184 @param buf_size Maximum buffer size on input, number of written bytes on return.
03185 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types)
03186 @param create If TRUE, create key if not existing
03187 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH,
03188 DB_TRUNCATED, DB_NO_KEY
03189 */
03190 INT db_get_value(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, const char *key_name, void *data, INT * buf_size, DWORD type, BOOL create)
03191 {
03192    if (rpc_is_remote())
03193       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_VALUE, hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, data, buf_size, type, create);
03194 
03195 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03196    {
03197       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03198       HNDLE hkey;
03199       KEY *pkey;
03200       INT status, size, idx;
03201       char *p, path[256], keyname[256];
03202 
03203       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03204          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "invalid database handle");
03205          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03206       }
03207 
03208       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03209          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "invalid database handle");
03210          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03211       }
03212 
03213       /* check if key name contains index */
03214       strlcpy(keyname, key_name, sizeof(keyname));
03215       idx = -1;
03216       if (strchr(keyname, '[') && strchr(keyname, ']')) {
03217          for (p = strchr(keyname, '[') + 1; *p && *p != ']'; p++)
03218             if (!isdigit(*p))
03219                break;
03220 
03221          if (*p && *p == ']') {
03222             idx = atoi(strchr(keyname, '[') + 1);
03223             *strchr(keyname, '[') = 0;
03224          }
03225       }
03226 
03227       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, keyname, &hkey);
03228       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
03229          if (create) {
03230             db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, keyname, type);
03231             status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, keyname, &hkey);
03232             if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03233                return status;
03234 
03235             /* get string size from data size */
03236             if (type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK)
03237                size = *buf_size;
03238             else
03239                size = rpc_tid_size(type);
03240 
03241             if (size == 0)
03242                return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03243 
03244             /* set default value if key was created */
03245             status = db_set_value(hDB, hKeyRoot, keyname, data, *buf_size, *buf_size / size, type);
03246          } else
03247             return DB_NO_KEY;
03248       }
03249 
03250       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03251          return status;
03252 
03253       /* now lock database */
03254       db_lock_database(hDB);
03255       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03256 
03257       /* get address from handle */
03258       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hkey);
03259 
03260       /* check for correct type */
03261       if (pkey->type != (type)) {
03262          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03263          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "hkey %d entry \"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
03264                 hKeyRoot, keyname, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
03265          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03266       }
03267 
03268       /* check for read access */
03269       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
03270          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03271          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "%s has no read access", keyname);
03272          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
03273       }
03274 
03275       /* check if buffer is too small */
03276       if ((idx == -1 && pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) || (idx != -1 && pkey->item_size > *buf_size)) {
03277          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
03278          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03279          db_get_path(hDB, hkey, path, sizeof(path));
03280          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "buffer too small, data truncated for key \"%s\"", path);
03281          return DB_TRUNCATED;
03282       }
03283 
03284       /* check if index in boundaries */
03285       if (idx != -1 && idx >= pkey->num_values) {
03286          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03287          db_get_path(hDB, hkey, path, sizeof(path));
03288          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "invalid index \"%d\" for key \"%s\"", idx, path);
03289          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
03290       }
03291 
03292       /* copy key data */
03293       if (idx == -1) {
03294          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
03295          *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
03296       } else {
03297          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data + idx * pkey->item_size, pkey->item_size);
03298          *buf_size = pkey->item_size;
03299       }
03300 
03301       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03302    }
03303 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03304 
03305    return DB_SUCCESS;
03306 }
03307 
03308 /********************************************************************/
03309 /**
03310 Enumerate subkeys from a key, follow links.
03311 
03312 hkey must correspond to a valid ODB directory. The index is
03313 usually incremented in a loop until the last key is reached. Information about the
03314 sub-keys can be obtained with db_get_key(). If a returned key is of type
03315 TID_KEY, it contains itself sub-keys. To scan a whole ODB sub-tree, the
03316 function db_scan_tree() can be used.
03317 \code
03318 INT   i;
03319 HNDLE hkey, hsubkey;
03320 KEY   key;
03321   db_find_key(hdb, 0, "/Runinfo", &hkey);
03322   for (i=0 ; ; i++)
03323   {
03324    db_enum_key(hdb, hkey, i, &hsubkey);
03325    if (!hSubkey)
03326     break; // end of list reached
03327    // print key name
03328    db_get_key(hdb, hkey, &key);
03329    printf("%s\n", key.name);
03330   }
03331 \endcode
03332 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03333 @param hKey          Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
03334 @param idx          Subkey index, sould be initially 0, then
03335                     incremented in each call until
03336                     *subhKey becomes zero and the function
03337                     returns DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS
03338 @param subkey_handle Handle of subkey which can be used in
03339                     db_get_key() and db_get_data()
03340 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS
03341 */
03342 INT db_enum_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT idx, HNDLE * subkey_handle)
03343 {
03344    if (rpc_is_remote())
03345       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ENUM_KEY, hDB, hKey, idx, subkey_handle);
03346 
03347 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03348    {
03349       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03350       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03351       KEY *pkey;
03352       INT i;
03353       char str[256];
03354       HNDLE parent;
03355 
03356       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03357          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_key", "invalid database handle");
03358          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03359       }
03360 
03361       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03362          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_key", "invalid database handle");
03363          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03364       }
03365 
03366       *subkey_handle = 0;
03367 
03368       /* first lock database */
03369       db_lock_database(hDB);
03370 
03371       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03372       if (!hKey)
03373          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03374       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03375 
03376       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03377       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03378          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03379          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03380       }
03381 
03382       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03383          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03384          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03385       }
03386       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03387 
03388       if (idx >= pkeylist->num_keys) {
03389          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03390          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03391       }
03392 
03393       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03394       for (i = 0; i < idx; i++)
03395          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03396 
03397       /* resolve links */
03398       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
03399          strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03400 
03401          /* no not reolve if link to array index */
03402          if (strlen(str) > 0 && str[strlen(str) - 1] == ']') {
03403             *subkey_handle = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
03404             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03405             return DB_SUCCESS;
03406          }
03407 
03408          if (*str == '/') {
03409             /* absolute path */
03410             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03411             return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subkey_handle);
03412          } else {
03413             /* relative path */
03414             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
03415                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
03416                parent = pkeylist->parent;
03417                db_unlock_database(hDB);
03418                return db_find_key(hDB, parent, str, subkey_handle);
03419             } else {
03420                db_unlock_database(hDB);
03421                return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subkey_handle);
03422             }
03423          }
03424       }
03425 
03426       *subkey_handle = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
03427       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03428    }
03429 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03430 
03431    return DB_SUCCESS;
03432 }
03433 
03434 /**dox***************************************************************/
03435 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03436 
03437 
03438 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03439 INT db_enum_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT idx, HNDLE * subkey_handle)
03440 /********************************************************************\
03441 
03442   Routine: db_enum_link
03443 
03444   Purpose: Enumerate subkeys from a key, don't follow links
03445 
03446   Input:
03447     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03448     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key to enumerate, zero for the
03449                             root key
03450     INT   idx               Subkey index, sould be initially 0, then
03451                             incremented in each call until
03452                             *subhKey becomes zero and the function
03453                             returns DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS
03454 
03455   Output:
03456     HNDLE *subkey_handle    Handle of subkey which can be used in
03457                             db_get_key and db_get_data
03458 
03459   Function value:
03460     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03461     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03462     DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS      Last subkey reached
03463 
03464 \********************************************************************/
03465 {
03466    if (rpc_is_remote())
03467       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ENUM_LINK, hDB, hKey, idx, subkey_handle);
03468 
03469 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03470    {
03471       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03472       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03473       KEY *pkey;
03474       INT i;
03475 
03476       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03477          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03478          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03479       }
03480 
03481       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03482          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03483          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03484       }
03485 
03486       *subkey_handle = 0;
03487 
03488       /* first lock database */
03489       db_lock_database(hDB);
03490 
03491       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03492       if (!hKey)
03493          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03494       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03495 
03496       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03497       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03498          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03499          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03500       }
03501 
03502       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03503          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03504          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03505       }
03506       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03507 
03508       if (idx >= pkeylist->num_keys) {
03509          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03510          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03511       }
03512 
03513       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03514       for (i = 0; i < idx; i++)
03515          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03516 
03517       *subkey_handle = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
03518       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03519    }
03520 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03521 
03522    return DB_SUCCESS;
03523 }
03524 
03525 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03526 INT db_get_next_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, HNDLE * subkey_handle)
03527 /********************************************************************\
03528 
03529   Routine: db_get_next_link
03530 
03531   Purpose: Get next key in ODB after hKey
03532 
03533   Input:
03534     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03535     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key to enumerate, zero for the
03536                             root key
03537 
03538   Output:
03539     HNDLE *subkey_handle    Handle of subkey which can be used in
03540                             db_get_key and db_get_data
03541 
03542   Function value:
03543     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03544     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03545     DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS      Last subkey reached
03546 
03547 \********************************************************************/
03548 {
03549    if (rpc_is_remote())
03550       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_NEXT_LINK, hDB, hKey, subkey_handle);
03551 
03552 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03553    {
03554       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03555       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03556       KEY *pkey;
03557       INT descent;
03558 
03559       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03560          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03561          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03562       }
03563 
03564       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03565          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03566          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03567       }
03568 
03569       *subkey_handle = 0;
03570 
03571       /* first lock database */
03572       db_lock_database(hDB);
03573 
03574       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03575       if (!hKey)
03576          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03577       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03578 
03579       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03580       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03581          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03582          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03583       }
03584 
03585       descent = TRUE;
03586       do {
03587          if (pkey->type != TID_KEY || !descent) {
03588             if (pkey->next_key) {
03589                /* key has next key, return it */
03590                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03591 
03592                if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03593                   *subkey_handle = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
03594                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
03595                   return DB_SUCCESS;
03596                }
03597 
03598                /* key has subkeys, so descent on the next iteration */
03599                descent = TRUE;
03600             } else {
03601                if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0) {
03602                   /* return if we are back to the root key */
03603                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
03604                   return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03605                }
03606 
03607                /* key is last in list, traverse up */
03608                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
03609 
03610                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
03611                descent = FALSE;
03612             }
03613          } else {
03614             if (descent) {
03615                /* find first subkey */
03616                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03617 
03618                if (pkeylist->num_keys == 0) {
03619                   /* if key has no subkeys, look for next key on this level */
03620                   descent = FALSE;
03621                } else {
03622                   /* get first subkey */
03623                   pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03624 
03625                   if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03626                      *subkey_handle = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
03627                      db_unlock_database(hDB);
03628                      return DB_SUCCESS;
03629                   }
03630                }
03631             }
03632          }
03633 
03634       } while (TRUE);
03635    }
03636 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03637 
03638    return DB_SUCCESS;
03639 }
03640 
03641 /**dox***************************************************************/
03642 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03643 
03644 /********************************************************************/
03645 /**
03646 Get key structure from a handle.
03647 
03648 KEY structure has following format:
03649 \code
03650 typedef struct {
03651   DWORD         type;                 // TID_xxx type
03652   INT           num_values;           // number of values
03653   char          name[NAME_LENGTH];    // name of variable
03654   INT           data;                 // Address of variable (offset)
03655   INT           total_size;           // Total size of data block
03656   INT           item_size;            // Size of single data item
03657   WORD          access_mode;          // Access mode
03658   WORD          notify_count;         // Notify counter
03659   INT           next_key;             // Address of next key
03660   INT           parent_keylist;       // keylist to which this key belongs
03661   INT           last_written;         // Time of last write action
03662 } KEY;
03663 \endcode
03664 Most of these values are used for internal purposes, the values which are of
03665 public interest are type, num_values, and name. For keys which contain a
03666 single value, num_values equals to one and total_size equals to
03667 item_size. For keys which contain an array of strings (TID_STRING),
03668 item_size equals to the length of one string.
03669 \code
03670 KEY   key;
03671 HNDLE hkey;
03672 db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
03673 db_get_key(hDB, hkey, &key);
03674 printf("The run number is of type %s\n", rpc_tid_name(key.type));
03675 \endcode
03676 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03677 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
03678 @param key Pointer to KEY stucture.
03679 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
03680 */
03681 INT db_get_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * key)
03682 {
03683    if (rpc_is_remote())
03684       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_KEY, hDB, hKey, key);
03685 
03686 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03687    {
03688       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03689       KEY *pkey;
03690       HNDLE hkeylink;
03691       char link_name[256];
03692 
03693       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03694          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03695          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03696       }
03697 
03698       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03699          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03700          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03701       }
03702 
03703       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) && hKey != 0) {
03704          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid key handle");
03705          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03706       }
03707 
03708       db_lock_database(hDB);
03709 
03710       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03711 
03712       if (!hKey)
03713          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03714 
03715       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03716 
03717       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03718       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03719          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03720          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03721       }
03722 
03723       if (pkey->type < 1 || pkey->type >= TID_LAST) {
03724          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03725          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid key type %d", pkey->type);
03726          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03727       }
03728 
03729       /* check for link to array index */
03730       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
03731          strlcpy(link_name, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, sizeof(link_name));
03732          if (strlen(link_name) > 0 && link_name[strlen(link_name) - 1] == ']') {
03733             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03734             if (strchr(link_name, '[') == NULL)
03735                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
03736             if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, link_name, &hkeylink) != DB_SUCCESS)
03737                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
03738             db_get_key(hDB, hkeylink, key);
03739             key->num_values = 1;        // fake number of values
03740             return DB_SUCCESS;
03741          }
03742       }
03743 
03744       memcpy(key, pkey, sizeof(KEY));
03745 
03746       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03747 
03748    }
03749 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03750 
03751    return DB_SUCCESS;
03752 }
03753 
03754 /********************************************************************/
03755 /**
03756 Same as db_get_key, but it does not follow a link to an array index
03757 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03758 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
03759 @param key Pointer to KEY stucture.
03760 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
03761 */
03762 INT db_get_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * key)
03763 {
03764    if (rpc_is_remote())
03765       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_LINK, hDB, hKey, key);
03766 
03767 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03768    {
03769       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03770       KEY *pkey;
03771 
03772       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03773          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_link", "invalid database handle");
03774          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03775       }
03776 
03777       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03778          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_link", "invalid database handle");
03779          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03780       }
03781 
03782       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) && hKey != 0) {
03783          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_link", "invalid key handle");
03784          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03785       }
03786 
03787       db_lock_database(hDB);
03788 
03789       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03790 
03791       if (!hKey)
03792          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03793 
03794       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03795 
03796       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03797       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03798          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03799          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03800       }
03801 
03802       if (pkey->type < 1 || pkey->type >= TID_LAST) {
03803          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03804          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_link", "hkey %d invalid key type %d", hKey, pkey->type);
03805          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03806       }
03807 
03808       memcpy(key, pkey, sizeof(KEY));
03809 
03810       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03811 
03812    }
03813 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03814 
03815    return DB_SUCCESS;
03816 }
03817 
03818 /********************************************************************/
03819 /**
03820 Get time when key was last modified
03821 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03822 @param hKey              Handle of key to operate on
03823 @param delta             Seconds since last update
03824 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
03825 */
03826 INT db_get_key_time(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, DWORD * delta)
03827 {
03828    if (rpc_is_remote())
03829       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_KEY_TIME, hDB, hKey, delta);
03830 
03831 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03832    {
03833       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03834       KEY *pkey;
03835 
03836       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03837          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03838          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03839       }
03840 
03841       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03842          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03843          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03844       }
03845 
03846       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
03847          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid key handle");
03848          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03849       }
03850 
03851       db_lock_database(hDB);
03852 
03853       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03854       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03855 
03856       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03857       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03858          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03859          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03860       }
03861 
03862       *delta = ss_time() - pkey->last_written;
03863 
03864       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03865 
03866    }
03867 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03868 
03869    return DB_SUCCESS;
03870 }
03871 
03872 /********************************************************************/
03873 /**
03874 Get key info (separate values instead of structure)
03875 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
03876 @param hKey              Handle of key to operate on
03877 @param name             Key name
03878 @param name_size        Size of the give name (done with sizeof())
03879 @param type             Key type (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
03880 @param num_values       Number of values in key.
03881 @param item_size        Size of individual key value (used for strings)
03882 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
03883 */
03884 INT db_get_key_info(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *name, INT name_size, INT * type, INT * num_values, INT * item_size)
03885 {
03886    if (rpc_is_remote())
03887       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_KEY_INFO, hDB, hKey, name, name_size, type, num_values, item_size);
03888 
03889 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03890    {
03891       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03892       KEY *pkey;
03893       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03894 
03895       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03896          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key_info", "invalid database handle");
03897          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03898       }
03899 
03900       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03901          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key_info", "invalid database handle");
03902          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03903       }
03904 
03905       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
03906          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key_info", "invalid key handle");
03907          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03908       }
03909 
03910       db_lock_database(hDB);
03911 
03912       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03913       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03914 
03915       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03916       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03917          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03918          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03919       }
03920 
03921       if ((INT) strlen(pkey->name) + 1 > name_size) {
03922          /* truncate name */
03923          memcpy(name, pkey->name, name_size - 1);
03924          name[name_size] = 0;
03925       } else
03926          strcpy(name, pkey->name);
03927 
03928       /* convert "root" to "/" */
03929       if (strcmp(name, "root") == 0)
03930          strcpy(name, "/");
03931 
03932       *type = pkey->type;
03933       *num_values = pkey->num_values;
03934       *item_size = pkey->item_size;
03935 
03936       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
03937          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03938          *num_values = pkeylist->num_keys;
03939       }
03940 
03941       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03942    }
03943 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03944 
03945    return DB_SUCCESS;
03946 }
03947 
03948 /**dox***************************************************************/
03949 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03950 
03951 
03952 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03953 INT db_rename_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *name)
03954 /********************************************************************\
03955 
03956   Routine: db_get_key
03957 
03958   Purpose: Rename a key
03959 
03960   Input:
03961     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03962     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key
03963     char  *name             New key name
03964 
03965   Output:
03966     <none>
03967 
03968   Function value:
03969     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03970     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03971     DB_INVALID_NAME         Key name contains '/'
03972 
03973 \********************************************************************/
03974 {
03975    if (rpc_is_remote())
03976       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_RENAME_KEY, hDB, hKey, name);
03977 
03978 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03979    {
03980       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03981       KEY *pkey;
03982 
03983       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03984          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
03985          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03986       }
03987 
03988       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03989          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
03990          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03991       }
03992 
03993       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
03994          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid key handle");
03995          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03996       }
03997 
03998       if (strchr(name, '/')) {
03999          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "key name may not contain \"/\"");
04000          return DB_INVALID_NAME;
04001       }
04002       db_lock_database(hDB);
04003 
04004       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04005       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04006 
04007       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04008       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04009          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04010          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04011       }
04012 
04013       if (!pkey->type) {
04014          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04015          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid key type %d", pkey->type);
04016          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04017       }
04018 
04019       strlcpy(pkey->name, name, NAME_LENGTH);
04020 
04021       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04022 
04023    }
04024 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04025 
04026    return DB_SUCCESS;
04027 }
04028 
04029 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04030 INT db_reorder_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT idx)
04031 /********************************************************************\
04032 
04033   Routine: db_reorder_key
04034 
04035   Purpose: Reorder key so that key hKey apprears at position 'index'
04036            in keylist (or at bottom if index<0)
04037 
04038   Input:
04039     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
04040     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key
04041     INT   idx               New positio of key in keylist
04042 
04043   Output:
04044     <none>
04045 
04046   Function value:
04047     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04048     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04049     DB_NO_ACCESS            Key is locked for write
04050     DB_OPEN_RECORD          Key, subkey or parent key is open
04051 
04052 \********************************************************************/
04053 {
04054    if (rpc_is_remote())
04055       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_REORDER_KEY, hDB, hKey, idx);
04056 
04057 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04058    {
04059       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04060       KEY *pkey, *pprev_key, *pnext_key, *pkey_tmp;
04061       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
04062       INT i;
04063 
04064       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04065          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
04066          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04067       }
04068 
04069       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04070          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
04071          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04072       }
04073 
04074       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04075          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid key handle");
04076          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04077       }
04078 
04079       db_lock_database(hDB);
04080 
04081       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04082       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04083 
04084       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04085       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04086          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04087          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04088       }
04089 
04090       if (!pkey->type) {
04091          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04092          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_reorder_key", "invalid key type %d", pkey->type);
04093          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04094       }
04095 
04096       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE)) {
04097          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04098          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04099       }
04100 
04101       /* check if someone has opened key or parent */
04102       do {
04103          if (pkey->notify_count) {
04104             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04105             return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
04106          }
04107 
04108          if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0)
04109             break;
04110 
04111          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
04112          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
04113       } while (TRUE);
04114 
04115       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04116       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
04117 
04118       /* first remove key from list */
04119       pnext_key = (KEY *) (POINTER_T) pkey->next_key;
04120 
04121       if ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key) == pkey) {
04122          /* key is first in list */
04123          pkeylist->first_key = (POINTER_T) pnext_key;
04124       } else {
04125          /* find predecessor */
04126          pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
04127          while ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key) != pkey)
04128             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04129          pkey_tmp->next_key = (POINTER_T) pnext_key;
04130       }
04131 
04132       /* add key to list at proper index */
04133       pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
04134       if (idx < 0 || idx >= pkeylist->num_keys - 1) {
04135          /* add at bottom */
04136 
04137          /* find last key */
04138          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys - 2; i++) {
04139             pprev_key = pkey_tmp;
04140             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04141          }
04142 
04143          pkey_tmp->next_key = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
04144          pkey->next_key = 0;
04145       } else {
04146          if (idx == 0) {
04147             /* add at top */
04148             pkey->next_key = pkeylist->first_key;
04149             pkeylist->first_key = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
04150          } else {
04151             /* add at position index */
04152             for (i = 0; i < idx - 1; i++)
04153                pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04154 
04155             pkey->next_key = pkey_tmp->next_key;
04156             pkey_tmp->next_key = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
04157          }
04158       }
04159 
04160       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04161 
04162    }
04163 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04164 
04165    return DB_SUCCESS;
04166 }
04167 
04168 /**dox***************************************************************/
04169 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04170 
04171 
04172 /********************************************************************/
04173 /**
04174 Get key data from a handle
04175 
04176 The function returns single values or whole arrays which are contained
04177 in an ODB key. Since the data buffer is of type void, no type checking can be
04178 performed by the compiler. Therefore the type has to be explicitly supplied,
04179 which is checked against the type stored in the ODB.
04180 \code
04181   HNLDE hkey;
04182   INT   run_number, size;
04183   // get key handle for run number
04184   db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
04185   // return run number
04186   size = sizeof(run_number);
04187   db_get_data(hDB, hkey, &run_number, &size,TID_INT);
04188 \endcode
04189 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
04190 @param hKey         Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
04191 @param data         Pointer to the return data. 
04192 @param buf_size     Size of data buffer.
04193 @param type         Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
04194 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH
04195 */
04196 INT db_get_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size, DWORD type)
04197 {
04198    if (rpc_is_remote())
04199       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, type);
04200 
04201 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04202    {
04203       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04204       KEY *pkey;
04205       char str[256];
04206 
04207       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04208          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04209          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04210       }
04211 
04212       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04213          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04214          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04215       }
04216 
04217       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04218          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04219          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04220       }
04221 
04222       db_lock_database(hDB);
04223 
04224       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04225       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04226 
04227       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04228       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04229          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04230          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04231       }
04232 
04233       /* check for read access */
04234       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04235          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04236          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04237       }
04238 
04239       if (!pkey->type) {
04240          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04241          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key type %d", pkey->type);
04242          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04243       }
04244 
04245       /* follow links to array index */
04246       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
04247          char link_name[256];
04248          int i;
04249          HNDLE hkey;
04250          KEY key;
04251 
04252          strlcpy(link_name, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, sizeof(link_name));
04253          if (strlen(link_name) > 0 && link_name[strlen(link_name) - 1] == ']') {
04254             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04255             if (strchr(link_name, '[') == NULL)
04256                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
04257             i = atoi(strchr(link_name, '[') + 1);
04258             *strchr(link_name, '[') = 0;
04259             if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, link_name, &hkey) != DB_SUCCESS)
04260                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
04261             db_get_key(hDB, hkey, &key);
04262             return db_get_data_index(hDB, hkey, data, buf_size, i, key.type);
04263          }
04264       }
04265 
04266       if (pkey->type != type) {
04267          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04268          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
04269          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04270                 str, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04271          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04272       }
04273 
04274       /* keys cannot contain data */
04275       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04276          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04277          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
04278          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Key \"%s\" cannot contain data", str);
