04279          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04280       }
04281 
04282       /* check if key has data */
04283       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04284          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04285          *buf_size = 0;
04286          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04287          return DB_SUCCESS;
04288       }
04289 
04290       /* check if buffer is too small */
04291       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04292          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
04293          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04294          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
04295          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", str);
04296          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04297       }
04298 
04299       /* copy key data */
04300       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
04301       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
04302 
04303       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04304 
04305    }
04306 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04307 
04308    return DB_SUCCESS;
04309 }
04310 
04311 /********************************************************************/
04312 /**
04313 Same as db_get_data, but do not follow a link to an array index
04314 
04315 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
04316 @param hKey         Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
04317 @param data         Pointer to the return data. 
04318 @param buf_size     Size of data buffer.
04319 @param type         Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
04320 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH
04321 */
04322 INT db_get_link_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size, DWORD type)
04323 {
04324    if (rpc_is_remote())
04325       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_LINK_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, type);
04326 
04327 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04328    {
04329       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04330       KEY *pkey;
04331 
04332       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04333          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04334          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04335       }
04336 
04337       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04338          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04339          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04340       }
04341 
04342       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04343          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04344          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04345       }
04346 
04347       db_lock_database(hDB);
04348 
04349       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04350       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04351 
04352       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04353       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04354          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04355          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04356       }
04357 
04358       /* check for read access */
04359       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04360          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04361          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04362       }
04363 
04364       if (!pkey->type) {
04365          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04366          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key type %d", pkey->type);
04367          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04368       }
04369 
04370       if (pkey->type != type) {
04371          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04372          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04373                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04374          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04375       }
04376 
04377       /* keys cannot contain data */
04378       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04379          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04380          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04381          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04382       }
04383 
04384       /* check if key has data */
04385       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04386          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04387          *buf_size = 0;
04388          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04389          return DB_SUCCESS;
04390       }
04391 
04392       /* check if buffer is too small */
04393       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04394          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
04395          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04396          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04397          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04398       }
04399 
04400       /* copy key data */
04401       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
04402       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
04403 
04404       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04405 
04406    }
04407 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04408 
04409    return DB_SUCCESS;
04410 }
04411 
04412 /**dox***************************************************************/
04413 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04414 
04415 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04416 INT db_get_data1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size, DWORD type, INT * num_values)
04417 /********************************************************************\
04418 
04419   Routine: db_get_data1
04420 
04421   Purpose: Get key data from a handle, return number of values
04422 
04423   Input:
04424     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
04425     HNDLE  hKey             Handle of key
04426     INT    *buf_size        Size of data buffer
04427     DWORD  type             Type of data
04428 
04429   Output:
04430     void   *data            Key data
04431     INT    *buf_size        Size of key data
04432     INT    *num_values      Number of values
04433 
04434   Function value:
04435     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04436     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04437     DB_TRUNCATED            Return buffer is smaller than key data
04438     DB_TYPE_MISMATCH        Type mismatch
04439 
04440 \********************************************************************/
04441 {
04442    if (rpc_is_remote())
04443       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA1, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, type, num_values);
04444 
04445 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04446    {
04447       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04448       KEY *pkey;
04449 
04450       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04451          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04452          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04453       }
04454 
04455       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04456          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04457          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04458       }
04459 
04460       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04461          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04462          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04463       }
04464 
04465       db_lock_database(hDB);
04466 
04467       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04468       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04469 
04470       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04471       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04472          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04473          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04474       }
04475 
04476       /* check for read access */
04477       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04478          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04479          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04480       }
04481 
04482       if (!pkey->type) {
04483          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04484          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key type %d", pkey->type);
04485          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04486       }
04487 
04488       if (pkey->type != type) {
04489          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04490          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04491                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04492          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04493       }
04494 
04495       /* keys cannot contain data */
04496       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04497          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04498          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04499          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04500       }
04501 
04502       /* check if key has data */
04503       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04504          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04505          *buf_size = 0;
04506          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04507          return DB_SUCCESS;
04508       }
04509 
04510       /* check if buffer is too small */
04511       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04512          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
04513          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04514          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04515          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04516       }
04517 
04518       /* copy key data */
04519       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
04520       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
04521       *num_values = pkey->num_values;
04522 
04523       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04524 
04525    }
04526 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04527 
04528    return DB_SUCCESS;
04529 }
04530 
04531 /**dox***************************************************************/
04532 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04533 
04534 /********************************************************************/
04535 /**
04536 returns a single value of keys containing arrays of values.
04537 
04538 The function returns a single value of keys containing arrays of values.
04539 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
04540 @param hKey         Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
04541 @param data         Size of data buffer.
04542 @param buf_size     Return size of the record.
04543 @param idx          Index of array [0..n-1].
04544 @param type         Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
04545 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_OUT_OF_RANGE
04546 */
04547 INT db_get_data_index(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size, INT idx, DWORD type)
04548 {
04549    if (rpc_is_remote())
04550       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA_INDEX, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, idx, type);
04551 
04552 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04553    {
04554       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04555       KEY *pkey;
04556       char str[256];
04557 
04558       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04559          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04560          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04561       }
04562 
04563       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04564          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04565          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04566       }
04567 
04568       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04569          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04570          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04571       }
04572 
04573       db_lock_database(hDB);
04574 
04575       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04576       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04577 
04578       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04579       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04580          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04581          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04582       }
04583 
04584       /* check for read access */
04585       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04586          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04587          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04588       }
04589 
04590       if (!pkey->type) {
04591          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04592          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "invalid key type %d", pkey->type);
04593          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04594       }
04595 
04596       if (pkey->type != type) {
04597          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04598          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index",
04599                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04600          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04601       }
04602 
04603       /* keys cannot contain data */
04604       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04605          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04606          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "Key cannot contain data");
04607          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04608       }
04609 
04610       /* check if key has data */
04611       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04612          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04613          *buf_size = 0;
04614          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04615          return DB_SUCCESS;
04616       }
04617 
04618       /* check if index in range */
04619       if (idx < 0 || idx >= pkey->num_values) {
04620          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04621          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04622 
04623          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
04624          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index",
04625                 "index (%d) exceeds array length (%d) for key \"%s\"", idx, pkey->num_values, str);
04626          return DB_OUT_OF_RANGE;
04627       }
04628 
04629       /* check if buffer is too small */
04630       if (pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04631          /* copy data */
04632          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data + idx * pkey->item_size, *buf_size);
04633          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04634          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04635          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04636       }
04637 
04638       /* copy key data */
04639       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data + idx * pkey->item_size, pkey->item_size);
04640       *buf_size = pkey->item_size;
04641 
04642       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04643 
04644    }
04645 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04646 
04647    return DB_SUCCESS;
04648 }
04649 
04650 /********************************************************************/
04651 /**
04652 Set key data from a handle. Adjust number of values if
04653 previous data has different size.
04654 \code
04655 HNLDE hkey;
04656  INT   run_number;
04657  // get key handle for run number
04658  db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
04659  // set run number
04660  db_set_data(hDB, hkey, &run_number, sizeof(run_number),TID_INT);
04661 \endcode
04662 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
04663 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
04664 @param data Buffer from which data gets copied to.
04665 @param buf_size Size of data buffer.
04666 @param num_values Number of data values (for arrays).
04667 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
04668 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED
04669 */
04670 INT db_set_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const void *data, INT buf_size, INT num_values, DWORD type)
04671 {
04672    if (rpc_is_remote())
04673       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, num_values, type);
04674 
04675 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04676    {
04677       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04678       KEY *pkey;
04679       HNDLE hkeylink;
04680       int link_idx;
04681       char link_name[256];
04682 
04683       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04684          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04685          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04686       }
04687 
04688       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04689          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04690          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04691       }
04692 
04693       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04694          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid key handle");
04695          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04696       }
04697 
04698       if (num_values == 0)
04699          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04700 
04701       db_lock_database(hDB);
04702 
04703       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04704       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04705 
04706       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04707       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04708          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04709          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04710       }
04711 
04712       /* check for write access */
04713       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04714          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04715          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04716       }
04717 
04718       /* check for link to array index */
04719       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
04720          strlcpy(link_name, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, sizeof(link_name));
04721          if (strlen(link_name) > 0 && link_name[strlen(link_name) - 1] == ']') {
04722             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04723             if (strchr(link_name, '[') == NULL)
04724                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
04725             link_idx = atoi(strchr(link_name, '[') + 1);
04726             *strchr(link_name, '[') = 0;
04727             if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, link_name, &hkeylink) != DB_SUCCESS)
04728                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
04729             return db_set_data_index(hDB, hkeylink, data, buf_size, link_idx, type);
04730          }
04731       }
04732 
04733       if (pkey->type != type) {
04734          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04735          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04736                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04737          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04738       }
04739 
04740       /* keys cannot contain data */
04741       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04742          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04743          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04744          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04745       }
04746 
04747       /* if no buf_size given (Java!), calculate it */
04748       if (buf_size == 0)
04749          buf_size = pkey->item_size * num_values;
04750 
04751       /* resize data size if necessary */
04752       if (pkey->total_size != buf_size) {
04753          pkey->data = (POINTER_T) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size, buf_size);
04754 
04755          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04756             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04757             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "online database full");
04758             return DB_FULL;
04759          }
04760 
04761          pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
04762          pkey->total_size = buf_size;
04763       }
04764 
04765       /* set number of values */
04766       pkey->num_values = num_values;
04767       if (num_values)
04768          pkey->item_size = buf_size / num_values;
04769 
04770       /* copy data */
04771       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, data, buf_size);
04772 
04773       /* update time */
04774       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04775 
04776       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04777       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04778 
04779    }
04780 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04781 
04782    return DB_SUCCESS;
04783 }
04784 
04785 /********************************************************************/
04786 /**
04787 Same as db_set_data, but it does not follow a link to an array index
04788 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
04789 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
04790 @param data Buffer from which data gets copied to.
04791 @param buf_size Size of data buffer.
04792 @param num_values Number of data values (for arrays).
04793 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
04794 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED
04795 */
04796 INT db_set_link_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const void *data, INT buf_size, INT num_values, DWORD type)
04797 {
04798    if (rpc_is_remote())
04799       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_LINK_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, num_values, type);
04800 
04801 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04802    {
04803       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04804       KEY *pkey;
04805 
04806       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04807          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04808          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04809       }
04810 
04811       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04812          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04813          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04814       }
04815 
04816       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04817          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid key handle");
04818          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04819       }
04820 
04821       if (num_values == 0)
04822          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04823 
04824       db_lock_database(hDB);
04825 
04826       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04827       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04828 
04829       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04830       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04831          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04832          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04833       }
04834 
04835       /* check for write access */
04836       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04837          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04838          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04839       }
04840 
04841       if (pkey->type != type) {
04842          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04843          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_link_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04844                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04845          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04846       }
04847 
04848       /* keys cannot contain data */
04849       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04850          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04851          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_link_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04852          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04853       }
04854 
04855       /* if no buf_size given (Java!), calculate it */
04856       if (buf_size == 0)
04857          buf_size = pkey->item_size * num_values;
04858 
04859       /* resize data size if necessary */
04860       if (pkey->total_size != buf_size) {
04861          pkey->data = (POINTER_T) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size, buf_size);
04862 
04863          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04864             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04865             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_link_data", "online database full");
04866             return DB_FULL;
04867          }
04868 
04869          pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
04870          pkey->total_size = buf_size;
04871       }
04872 
04873       /* set number of values */
04874       pkey->num_values = num_values;
04875       if (num_values)
04876          pkey->item_size = buf_size / num_values;
04877 
04878       /* copy data */
04879       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, data, buf_size);
04880 
04881       /* update time */
04882       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04883 
04884       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04885       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04886 
04887    }
04888 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04889 
04890    return DB_SUCCESS;
04891 }
04892 
04893 /**dox***************************************************************/
04894 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04895 
04896 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04897 INT db_set_num_values(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT num_values)
04898 /********************************************************************\
04899 
04900   Routine: db_set_num_values
04901 
04902   Purpose: Set numbe of values in a key. Extend with zeros or truncate.
04903 
04904   Input:
04905     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
04906     HNDLE  hKey             Handle of key
04907     INT    num_values       Number of data values
04908 
04909   Output:
04910     none
04911 
04912   Function value:
04913     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04914     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04915 
04916 \********************************************************************/
04917 {
04918    if (rpc_is_remote())
04919       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_NUM_VALUES, hDB, hKey, num_values);
04920 
04921 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04922    {
04923       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04924       KEY *pkey;
04925       INT new_size;
04926 
04927       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04928          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "invalid database handle");
04929          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04930       }
04931 
04932       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04933          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "invalid database handle");
04934          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04935       }
04936 
04937       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04938          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "invalid key handle");
04939          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04940       }
04941 
04942       if (num_values <= 0) {
04943          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "invalid num_values %d", num_values);
04944          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04945       }
04946 
04947       if (num_values == 0)
04948          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04949 
04950       db_lock_database(hDB);
04951 
04952       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04953       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04954 
04955       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04956       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04957          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04958          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04959       }
04960 
04961       /* check for write access */
04962       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04963          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04964          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04965       }
04966 
04967       /* keys cannot contain data */
04968       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04969          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04970          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "Key cannot contain data");
04971          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04972       }
04973 
04974       if (pkey->total_size != pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values) {
04975          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04976          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "Corrupted key");
04977          return DB_CORRUPTED;
04978       }
04979 
04980       if (pkey->item_size == 0) {
04981          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04982          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "Cannot resize array with item_size equal to zero");
04983          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04984       }
04985 
04986       /* resize data size if necessary */
04987       if (pkey->num_values != num_values) {
04988          new_size = pkey->item_size * num_values;
04989 
04990          pkey->data = (POINTER_T) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size, new_size);
04991 
04992          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04993             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04994             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_num_values", "hkey %d, num_values %d, new_size %d, online database full", hKey, num_values, new_size);
04995             return DB_FULL;
04996          }
04997 
04998          pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
04999          pkey->total_size = new_size;
05000          pkey->num_values = num_values;
05001       }
05002 
05003       /* update time */
05004       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
05005 
05006       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
05007       db_unlock_database(hDB);
05008 
05009    }
05010 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05011 
05012    return DB_SUCCESS;
05013 }
05014 
05015 /**dox***************************************************************/
05016 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05017 
05018 /********************************************************************/
05019 /**
05020 Set key data for a key which contains an array of values.
05021 
05022 This function sets individual values of a key containing an array.
05023 If the index is larger than the array size, the array is extended and the intermediate
05024 values are set to zero.
05025 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
05026 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
05027 @param data Pointer to single value of data.
05028 @param data_size
05029 @param idx Size of single data element.
05030 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
05031 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH
05032 */
05033 INT db_set_data_index(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const void *data, INT data_size, INT idx, DWORD type)
05034 {
05035    if (rpc_is_remote())
05036       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_DATA_INDEX, hDB, hKey, data, data_size, idx, type);
05037 
05038 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05039    {
05040       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
05041       KEY *pkey;
05042       char link_name[256], str[256];
05043       int link_idx;
05044       HNDLE hkeylink;
05045 
05046       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
05047          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid database handle");
05048          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05049       }
05050 
05051       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
05052          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid database handle");
05053          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05054       }
05055 
05056       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
05057          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid key handle");
05058          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05059       }
05060 
05061       db_lock_database(hDB);
05062 
05063       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05064       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05065 
05066       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
05067       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
05068          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05069          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05070       }
05071 
05072       /* check for write access */
05073       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
05074          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05075          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
05076       }
05077 
05078       /* check for link to array index */
05079       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
05080          strlcpy(link_name, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, sizeof(link_name));
05081          if (strlen(link_name) > 0 && link_name[strlen(link_name) - 1] == ']') {
05082             db_unlock_database(hDB);
05083             if (strchr(link_name, '[') == NULL)
05084                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
05085             link_idx = atoi(strchr(link_name, '[') + 1);
05086             *strchr(link_name, '[') = 0;
05087             if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, link_name, &hkeylink) != DB_SUCCESS)
05088                return DB_INVALID_LINK;
05089             return db_set_data_index(hDB, hkeylink, data, data_size, link_idx, type);
05090          }
05091       }
05092 
05093       if (pkey->type != type) {
05094          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05095          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
05096          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index",
05097                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", str, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
05098          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05099       }
05100 
05101       /* keys cannot contain data */
05102       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
05103          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05104          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "key cannot contain data");
05105          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05106       }
05107 
05108       /* check for valid idx */
05109       if (idx < 0) {
05110          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05111          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid index %d", idx);
05112          return DB_FULL;
05113       }
05114 
05115       /* check for valid array element size: if new element size
05116          is different from existing size, ODB becomes corrupted */
05117       if (pkey->item_size != 0 && data_size != pkey->item_size) {
05118          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05119          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid element data size %d, expected %d", data_size, pkey->item_size);
05120          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05121       }
05122 
05123       /* increase data size if necessary */
05124       if (idx >= pkey->num_values || pkey->item_size == 0) {
05125          pkey->data =
05126              (POINTER_T) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size, data_size * (idx + 1));
05127 
05128          if (pkey->data == 0) {
05129             db_unlock_database(hDB);
05130             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "online database full");
05131             return DB_FULL;
05132          }
05133 
05134          pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
05135          if (!pkey->item_size)
05136             pkey->item_size = data_size;
05137          pkey->total_size = data_size * (idx + 1);
05138          pkey->num_values = idx + 1;
05139       }
05140 
05141       /* cut strings which are too long */
05142       if ((type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK) && (int) strlen((char *) data) + 1 > pkey->item_size)
05143          *((char *) data + pkey->item_size - 1) = 0;
05144 
05145       /* copy data */
05146       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data + idx * pkey->item_size, data, pkey->item_size);
05147 
05148       /* update time */
05149       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
05150 
05151       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
05152       db_unlock_database(hDB);
05153 
05154    }
05155 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05156 
05157    return DB_SUCCESS;
05158 }
05159 
05160 /********************************************************************/
05161 /**
05162 Same as db_set_data_index, but does not follow links.
05163 
05164 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
05165 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
05166 @param data Pointer to single value of data.
05167 @param data_size
05168 @param idx Size of single data element.
05169 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
05170 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH
05171 */
05172 INT db_set_link_data_index(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const void *data, INT data_size, INT idx, DWORD type)
05173 {
05174    if (rpc_is_remote())
05175       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_LINK_DATA_INDEX, hDB, hKey, data, data_size, idx, type);
05176 
05177 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05178    {
05179       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
05180       KEY *pkey;
05181       char str[256];
05182 
05183       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
05184          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid database handle");
05185          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05186       }
05187 
05188       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
05189          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid database handle");
05190          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05191       }
05192 
05193       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
05194          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid key handle");
05195          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05196       }
05197 
05198       db_lock_database(hDB);
05199 
05200       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05201       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05202 
05203       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
05204       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
05205          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05206          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05207       }
05208 
05209       /* check for write access */
05210       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
05211          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05212          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
05213       }
05214 
05215       if (pkey->type != type) {
05216          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05217          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
05218          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index",
05219                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", str, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
05220          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05221       }
05222 
05223       /* keys cannot contain data */
05224       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
05225          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05226          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "key cannot contain data");
05227          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05228       }
05229 
05230       /* check for valid array element size: if new element size
05231          is different from existing size, ODB becomes corrupted */
05232       if (pkey->item_size != 0 && data_size != pkey->item_size) {
05233          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05234          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid element data size %d, expected %d", data_size, pkey->item_size);
05235          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05236       }
05237 
05238       /* increase data size if necessary */
05239       if (idx >= pkey->num_values || pkey->item_size == 0) {
05240          pkey->data =
05241              (POINTER_T) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size, data_size * (idx + 1));
05242 
05243          if (pkey->data == 0) {
05244             db_unlock_database(hDB);
05245             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "online database full");
05246             return DB_FULL;
05247          }
05248 
05249          pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
05250          if (!pkey->item_size)
05251             pkey->item_size = data_size;
05252          pkey->total_size = data_size * (idx + 1);
05253          pkey->num_values = idx + 1;
05254       }
05255 
05256       /* cut strings which are too long */
05257       if ((type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK) && (int) strlen((char *) data) + 1 > pkey->item_size)
05258          *((char *) data + pkey->item_size - 1) = 0;
05259 
05260       /* copy data */
05261       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data + idx * pkey->item_size, data, pkey->item_size);
05262 
05263       /* update time */
05264       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
05265 
05266       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
05267       db_unlock_database(hDB);
05268 
05269    }
05270 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05271 
05272    return DB_SUCCESS;
05273 }
05274 
05275 /**dox***************************************************************/
05276 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
05277 
05278 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05279 INT db_set_data_index2(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const void *data, INT data_size, INT idx, DWORD type, BOOL bNotify)
05280 /********************************************************************\
05281 
05282   Routine: db_set_data_index2
05283 
05284   Purpose: Set key data for a key which contains an array of values.
05285            Optionally notify clients which have key open.
05286 
05287   Input:
05288     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
05289     HNDLE  hKey             Handle of key to enumerate
05290     void   *data            Pointer to single value of data
05291     INT    data_size        Size of single data element
05292     INT    idx              Index of array to change [0..n-1]
05293     DWORD  type             Type of data
05294     BOOL   bNotify          If TRUE, notify clients
05295 
05296   Output:
05297     none
05298 
05299   Function value:
05300     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05301     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
05302     DB_TYPE_MISMATCH        Key was created with different type
05303     DB_NO_ACCESS            No write access
05304 
05305 \********************************************************************/
05306 {
05307    if (rpc_is_remote())
05308       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_DATA_INDEX2, hDB, hKey, data, data_size, idx, type, bNotify);
05309 
05310 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05311    {
05312       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
05313       KEY *pkey;
05314 
05315       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
05316          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid database handle");
05317          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05318       }
05319 
05320       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
05321          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid database handle");
05322          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05323       }
05324 
05325       if (hKey < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
05326          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid key handle");
05327          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05328       }
05329 
05330       db_lock_database(hDB);
05331 
05332       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05333       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05334 
05335       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
05336       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
05337          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05338          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05339       }
05340 
05341       /* check for write access */
05342       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
05343          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05344          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
05345       }
05346 
05347       if (pkey->type != type) {
05348          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05349          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2",
05350                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
05351          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05352       }
05353 
05354       /* keys cannot contain data */
05355       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
05356          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05357          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "key cannot contain data");
05358          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
05359       }
05360 
05361       /* check for valid index */
05362       if (idx < 0) {
05363          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05364          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid index");
05365          return DB_FULL;
05366       }
05367 
05368       /* increase key size if necessary */
05369       if (idx >= pkey->num_values) {
05370          pkey->data =
05371              (POINTER_T) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size, data_size * (idx + 1));
05372 
05373          if (pkey->data == 0) {
05374             db_unlock_database(hDB);
05375             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "online database full");
05376             return DB_FULL;
05377          }
05378 
05379          pkey->data -= (POINTER_T) pheader;
05380          if (!pkey->item_size)
05381             pkey->item_size = data_size;
05382          pkey->total_size = data_size * (idx + 1);
05383          pkey->num_values = idx + 1;
05384       }
05385 
05386       /* cut strings which are too long */
05387       if ((type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK) && (int) strlen((char *) data) + 1 > pkey->item_size)
05388          *((char *) data + pkey->item_size - 1) = 0;
05389 
05390       /* copy data */
05391       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data + idx * pkey->item_size, data, pkey->item_size);
05392 
05393       /* update time */
05394       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
05395 
05396       if (bNotify)
05397          db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
05398 
05399       db_unlock_database(hDB);
05400    }
05401 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05402 
05403    return DB_SUCCESS;
05404 }
05405 
05406 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05407 
05408 INT db_merge_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, const char *name, void *data, INT data_size, INT num_values, INT type)
05409 /********************************************************************\
05410 
05411   Routine: db_merge_data
05412 
05413   Purpose: Merge an array with an ODB array. If the ODB array doesn't
05414            exist, create it and fill it with the array. If it exists,
05415            load it in the array. Adjust ODB array size if necessary.
05416 
05417   Input:
05418     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
05419     HNDLE  hKeyRoot         Key handle to start with, 0 for root
05420     cha    *name            Key name relative to hKeyRoot
05421     void   *data            Pointer to data array
05422     INT    data_size        Size of data array
05423     INT    num_values       Number of values in array
05424     DWORD  type             Type of data
05425 
05426   Output:
05427     none
05428 
05429   Function value:
05430     <same as db_set_data>
05431 
05432 \********************************************************************/
05433 {
05434    HNDLE hKey;
05435    INT status, old_size;
05436 
05437    if (num_values == 0)
05438       return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
05439 
05440    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, &hKey);
05441    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
05442       db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, type);
05443       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, &hKey);
05444       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, data_size, num_values, type);
05445    } else {
05446       old_size = data_size;
05447       db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, &old_size, type);
05448       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, data_size, num_values, type);
05449    }
05450 
05451    return status;
05452 }
05453 
05454 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05455 INT db_set_mode(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, WORD mode, BOOL recurse)
05456 /********************************************************************\
05457 
05458   Routine: db_set_mode
05459 
05460   Purpose: Set access mode of key
05461 
05462   Input:
05463     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
05464     HNDLE  hKey             Key handle
05465     DWORD  mode             Access mode, any or'ed combination of
05466                             MODE_READ, MODE_WRITE, MODE_EXCLUSIVE
05467                             and MODE_DELETE
05468     BOOL   recurse          Value of 0 (FALSE): do not recurse subtree,
05469                             value of 1 (TRUE): recurse subtree,
05470                             value of 2: recurse subtree, assume database is locked by caller.
05471 
05472   Output:
05473     none
05474 
05475   Function value:
05476     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05477     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
05478 
05479 \********************************************************************/
05480 {
05481    if (rpc_is_remote())
05482       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_MODE, hDB, hKey, mode, recurse);
05483 
05484 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05485    {
05486       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
05487       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
05488       KEY *pkey, *pnext_key;
05489       HNDLE hKeyLink;
05490       BOOL locked = FALSE;
05491 
05492       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
05493          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_mode", "invalid database handle");
05494          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05495       }
05496 
05497       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
05498          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_mode", "invalid database handle");
05499          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05500       }
05501 
05502       if (recurse < 2) {
05503          db_lock_database(hDB);
05504          locked = TRUE;
05505       }
05506 
05507       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05508       if (!hKey)
05509          hKey = pheader->root_key;
05510       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05511 
05512       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
05513       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
05514          if (locked)
05515             db_unlock_database(hDB);
05516          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05517       }
05518 
05519       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
05520 
05521       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY && pkeylist->first_key && recurse) {
05522          /* first recurse subtree */
05523          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
05524 
05525          do {
05526             pnext_key = (KEY *) (POINTER_T) pkey->next_key;
05527 
05528             db_set_mode(hDB, (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader, mode, recurse + 1);
05529 
05530             if (pnext_key)
05531                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + (POINTER_T) pnext_key);
05532          } while (pnext_key);
05533       }
05534 
05535       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05536 
05537       /* resolve links */
05538       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
05539          if (*((char *) pheader + pkey->data) == '/')
05540             db_find_key1(hDB, 0, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
05541          else
05542             db_find_key1(hDB, hKey, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
05543          if (hKeyLink)
05544             db_set_mode(hDB, hKeyLink, mode, recurse > 0);
05545          pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05546          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05547       }
05548 
05549       /* now set mode */
05550       pkey->access_mode = mode;
05551 
05552       if (locked)
05553          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05554    }
05555 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05556 
05557    return DB_SUCCESS;
05558 }
05559 
05560 /**dox***************************************************************/
05561 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05562 
05563 /********************************************************************/
05564 /**
05565 Load a branch of a database from an .ODB file.
05566 
05567 This function is used by the ODBEdit command load. For a
05568 description of the ASCII format, see db_copy(). Data can be loaded relative to
05569 the root of the ODB (hkey equal zero) or relative to a certain key.
05570 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
05571 @param hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
05572 @param filename Filename of .ODB file.
05573 @param bRemote If TRUE, the file is loaded by the server process on the
05574 back-end, if FALSE, it is loaded from the current process
05575 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_FILE_ERROR
05576 */
05577 INT db_load(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, const char *filename, BOOL bRemote)
05578 {
05579    struct stat stat_buf;
05580    INT hfile, size, n, i, status;
05581    char *buffer;
05582 
05583    if (rpc_is_remote() && bRemote)
05584       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_LOAD, hDB, hKeyRoot, filename);
05585 
05586    /* open file */
05587    hfile = open(filename, O_RDONLY | O_TEXT, 0644);
05588    if (hfile == -1) {
05589       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_load", "file \"%s\" not found", filename);
05590       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
05591    }
05592 
05593    /* allocate buffer with file size */
05594    fstat(hfile, &stat_buf);
05595    size = stat_buf.st_size;
05596    buffer = (char *) malloc(size + 1);
05597 
05598    if (buffer == NULL) {
05599       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_load", "cannot allocate ODB load buffer");
05600       close(hfile);
05601       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05602    }
05603 
05604    n = 0;
05605 
05606    do {
05607       i = read(hfile, buffer + n, size - n);
05608       if (i <= 0)
05609          break;
05610       n += i;
05611    } while (TRUE);
05612 
05613    buffer[n] = 0;
05614 
05615    if (strncmp(buffer, "<?xml version=\"1.0\"", 19) == 0) {
05616       status = db_paste_xml(hDB, hKeyRoot, buffer);
05617       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05618          printf("Error in file \"%s\"\n", filename);
05619    } else
05620       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyRoot, buffer);
05621 
05622    close(hfile);
05623    free(buffer);
05624 
05625    return status;
05626 }
05627 
05628 /********************************************************************/
05629 /**
05630 Copy an ODB subtree in ASCII format to a buffer
05631 
05632 This function converts the binary ODB contents to an ASCII.
05633 The function db_paste() can be used to convert the ASCII representation back
05634 to binary ODB contents. The functions db_load() and db_save() internally
05635 use db_copy() and db_paste(). This function converts the binary ODB
05636 contents to an ASCII representation of the form:
05637 - For single value:
05638 \code
05639 [ODB path]
05640  key name = type : value
05641 \endcode
05642 - For strings:
05643 \code
05644 key name = STRING : [size] string contents
05645 \endcode
05646 - For arrayes (type can be BYTE, SBYTE, CHAR, WORD, SHORT, DWORD,
05647 INT, BOOL, FLOAT, DOUBLE, STRING or LINK):
05648 \code
05649 key name = type[size] :
05650  [0] value0
05651  [1] value1
05652  [2] value2
05653  ...
05654 \endcode
05655 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
05656 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
05657 @param buffer ASCII buffer which receives ODB contents.
05658 @param buffer_size Size of buffer, returns remaining space in buffer.
05659 @param path Internal use only, must be empty ("").
05660 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_NO_MEMORY
05661 */
05662 INT db_copy(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *buffer, INT * buffer_size, char *path)
05663 {
05664    INT i, j, size, status;
05665    KEY key;
05666    HNDLE hSubkey;
05667    char full_path[MAX_ODB_PATH], str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH * 2];
05668    char *data, line[MAX_STRING_LENGTH * 2];
05669    BOOL bWritten;
05670 
05671    strcpy(full_path, path);
05672 
05673    bWritten = FALSE;
05674 
05675    /* first enumerate this level */
05676    for (i = 0;; i++) {
05677       db_enum_link(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
05678 
05679       if (i == 0 && !hSubkey) {
05680          /* If key has no subkeys, just write this key */
05681          status = db_get_link(hDB, hKey, &key);
05682          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05683             continue;
05684          size = key.total_size;
05685          data = (char *) malloc(size);
05686          if (data == NULL) {
05687             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_copy", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05688             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05689          }
05690          line[0] = 0;
05691 
05692          if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
05693             status = db_get_link_data(hDB, hKey, data, &size, key.type);
05694             if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05695                continue;
05696             if (key.num_values == 1) {
05697                sprintf(line, "%s = %s : ", key.name, tid_name[key.type]);
05698 
05699                if (key.type == TID_STRING && strchr(data, '\n') != NULL) {
05700                   /* multiline string */
05701                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[====#$@$#====]\n");
05702 
05703                   /* copy line to buffer */
05704                   if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05705                      free(data);
05706                      return DB_TRUNCATED;
05707                   }
05708 
05709                   strcpy(buffer, line);
05710                   buffer += strlen(line);
05711                   *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05712 
05713                   /* copy multiple lines to buffer */
05714                   if (key.item_size > *buffer_size) {
05715                      free(data);
05716                      return DB_TRUNCATED;
05717                   }
05718 
05719                   strcpy(buffer, data);
05720                   buffer += strlen(data);
05721                   *buffer_size -= strlen(data);
05722 
05723                   strcpy(line, "\n====#$@$#====\n");
05724                } else {
05725                   db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, 0, key.type);
05726 
05727                   if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05728                      sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05729 
05730                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05731                }
05732             } else {
05733                sprintf(line, "%s = %s[%d] :\n", key.name, tid_name[key.type], key.num_values);
05734 
05735                for (j = 0; j < key.num_values; j++) {
05736                   if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05737                      sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05738                   else
05739                      sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", j);
05740 
05741                   db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, j, key.type);
05742                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05743 
05744                   /* copy line to buffer */
05745                   if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05746                      free(data);
05747                      return DB_TRUNCATED;
05748                   }
05749 
05750                   strcpy(buffer, line);
05751                   buffer += strlen(line);
05752                   *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05753                   line[0] = 0;
05754                }
05755             }
05756          }
05757 
05758          /* copy line to buffer */
05759          if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05760             free(data);
05761             return DB_TRUNCATED;
05762          }
05763 
05764          strcpy(buffer, line);
05765          buffer += strlen(line);
05766          *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05767 
05768          free(data);
05769       }
05770 
05771       if (!hSubkey)
05772          break;
05773 
05774       status = db_get_link(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
05775       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05776          continue;
05777 
05778       if (strcmp(key.name, "arr2") == 0)
05779          printf("\narr2\n");
05780       size = key.total_size;
05781       data = (char *) malloc(size);
05782       if (data == NULL) {
05783          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_copy", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05784          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05785       }
05786 
05787       line[0] = 0;
05788 
05789       if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
05790          /* new line */
05791          if (bWritten) {
05792             if (*buffer_size < 2) {
05793                free(data);
05794                return DB_TRUNCATED;
05795             }
05796 
05797             strcpy(buffer, "\n");
05798             buffer += 1;
05799             *buffer_size -= 1;
05800          }
05801 
05802          strcpy(str, full_path);
05803          if (str[0] && str[strlen(str) - 1] != '/')
05804             strcat(str, "/");
05805          strcat(str, key.name);
05806 
05807          /* recurse */
05808          status = db_copy(hDB, hSubkey, buffer, buffer_size, str);
05809          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
05810             free(data);
05811             return status;
05812          }
05813 
05814          buffer += strlen(buffer);
05815          bWritten = FALSE;
05816       } else {
05817          status = db_get_link_data(hDB, hSubkey, data, &size, key.type);
05818          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05819             continue;
05820 
05821          if (!bWritten) {
05822             if (path[0] == 0)
05823                sprintf(line, "[.]\n");
05824             else
05825                sprintf(line, "[%s]\n", path);
05826             bWritten = TRUE;
05827          }
05828 
05829          if (key.num_values == 1) {
05830             sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s = %s : ", key.name, tid_name[key.type]);
05831 
05832             if (key.type == TID_STRING && strchr(data, '\n') != NULL) {
05833                /* multiline string */
05834                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[====#$@$#====]\n");
05835 
05836                /* ensure string limiter */
05837                data[size - 1] = 0;
05838 
05839                /* copy line to buffer */
05840                if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05841                   free(data);
05842                   return DB_TRUNCATED;
05843                }
05844 
05845                strcpy(buffer, line);
05846                buffer += strlen(line);
05847                *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05848 
05849                /* copy multiple lines to buffer */
05850                if (key.item_size > *buffer_size) {
05851                   free(data);
05852                   return DB_TRUNCATED;
05853                }
05854 
05855                strcpy(buffer, data);
05856                buffer += strlen(data);
05857                *buffer_size -= strlen(data);
05858 
05859                strcpy(line, "\n====#$@$#====\n");
05860             } else {
05861                db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, 0, key.type);
05862 
05863                if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05864                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05865 
05866                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05867             }
05868          } else {
05869             sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s = %s[%d] :\n", key.name, tid_name[key.type], key.num_values);
05870 
05871             for (j = 0; j < key.num_values; j++) {
05872                if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05873                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05874                else
05875                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", j);
05876 
05877                db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, j, key.type);
05878                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05879 
05880                /* copy line to buffer */
05881                if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05882                   free(data);
05883                   return DB_TRUNCATED;
05884                }
05885 
05886                strcpy(buffer, line);
05887                buffer += strlen(line);
05888                *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05889                line[0] = 0;
05890             }
05891          }
05892 
05893          /* copy line to buffer */
05894          if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05895             free(data);
05896             return DB_TRUNCATED;
05897          }
05898 
05899          strcpy(buffer, line);
05900          buffer += strlen(line);
05901          *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05902       }
05903 
05904       free(data);
05905    }
05906 
05907    if (bWritten) {
05908       if (*buffer_size < 2)
05909          return DB_TRUNCATED;
05910 
05911       strcpy(buffer, "\n");
05912       buffer += 1;
05913       *buffer_size -= 1;
05914    }
05915 
05916    return DB_SUCCESS;
05917 }
05918 
05919 /********************************************************************/
05920 /**
05921 Copy an ODB subtree in ASCII format from a buffer
05922 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
05923 @param hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
05924 @param buffer NULL-terminated buffer
05925 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_NO_MEMORY
05926 */
05927 INT db_paste(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, const char *buffer)
05928 {
05929    char line[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05930    char title[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05931    char key_name[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05932    char data_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH + 50];
05933    char test_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05934    char *pc, *data;
05935    const char *pold;
05936    INT data_size;
05937    INT tid, i, j, n_data, string_length, status, size;
05938    HNDLE hKey;
05939    KEY root_key;
05940    BOOL multi_line;
05941 
05942    title[0] = 0;
05943    multi_line = FALSE;
05944 
05945    if (hKeyRoot == 0)
05946       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, "", &hKeyRoot);
05947 
05948    db_get_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, &root_key);
05949 
05950    /* initial data size */
05951    data_size = 1000;
05952    data = (char *) malloc(data_size);
05953    if (data == NULL) {
05954       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05955       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05956    }
05957 
05958    do {
05959       if (*buffer == 0)
05960          break;
05961 
05962       for (i = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer && i < MAX_STRING_LENGTH; i++)
05963          line[i] = *buffer++;
05964 
05965       if (i == MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
05966          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "line too long");
05967          free(data);
05968          return DB_TRUNCATED;
05969       }
05970 
05971       line[i] = 0;
05972       if (*buffer == '\n')
05973          buffer++;
05974 
05975       /* check if it is a section title */
05976       if (line[0] == '[') {
05977          /* extract title and append '/' */
05978          strlcpy(title, line + 1, sizeof(title));
05979          if (strchr(title, ']'))
05980             *strchr(title, ']') = 0;
05981          if (title[0] && title[strlen(title) - 1] != '/')
05982             strlcat(title, "/", sizeof(title));
05983       } else {
05984          /* valid data line if it includes '=' and no ';' */
05985          if (strchr(line, '=') && line[0] != ';') {
05986             /* copy type info and data */
05987             pc = strrchr(line, '=') + 1;
05988             while (strstr(line, ": [") != NULL && strstr(line, ": [") < pc) {
05989                pc -= 2;
05990                while (*pc != '=' && pc > line)
05991                   pc--;
05992                pc++;
05993             }
05994             while (*pc == ' ')
05995                pc++;
05996             strlcpy(data_str, pc, sizeof(data_str));
05997 
05998             /* extract key name */
05999             *strrchr(line, '=') = 0;
06000             while (strstr(line, ": [") && strchr(line, '='))
06001                *strrchr(line, '=') = 0;
06002 
06003             pc = &line[strlen(line) - 1];
06004             while (*pc == ' ')
06005                *pc-- = 0;
06006 
06007             key_name[0] = 0;
06008             if (title[0] != '.')
06009                strlcpy(key_name, title, sizeof(key_name));
06010 
06011             strlcat(key_name, line, sizeof(key_name));
06012 
06013             /* evaluate type info */
06014             strlcpy(line, data_str, sizeof(line));
06015             if (strchr(line, ' '))
06016                *strchr(line, ' ') = 0;
06017 
06018             n_data = 1;
06019             if (strchr(line, '[')) {
06020                n_data = atol(strchr(line, '[') + 1);
06021                *strchr(line, '[') = 0;
06022             }
06023 
06024             for (tid = 0; tid < TID_LAST; tid++)
06025                if (strcmp(tid_name[tid], line) == 0)
06026                   break;
06027 
06028             string_length = 0;
06029 
06030             if (tid == TID_LAST)
06031                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "found unknown data type \"%s\" in ODB file", line);
06032             else {
06033                /* skip type info */
06034                pc = data_str;
06035                while (*pc != ' ' && *pc)
06036                   pc++;
06037                while ((*pc == ' ' || *pc == ':') && *pc)
06038                   pc++;
06039                strlcpy(data_str, pc, sizeof(data_str));
06040 
06041                if (n_data > 1) {
06042                   data_str[0] = 0;
06043                   if (!*buffer)
06044                      break;
06045 
06046                   for (j = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer; j++)
06047                      data_str[j] = *buffer++;
06048                   data_str[j] = 0;
06049                   if (*buffer == '\n')
06050                      buffer++;
06051                }
06052 
06053                for (i = 0; i < n_data; i++) {
06054                   /* strip trailing \n */
06055                   pc = &data_str[strlen(data_str) - 1];
06056                   while (*pc == '\n' || *pc == '\r')
06057                      *pc-- = 0;
06058 
06059                   if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
06060                      if (!string_length) {
06061                         if (data_str[1] == '=')
06062                            string_length = -1;
06063                         else
06064                            string_length = atoi(data_str + 1);
06065                         if (string_length > MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
06066                            string_length = MAX_STRING_LENGTH;
06067                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "found string exceeding MAX_STRING_LENGTH");
06068                         }
06069                      }
06070 
06071                      if (string_length == -1) {
06072                         /* multi-line string */
06073                         if (strstr(buffer, "\n====#$@$#====\n") != NULL) {
06074                            string_length = (POINTER_T) strstr(buffer, "\n====#$@$#====\n") - (POINTER_T) buffer + 1;
06075 
06076                            if (string_length >= data_size) {
06077                               data_size += string_length + 100;
06078                               data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
06079                               if (data == NULL) {
06080                                  cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
06081                                  return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06082                               }
06083                            }
06084 
06085                            memset(data, 0, data_size);
06086                            strncpy(data, buffer, string_length);
06087                            data[string_length - 1] = 0;
06088                            buffer = strstr(buffer, "\n====#$@$#====\n") + strlen("\n====#$@$#====\n");
06089                         } else
06090                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "found multi-line string without termination sequence");
06091                      } else {
06092                         pc = data_str + 2;
06093                         while (*pc && *pc != ' ')
06094                            pc++;
06095                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
06096                            pc++;
06097 
06098                         /* limit string size */
06099                         *(pc + string_length - 1) = 0;
06100 
06101                         /* increase data buffer if necessary */
06102                         if (string_length * (i + 1) >= data_size) {
06103                            data_size += 1000;
06104                            data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
06105                            if (data == NULL) {
06106                               cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
06107                               return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06108                            }
06109                         }
06110 
06111                         strlcpy(data + string_length * i, pc, string_length);
06112                      }
06113                   } else {
06114                      pc = data_str;
06115 
06116                      if (n_data > 1 && data_str[0] == '[') {
06117                         pc = strchr(data_str, ']') + 1;
06118                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
06119                            pc++;
06120                      }
06121 
06122                      db_sscanf(pc, data, &size, i, tid);
06123 
06124                      /* increase data buffer if necessary */
06125                      if (size * (i + 1) >= data_size) {
06126                         data_size += 1000;
06127                         data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
06128                         if (data == NULL) {
06129                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
06130                            return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06131                         }
06132                      }
06133 
06134                   }
06135 
06136                   if (i < n_data - 1) {
06137                      data_str[0] = 0;
06138                      if (!*buffer)
06139                         break;
06140 
06141                      pold = buffer;
06142 
06143                      for (j = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer; j++)
06144                         data_str[j] = *buffer++;
06145                      data_str[j] = 0;
06146                      if (*buffer == '\n')
06147                         buffer++;
06148 
06149                      /* test if valid data */
06150                      if (tid != TID_STRING && tid != TID_LINK) {
06151                         if (data_str[0] == 0 || (strchr(data_str, '=')
06152                                                  && strchr(data_str, ':')))
06153                            buffer = pold;
06154                      }
06155                   }
06156                }
06157 
06158                /* skip system client entries */
06159                strcpy(test_str, key_name);
06160                test_str[15] = 0;
06161 
06162                if (!equal_ustring(test_str, "/System/Clients")) {
06163                   if (root_key.type != TID_KEY) {
06164                      /* root key is destination key */
06165                      hKey = hKeyRoot;
06166                   } else {
06167                      /* create key and set value */
06168                      if (key_name[0] == '/') {
06169                         status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, key_name, &hKey);
06170                         if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
06171                            db_create_key(hDB, 0, key_name, tid);
06172                            status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, key_name, &hKey);
06173                         }
06174                      } else {
06175                         status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
06176                         if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
06177                            db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, tid);
06178                            status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
06179                         }
06180                      }
06181                   }
06182 
06183                   /* set key data if created sucessfully */
06184                   if (hKey) {
06185                      if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
06186                         db_set_link_data(hDB, hKey, data, string_length * n_data, n_data, tid);
06187                      else
06188                         db_set_link_data(hDB, hKey, data, rpc_tid_size(tid) * n_data, n_data, tid);
06189                   }
06190                }
06191             }
06192          }
06193       }
06194    } while (TRUE);
06195 
06196    free(data);
06197    return DB_SUCCESS;
06198 }
06199 
06200 /********************************************************************/
06201 /* 
06202   Only internally used by db_paste_xml                             
06203 */
06204 int db_paste_node(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, PMXML_NODE node)
06205 {
06206    char type[256], data[256], test_str[256], buf[10000];
06207    int i, status, size, tid, num_values;
06208    HNDLE hKey;
06209    PMXML_NODE child;
06210 
06211    if (strcmp(mxml_get_name(node), "odb") == 0) {
06212       for (i = 0; i < mxml_get_number_of_children(node); i++) {
06213          status = db_paste_node(hDB, hKeyRoot, mxml_subnode(node, i));
06214          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06215             return status;
06216       }
06217    } else if (strcmp(mxml_get_name(node), "dir") == 0) {
06218       status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), &hKey);
06219 
06220       /* skip system client entries */
06221       strlcpy(test_str, mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), sizeof(test_str));
06222       test_str[15] = 0;
06223       if (equal_ustring(test_str, "/System/Clients"))
06224          return DB_SUCCESS;
06225 
06226       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
06227          status = db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), TID_KEY);
06228          if (status == DB_NO_ACCESS)
06229             return DB_SUCCESS;  /* key or tree is locked, just skip it */
06230 
06231          if (status != DB_SUCCESS && status != DB_KEY_EXIST) {
06232             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste_node",
06233                    "cannot create key \"%s\" in ODB, status = %d", mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), status);
06234             return status;
06235          }
06236          status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), &hKey);
06237          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
06238             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste_node", "cannot find key \"%s\" in ODB", mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"));
06239             return status;
06240          }
06241       }
06242 
06243       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, data, sizeof(data));
06244       if (strncmp(data, "/System/Clients", 15) != 0) {
06245          for (i = 0; i < mxml_get_number_of_children(node); i++) {
06246             status = db_paste_node(hDB, hKey, mxml_subnode(node, i));
06247             if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06248                return status;
06249          }
06250       }
06251    } else if (strcmp(mxml_get_name(node), "key") == 0 || strcmp(mxml_get_name(node), "keyarray") == 0) {
06252 
06253       if (strcmp(mxml_get_name(node), "keyarray") == 0)
06254          num_values = atoi(mxml_get_attribute(node, "num_values"));
06255       else
06256          num_values = 0;
06257 
06258       if (mxml_get_attribute(node, "type") == NULL) {
06259          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste_node", "found key \"%s\" with no type in XML data", mxml_get_name(node));
06260          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
06261       }
06262 
06263       strlcpy(type, mxml_get_attribute(node, "type"), sizeof(type));
06264       for (tid = 0; tid < TID_LAST; tid++)
06265          if (strcmp(tid_name[tid], type) == 0)
06266             break;
06267       if (tid == TID_LAST) {
06268          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste_node", "found unknown data type \"%s\" in XML data", type);
06269          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
06270       }
06271 
06272       status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), &hKey);
06273       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
06274          status = db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), tid);
06275          if (status == DB_NO_ACCESS)
06276             return DB_SUCCESS;  /* key or tree is locked, just skip it */
06277 
06278          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
06279             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste_node",
06280                    "cannot create key \"%s\" in ODB, status = %d", mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), status);
06281             return status;
06282          }
06283          status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"), &hKey);
06284          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
06285             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste_node",
06286                    "cannot find key \"%s\" in ODB, status = %d", mxml_get_attribute(node, "name"));
06287             return status;
06288          }
06289       }
06290 
06291       if (num_values) {
06292          /* evaluate array */
06293          for (i = 0; i < mxml_get_number_of_children(node); i++) {
06294             child = mxml_subnode(node, i);
06295             if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
06296                size = atoi(mxml_get_attribute(node, "size"));
06297                if (mxml_get_value(child) == NULL)
06298                   db_set_data_index(hDB, hKey, "", size, i, tid);
06299                else {
06300                   strlcpy(buf, mxml_get_value(child), sizeof(buf));
06301                   db_set_data_index(hDB, hKey, buf, size, i, tid);
06302                }
06303             } else {
06304                db_sscanf(mxml_get_value(child), data, &size, 0, tid);
06305                db_set_data_index(hDB, hKey, data, rpc_tid_size(tid), i, tid);
06306             }
06307          }
06308 
06309       } else {                  /* single value */
06310          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
06311             size = atoi(mxml_get_attribute(node, "size"));
06312             if (mxml_get_value(node) == NULL)
06313                db_set_data(hDB, hKey, "", size, 1, tid);
06314             else
06315                db_set_data(hDB, hKey, mxml_get_value(node), size, 1, tid);
06316          } else {
06317             db_sscanf(mxml_get_value(node), data, &size, 0, tid);
06318             db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, rpc_tid_size(tid), 1, tid);
06319          }
06320       }
06321    }
06322 
06323    return DB_SUCCESS;
06324 }
06325 
06326 /********************************************************************/
06327 /**
06328 Paste an ODB subtree in XML format from a buffer
06329 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
