06330 @param hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
06331 @param buffer NULL-terminated buffer
06332 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_PARAM, DB_NO_MEMORY, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH
06333 */
06334 INT db_paste_xml(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, const char *buffer)
06335 {
06336    char error[256];
06337    INT status;
06338    PMXML_NODE tree, node;
06339 
06340    if (hKeyRoot == 0)
06341       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, "", &hKeyRoot);
06342 
06343    /* parse XML buffer */
06344    tree = mxml_parse_buffer(buffer, error, sizeof(error), NULL);
06345    if (tree == NULL) {
06346       puts(error);
06347       return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
06348    }
06349 
06350    node = mxml_find_node(tree, "odb");
06351    if (node == NULL) {
06352       puts("Cannot find element \"odb\" in XML data");
06353       return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
06354    }
06355 
06356    status = db_paste_node(hDB, hKeyRoot, node);
06357 
06358    mxml_free_tree(tree);
06359 
06360    return status;
06361 }
06362 
06363 /********************************************************************/
06364 /**
06365 Copy an ODB subtree in XML format to a buffer
06366 
06367 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
06368 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
06369 @param buffer ASCII buffer which receives ODB contents.
06370 @param buffer_size Size of buffer, returns remaining space in buffer.
06371 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_NO_MEMORY
06372 */
06373 INT db_copy_xml(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *buffer, INT * buffer_size)
06374 {
06375 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06376    {
06377       INT len;
06378       char *p, str[256];
06379       MXML_WRITER *writer;
06380 
06381       /* open file */
06382       writer = mxml_open_buffer();
06383       if (writer == NULL) {
06384          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_copy_xml", "Cannot allocate buffer");
06385          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06386       }
06387 
06388       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
06389 
06390       /* write XML header */
06391       mxml_start_element(writer, "odb");
06392       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "root", str);
06393       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "xmlns:xsi", "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance");
06394       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation", "http://midas.psi.ch/odb.xsd");
06395 
06396       db_save_xml_key(hDB, hKey, 0, writer);
06397 
06398       mxml_end_element(writer); // "odb"
06399       p = mxml_close_buffer(writer);
06400 
06401       strlcpy(buffer, p, *buffer_size);
06402       len = strlen(p);
06403       free(p);
06404       if (len > *buffer_size) {
06405          *buffer_size = 0;
06406          return DB_TRUNCATED;
06407       }
06408 
06409       *buffer_size -= len;
06410    }
06411 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06412 
06413    return DB_SUCCESS;
06414 }
06415 
06416 /**dox***************************************************************/
06417 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
06418 
06419 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06420 void name2c(char *str)
06421 /********************************************************************\
06422 
06423   Routine: name2c
06424 
06425   Purpose: Convert key name to C name. Internal use only.
06426 
06427 \********************************************************************/
06428 {
06429    if (*str >= '0' && *str <= '9')
06430       *str = '_';
06431 
06432    while (*str) {
06433       if (!(*str >= 'a' && *str <= 'z') && !(*str >= 'A' && *str <= 'Z') && !(*str >= '0' && *str <= '9'))
06434          *str = '_';
06435       *str = (char) tolower(*str);
06436       str++;
06437    }
06438 }
06439 
06440 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06441 static void db_save_tree_struct(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, int hfile, INT level)
06442 /********************************************************************\
06443 
06444   Routine: db_save_tree_struct
06445 
06446   Purpose: Save database tree as a C structure. Gets called by
06447            db_save_struct(). Internal use only.
06448 
06449 \********************************************************************/
06450 {
06451    INT i, idx;
06452    KEY key;
06453    HNDLE hSubkey;
06454    char line[MAX_ODB_PATH], str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
06455 
06456    /* first enumerate this level */
06457    for (idx = 0;; idx++) {
06458       db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, idx, &hSubkey);
06459 
06460       if (!hSubkey)
06461          break;
06462 
06463       db_get_key(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
06464 
06465       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
06466          for (i = 0; i <= level; i++)
06467             write(hfile, "  ", 2);
06468 
06469          switch (key.type) {
06470          case TID_SBYTE:
06471          case TID_CHAR:
06472             strcpy(line, "char");
06473             break;
06474          case TID_SHORT:
06475             strcpy(line, "short");
06476             break;
06477          case TID_FLOAT:
06478             strcpy(line, "float");
06479             break;
06480          case TID_DOUBLE:
06481             strcpy(line, "double");
06482             break;
06483          case TID_BITFIELD:
06484             strcpy(line, "unsigned char");
06485             break;
06486          case TID_STRING:
06487             strcpy(line, "char");
06488             break;
06489          case TID_LINK:
06490             strcpy(line, "char");
06491             break;
06492          default:
06493             strcpy(line, tid_name[key.type]);
06494             break;
06495          }
06496 
06497          strcat(line, "                    ");
06498          strcpy(str, key.name);
06499          name2c(str);
06500 
06501          if (key.num_values > 1)
06502             sprintf(str + strlen(str), "[%d]", key.num_values);
06503          if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
06504             sprintf(str + strlen(str), "[%d]", key.item_size);
06505 
06506          strcpy(line + 10, str);
06507          strcat(line, ";\n");
06508 
06509          write(hfile, line, strlen(line));
06510       } else {
06511          /* recurse subtree */
06512          for (i = 0; i <= level; i++)
06513             write(hfile, "  ", 2);
06514 
06515          sprintf(line, "struct {\n");
06516          write(hfile, line, strlen(line));
06517          db_save_tree_struct(hDB, hSubkey, hfile, level + 1);
06518 
06519          for (i = 0; i <= level; i++)
06520             write(hfile, "  ", 2);
06521 
06522          strcpy(str, key.name);
06523          name2c(str);
06524 
06525          sprintf(line, "} %s;\n", str);
06526          write(hfile, line, strlen(line));
06527       }
06528    }
06529 }
06530 
06531 /**dox***************************************************************/
06532 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
06533 
06534 /********************************************************************/
06535 /**
06536 Save a branch of a database to an .ODB file
06537 
06538 This function is used by the ODBEdit command save. For a
06539 description of the ASCII format, see db_copy(). Data of the whole ODB can
06540 be saved (hkey equal zero) or only a sub-tree.
06541 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
06542 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
06543 @param filename Filename of .ODB file.
06544 @param bRemote Flag for saving database on remote server.
06545 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_FILE_ERROR
06546 */
06547 INT db_save(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *filename, BOOL bRemote)
06548 {
06549    if (rpc_is_remote() && bRemote)
06550       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SAVE, hDB, hKey, filename, bRemote);
06551 
06552 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06553    {
06554       INT hfile, size, buffer_size, n, status;
06555       char *buffer, path[256];
06556 
06557       /* open file */
06558       hfile = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_TEXT, 0644);
06559       if (hfile == -1) {
06560          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "Cannot open file \"%s\"", filename);
06561          return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06562       }
06563 
06564       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, path, sizeof(path));
06565 
06566       buffer_size = 10000;
06567       do {
06568          buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
06569          if (buffer == NULL) {
06570             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot allocate ODB dump buffer");
06571             break;
06572          }
06573 
06574          size = buffer_size;
06575          status = db_copy(hDB, hKey, buffer, &size, path);
06576          if (status != DB_TRUNCATED) {
06577             n = write(hfile, buffer, buffer_size - size);
06578             free(buffer);
06579 
06580             if (n != buffer_size - size) {
06581                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot save .ODB file");
06582                close(hfile);
06583                return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06584             }
06585             break;
06586          }
06587 
06588          /* increase buffer size if truncated */
06589          free(buffer);
06590          buffer_size *= 2;
06591       } while (1);
06592 
06593       close(hfile);
06594 
06595    }
06596 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06597 
06598    return DB_SUCCESS;
06599 }
06600 
06601 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06602 
06603 void xml_encode(char *src, int size)
06604 {
06605    int i;
06606    char *dst, *p;
06607 
06608    dst = (char *) malloc(size);
06609    if (dst == NULL)
06610       return;
06611 
06612    *dst = 0;
06613    for (i = 0; i < (int) strlen(src); i++) {
06614       switch (src[i]) {
06615       case '<':
06616          strlcat(dst, "&lt;", size);
06617          break;
06618       case '>':
06619          strlcat(dst, "&gt;", size);
06620          break;
06621       case '&':
06622          strlcat(dst, "&amp;", size);
06623          break;
06624       case '\"':
06625          strlcat(dst, "&quot;", size);
06626          break;
06627       case '\'':
06628          strlcat(dst, "&apos;", size);
06629          break;
06630       default:
06631          if ((int) strlen(dst) >= size) {
06632             free(dst);
06633             return;
06634          }
06635          p = dst + strlen(dst);
06636          *p = src[i];
06637          *(p + 1) = 0;
06638       }
06639    }
06640 
06641    strlcpy(src, dst, size);
06642 }
06643 
06644 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06645 
06646 INT db_save_xml_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level, MXML_WRITER * writer)
06647 {
06648    INT i, idx, size, status;
06649    char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH * 2], *data;
06650    HNDLE hSubkey;
06651    KEY key;
06652 
06653    status = db_get_link(hDB, hKey, &key);
06654    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06655       return status;
06656 
06657    if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
06658 
06659       /* save opening tag for subtree */
06660 
06661       if (level > 0) {
06662          mxml_start_element(writer, "dir");
06663          mxml_write_attribute(writer, "name", key.name);
06664       }
06665 
06666       for (idx = 0;; idx++) {
06667          db_enum_link(hDB, hKey, idx, &hSubkey);
06668 
06669          if (!hSubkey)
06670             break;
06671 
06672          /* save subtree */
06673          status = db_save_xml_key(hDB, hSubkey, level + 1, writer);
06674          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06675             return status;
06676       }
06677 
06678       /* save closing tag for subtree */
06679       if (level > 0)
06680          mxml_end_element(writer);
06681 
06682    } else {
06683 
06684       /* save key value */
06685 
06686       if (key.num_values > 1)
06687          mxml_start_element(writer, "keyarray");
06688       else
06689          mxml_start_element(writer, "key");
06690       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "name", key.name);
06691       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "type", rpc_tid_name(key.type));
06692 
06693       if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK) {
06694          sprintf(str, "%d", key.item_size);
06695          mxml_write_attribute(writer, "size", str);
06696       }
06697 
06698       if (key.num_values > 1) {
06699          sprintf(str, "%d", key.num_values);
06700          mxml_write_attribute(writer, "num_values", str);
06701       }
06702 
06703       size = key.total_size;
06704       data = (char *) malloc(size);
06705       if (data == NULL) {
06706          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_xml_key", "cannot allocate data buffer");
06707          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06708       }
06709 
06710       db_get_link_data(hDB, hKey, data, &size, key.type);
06711 
06712       if (key.num_values == 1) {
06713 
06714          db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, 0, key.type);
06715          mxml_write_value(writer, str);
06716          mxml_end_element(writer);
06717 
06718       } else {                  /* array of values */
06719 
06720          for (i = 0; i < key.num_values; i++) {
06721 
06722             mxml_start_element(writer, "value");
06723             db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, i, key.type);
06724             mxml_write_value(writer, str);
06725             mxml_end_element(writer);
06726          }
06727 
06728          mxml_end_element(writer);      /* keyarray */
06729       }
06730 
06731       free(data);
06732    }
06733 
06734    return DB_SUCCESS;
06735 }
06736 
06737 /********************************************************************/
06738 /**
06739 Save a branch of a database to an .xml file
06740 
06741 This function is used by the ODBEdit command save to write the contents
06742 of the ODB into a XML file. Data of the whole ODB can
06743 be saved (hkey equal zero) or only a sub-tree.
06744 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
06745 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
06746 @param filename Filename of .XML file.
06747 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_FILE_ERROR
06748 */
06749 INT db_save_xml(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *filename)
06750 {
06751 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06752    {
06753       INT status;
06754       char str[256];
06755       MXML_WRITER *writer;
06756 
06757       /* open file */
06758       writer = mxml_open_file(filename);
06759       if (writer == NULL) {
06760          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_xml", "Cannot open file \"%s\"", filename);
06761          return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06762       }
06763 
06764       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
06765 
06766       /* write XML header */
06767       mxml_start_element(writer, "odb");
06768       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "root", str);
06769       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "filename", filename);
06770       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "xmlns:xsi", "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance");
06771 
06772       if (getenv("MIDASSYS"))
06773          strcpy(str, getenv("MIDASSYS"));
06774       else
06775          strcpy(str, "");
06776       strcat(str, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
06777       strcat(str, "odb.xsd");
06778       mxml_write_attribute(writer, "xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation", str);
06779 
06780       status = db_save_xml_key(hDB, hKey, 0, writer);
06781 
06782       mxml_end_element(writer); // "odb"
06783       mxml_close_file(writer);
06784    }
06785 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06786 
06787    return DB_SUCCESS;
06788 }
06789 
06790 /********************************************************************/
06791 /**
06792 Save a branch of a database to a C structure .H file
06793 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
06794 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
06795 @param file_name Filename of .ODB file.
06796 @param struct_name Name of structure. If struct_name == NULL,
06797                    the name of the key is used.
06798 @param append      If TRUE, append to end of existing file
06799 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_FILE_ERROR
06800 */
06801 INT db_save_struct(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *file_name, const char *struct_name, BOOL append)
06802 {
06803    KEY key;
06804    char str[100], line[100];
06805    INT status, i, fh;
06806 
06807    /* open file */
06808    fh = open(file_name, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | (append ? O_APPEND : O_TRUNC), 0644);
06809 
06810    if (fh == -1) {
06811       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_struct", "Cannot open file\"%s\"", file_name);
06812       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06813    }
06814 
06815    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06816    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
06817       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_struct", "cannot find key");
06818       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
06819    }
06820 
06821    sprintf(line, "typedef struct {\n");
06822    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06823    db_save_tree_struct(hDB, hKey, fh, 0);
06824 
06825    if (struct_name && struct_name[0])
06826       strcpy(str, struct_name);
06827    else
06828       strcpy(str, key.name);
06829 
06830    name2c(str);
06831    for (i = 0; i < (int) strlen(str); i++)
06832       str[i] = (char) toupper(str[i]);
06833 
06834    sprintf(line, "} %s;\n\n", str);
06835    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06836 
06837    close(fh);
06838 
06839    return DB_SUCCESS;
06840 }
06841 
06842 /**dox***************************************************************/
06843 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
06844 
06845 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06846 INT db_save_string(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *file_name, const char *string_name, BOOL append)
06847 /********************************************************************\
06848 
06849   Routine: db_save_string
06850 
06851   Purpose: Save a branch of a database as a string which can be used
06852            by db_create_record.
06853 
06854   Input:
06855     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
06856     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key to start, 0 for root
06857     int   fh                File handle to write to
06858     char  string_name       Name of string. If struct_name == NULL,
06859                             the name of the key is used.
06860 
06861   Output:
06862     none
06863 
06864   Function value:
06865     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
06866     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
06867 
06868 \********************************************************************/
06869 {
06870    KEY key;
06871    char str[256], line[256];
06872    INT status, i, size, fh, buffer_size;
06873    char *buffer, *pc;
06874 
06875 
06876    /* open file */
06877    fh = open(file_name, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | (append ? O_APPEND : O_TRUNC), 0644);
06878 
06879    if (fh == -1) {
06880       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_string", "Cannot open file\"%s\"", file_name);
06881       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06882    }
06883 
06884    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06885    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
06886       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_string", "cannot find key");
06887       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
06888    }
06889 
06890    if (string_name && string_name[0])
06891       strcpy(str, string_name);
06892    else
06893       strcpy(str, key.name);
06894 
06895    name2c(str);
06896    for (i = 0; i < (int) strlen(str); i++)
06897       str[i] = (char) toupper(str[i]);
06898 
06899    sprintf(line, "#define %s(_name) const char *_name[] = {\\\n", str);
06900    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06901 
06902    buffer_size = 10000;
06903    do {
06904       buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
06905       if (buffer == NULL) {
06906          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot allocate ODB dump buffer");
06907          break;
06908       }
06909 
06910       size = buffer_size;
06911       status = db_copy(hDB, hKey, buffer, &size, "");
06912       if (status != DB_TRUNCATED)
06913          break;
06914 
06915       /* increase buffer size if truncated */
06916       free(buffer);
06917       buffer_size *= 2;
06918    } while (1);
06919 
06920 
06921    pc = buffer;
06922 
06923    do {
06924       i = 0;
06925       line[i++] = '"';
06926       while (*pc != '\n' && *pc != 0) {
06927          if (*pc == '\"' || *pc == '\'')
06928             line[i++] = '\\';
06929          line[i++] = *pc++;
06930       }
06931       strcpy(&line[i], "\",\\\n");
06932       if (i > 0)
06933          write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06934 
06935       if (*pc == '\n')
06936          pc++;
06937 
06938    } while (*pc);
06939 
06940    sprintf(line, "NULL }\n\n");
06941    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06942 
06943    close(fh);
06944    free(buffer);
06945 
06946    return DB_SUCCESS;
06947 }
06948 
06949 /**dox***************************************************************/
06950 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
06951 
06952 /********************************************************************/
06953 /**
06954 Convert a database value to a string according to its type.
06955 
06956 This function is a convenient way to convert a binary ODB value into a
06957 string depending on its type if is not known at compile time. If it is known, the
06958 normal sprintf() function can be used.
06959 \code
06960 ...
06961   for (j=0 ; j<key.num_values ; j++)
06962   {
06963     db_sprintf(pbuf, pdata, key.item_size, j, key.type);
06964     strcat(pbuf, "\n");
06965   }
06966   ...
06967 \endcode
06968 @param string output ASCII string of data.
06969 @param data Value data.
06970 @param data_size Size of single data element.
06971 @param idx Index for array data.
06972 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
06973 @return DB_SUCCESS
06974 */
06975 INT db_sprintf(char *string, const void *data, INT data_size, INT idx, DWORD type)
06976 {
06977    if (data_size == 0)
06978       sprintf(string, "<NULL>");
06979    else
06980       switch (type) {
06981       case TID_BYTE:
06982          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((BYTE *) data) + idx));
06983          break;
06984       case TID_SBYTE:
06985          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((char *) data) + idx));
06986          break;
06987       case TID_CHAR:
06988          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((char *) data) + idx));
06989          break;
06990       case TID_WORD:
06991          sprintf(string, "%u", *(((WORD *) data) + idx));
06992          break;
06993       case TID_SHORT:
06994          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((short *) data) + idx));
06995          break;
06996       case TID_DWORD:
06997          sprintf(string, "%u", *(((DWORD *) data) + idx));
06998          break;
06999       case TID_INT:
07000          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((INT *) data) + idx));
07001          break;
07002       case TID_BOOL:
07003          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((BOOL *) data) + idx) ? 'y' : 'n');
07004          break;
07005       case TID_FLOAT:
07006          if (ss_isnan(*(((float *) data) + idx)))
07007             sprintf(string, "NAN");
07008          else
07009             sprintf(string, "%.7g", *(((float *) data) + idx));
07010          break;
07011       case TID_DOUBLE:
07012          if (ss_isnan(*(((double *) data) + idx)))
07013             sprintf(string, "NAN");
07014          else
07015             sprintf(string, "%.16lg", *(((double *) data) + idx));
07016          break;
07017       case TID_BITFIELD:
07018          /* TBD */
07019          break;
07020       case TID_STRING:
07021       case TID_LINK:
07022          strlcpy(string, ((char *) data) + data_size * idx, MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
07023          break;
07024       default:
07025          sprintf(string, "<unknown>");
07026          break;
07027       }
07028 
07029    return DB_SUCCESS;
07030 }
07031 
07032 /********************************************************************/
07033 /**
07034 Same as db_sprintf, but with additional format parameter
07035 
07036 @param string output ASCII string of data.
07037 @param format Format specifier passed to sprintf()
07038 @param data Value data.
07039 @param data_size Size of single data element.
07040 @param idx Index for array data.
07041 @param type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see @ref Midas_Data_Types).
07042 @return DB_SUCCESS
07043 */
07044 
07045 INT db_sprintff(char *string, const char *format, const void *data, INT data_size, INT idx, DWORD type)
07046 {
07047    if (data_size == 0)
07048       sprintf(string, "<NULL>");
07049    else
07050       switch (type) {
07051       case TID_BYTE:
07052          sprintf(string, format, *(((BYTE *) data) + idx));
07053          break;
07054       case TID_SBYTE:
07055          sprintf(string, format, *(((char *) data) + idx));
07056          break;
07057       case TID_CHAR:
07058          sprintf(string, format, *(((char *) data) + idx));
07059          break;
07060       case TID_WORD:
07061          sprintf(string, format, *(((WORD *) data) + idx));
07062          break;
07063       case TID_SHORT:
07064          sprintf(string, format, *(((short *) data) + idx));
07065          break;
07066       case TID_DWORD:
07067          sprintf(string, format, *(((DWORD *) data) + idx));
07068          break;
07069       case TID_INT:
07070          sprintf(string, format, *(((INT *) data) + idx));
07071          break;
07072       case TID_BOOL:
07073          sprintf(string, format, *(((BOOL *) data) + idx) ? 'y' : 'n');
07074          break;
07075       case TID_FLOAT:
07076          if (ss_isnan(*(((float *) data) + idx)))
07077             sprintf(string, "NAN");
07078          else
07079             sprintf(string, format, *(((float *) data) + idx));
07080          break;
07081       case TID_DOUBLE:
07082          if (ss_isnan(*(((double *) data) + idx)))
07083             sprintf(string, "NAN");
07084          else
07085             sprintf(string, format, *(((double *) data) + idx));
07086          break;
07087       case TID_BITFIELD:
07088          /* TBD */
07089          break;
07090       case TID_STRING:
07091       case TID_LINK:
07092          strlcpy(string, ((char *) data) + data_size * idx, MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
07093          break;
07094       default:
07095          sprintf(string, "<unknown>");
07096          break;
07097       }
07098 
07099    return DB_SUCCESS;
07100 }
07101 
07102 /**dox***************************************************************/
07103 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
07104 
07105 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07106 INT db_sprintfh(char *string, const void *data, INT data_size, INT idx, DWORD type)
07107 /********************************************************************\
07108 
07109   Routine: db_sprintfh
07110 
07111   Purpose: Convert a database value to a string according to its type
07112            in hex format
07113 
07114   Input:
07115     void  *data             Value data
07116     INT   idx               Index for array data
07117     INT   data_size         Size of single data element
07118     DWORD type              Valye type, one of TID_xxx
07119 
07120   Output:
07121     char  *string           ASCII string of data
07122 
07123   Function value:
07124     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
07125 
07126 \********************************************************************/
07127 {
07128    if (data_size == 0)
07129       sprintf(string, "<NULL>");
07130    else
07131       switch (type) {
07132       case TID_BYTE:
07133          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((BYTE *) data) + idx));
07134          break;
07135       case TID_SBYTE:
07136          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((char *) data) + idx));
07137          break;
07138       case TID_CHAR:
07139          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((char *) data) + idx));
07140          break;
07141       case TID_WORD:
07142          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((WORD *) data) + idx));
07143          break;
07144       case TID_SHORT:
07145          sprintf(string, "0x%hX", *(((short *) data) + idx));
07146          break;
07147       case TID_DWORD:
07148          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((DWORD *) data) + idx));
07149          break;
07150       case TID_INT:
07151          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((INT *) data) + idx));
07152          break;
07153       case TID_BOOL:
07154          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((BOOL *) data) + idx) ? 'y' : 'n');
07155          break;
07156       case TID_FLOAT:
07157          if (ss_isnan(*(((float *) data) + idx)))
07158             sprintf(string, "NAN");
07159          else
07160             sprintf(string, "%.7g", *(((float *) data) + idx));
07161          break;
07162       case TID_DOUBLE:
07163          if (ss_isnan(*(((double *) data) + idx)))
07164             sprintf(string, "NAN");
07165          else
07166             sprintf(string, "%.16lg", *(((double *) data) + idx));
07167          break;
07168       case TID_BITFIELD:
07169          /* TBD */
07170          break;
07171       case TID_STRING:
07172       case TID_LINK:
07173          sprintf(string, "%s", ((char *) data) + data_size * idx);
07174          break;
07175       default:
07176          sprintf(string, "<unknown>");
07177          break;
07178       }
07179 
07180    return DB_SUCCESS;
07181 }
07182 
07183 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07184 INT db_sscanf(const char *data_str, void *data, INT * data_size, INT i, DWORD tid)
07185 /********************************************************************\
07186 
07187   Routine: db_sscanf
07188 
07189   Purpose: Convert a string to a database value according to its type
07190 
07191   Input:
07192     char  *data_str         ASCII string of data
07193     INT   i                 Index for array data
07194     DWORD tid               Value type, one of TID_xxx
07195 
07196   Output:
07197     void  *data             Value data
07198     INT   *data_size        Size of single data element
07199 
07200   Function value:
07201     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
07202 
07203 \********************************************************************/
07204 {
07205    DWORD value;
07206    BOOL hex = FALSE;
07207 
07208    if (data_str == NULL)
07209       return 0;
07210 
07211    *data_size = rpc_tid_size(tid);
07212    if (strncmp(data_str, "0x", 2) == 0) {
07213       hex = TRUE;
07214       sscanf(data_str + 2, "%x", &value);
07215    }
07216 
07217    switch (tid) {
07218    case TID_BYTE:
07219    case TID_SBYTE:
07220       if (hex)
07221          *((char *) data + i) = (char) value;
07222       else
07223          *((char *) data + i) = (char) atoi(data_str);
07224       break;
07225    case TID_CHAR:
07226       *((char *) data + i) = data_str[0];
07227       break;
07228    case TID_WORD:
07229       if (hex)
07230          *((WORD *) data + i) = (WORD) value;
07231       else
07232          *((WORD *) data + i) = (WORD) atoi(data_str);
07233       break;
07234    case TID_SHORT:
07235       if (hex)
07236          *((short int *) data + i) = (short int) value;
07237       else
07238          *((short int *) data + i) = (short int) atoi(data_str);
07239       break;
07240    case TID_DWORD:
07241       if (!hex)
07242          sscanf(data_str, "%u", &value);
07243 
07244       *((DWORD *) data + i) = value;
07245       break;
07246    case TID_INT:
07247       if (hex)
07248          *((INT *) data + i) = value;
07249       else
07250          *((INT *) data + i) = atol(data_str);
07251       break;
07252    case TID_BOOL:
07253       if (data_str[0] == 'y' || data_str[0] == 'Y' || atoi(data_str) > 0)
07254          *((BOOL *) data + i) = 1;
07255       else
07256          *((BOOL *) data + i) = 0;
07257       break;
07258    case TID_FLOAT:
07259       if (data_str[0] == 'n' || data_str[0] == 'N')
07260          *((float *) data + i) = (float) ss_nan();
07261       else
07262          *((float *) data + i) = (float) atof(data_str);
07263       break;
07264    case TID_DOUBLE:
07265       if (data_str[0] == 'n' || data_str[0] == 'N')
07266          *((double *) data + i) = ss_nan();
07267       else
07268          *((double *) data + i) = atof(data_str);
07269       break;
07270    case TID_BITFIELD:
07271       /* TBD */
07272       break;
07273    case TID_STRING:
07274    case TID_LINK:
07275       strcpy((char *) data, data_str);
07276       *data_size = strlen(data_str) + 1;
07277       break;
07278    }
07279 
07280    return DB_SUCCESS;
07281 }
07282 
07283 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07284 
07285 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07286 
07287 static void db_recurse_record_tree(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void **data,
07288                                    INT * total_size, INT base_align, INT * max_align, BOOL bSet, INT convert_flags)
07289 /********************************************************************\
07290 
07291   Routine: db_recurse_record_tree
07292 
07293   Purpose: Recurse a database tree and calculate its size or copy
07294            data. Internal use only.
07295 
07296 \********************************************************************/
07297 {
07298    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
07299    KEYLIST *pkeylist;
07300    KEY *pkey;
07301    INT size, align, corr, total_size_tmp;
07302 
07303    /* get first subkey of hKey */
07304    pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
07305    pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
07306 
07307    pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
07308    if (!pkeylist->first_key)
07309       return;
07310    pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
07311 
07312    /* first browse through this level */
07313    do {
07314       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
07315          /* correct for alignment */
07316          align = 1;
07317 
07318          if (rpc_tid_size(pkey->type))
07319             align = rpc_tid_size(pkey->type) < base_align ? rpc_tid_size(pkey->type) : base_align;
07320 
07321          if (max_align && align > *max_align)
07322             *max_align = align;
07323 
07324          corr = VALIGN(*total_size, align) - *total_size;
07325          *total_size += corr;
07326          if (data)
07327             *data = (void *) ((char *) (*data) + corr);
07328 
07329          /* calculate data size */
07330          size = pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values;
07331 
07332          if (data) {
07333             if (bSet) {
07334                /* copy data if there is write access */
07335                if (pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
07336                   memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, *data, pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values);
07337 
07338                   /* convert data */
07339                   if (convert_flags) {
07340                      if (pkey->num_values > 1)
07341                         rpc_convert_data((char *) pheader + pkey->data,
07342                                          pkey->type, RPC_FIXARRAY, pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values, convert_flags);
07343                      else
07344                         rpc_convert_single((char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->type, 0, convert_flags);
07345                   }
07346 
07347                   /* update time */
07348                   pkey->last_written = ss_time();
07349 
07350                   /* notify clients which have key open */
07351                   if (pkey->notify_count)
07352                      db_notify_clients(hDB, (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader, FALSE);
07353                }
07354             } else {
07355                /* copy key data if there is read access */
07356                if (pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ) {
07357                   memcpy(*data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values);
07358 
07359                   /* convert data */
07360                   if (convert_flags) {
07361                      if (pkey->num_values > 1)
07362                         rpc_convert_data(*data, pkey->type,
07363                                          RPC_FIXARRAY | RPC_OUTGOING,
07364                                          pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values, convert_flags);
07365                      else
07366                         rpc_convert_single(*data, pkey->type, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07367                   }
07368                }
07369             }
07370 
07371             *data = (char *) (*data) + size;
07372          }
07373 
07374          *total_size += size;
07375       } else {
07376          /* align new substructure according to the maximum
07377             align value in this structure */
07378          align = 1;
07379 
07380          total_size_tmp = *total_size;
07381          db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader,
07382                                 NULL, &total_size_tmp, base_align, &align, bSet, convert_flags);
07383 
07384          if (max_align && align > *max_align)
07385             *max_align = align;
07386 
07387          corr = VALIGN(*total_size, align) - *total_size;
07388          *total_size += corr;
07389          if (data)
07390             *data = (void *) ((char *) (*data) + corr);
07391 
07392          /* now copy subtree */
07393          db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader,
07394                                 data, total_size, base_align, NULL, bSet, convert_flags);
07395 
07396          corr = VALIGN(*total_size, align) - *total_size;
07397          *total_size += corr;
07398          if (data)
07399             *data = (void *) ((char *) (*data) + corr);
07400 
07401          if (bSet && pkey->notify_count)
07402             db_notify_clients(hDB, (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader, FALSE);
07403       }
07404 
07405       if (!pkey->next_key)
07406          break;
07407 
07408       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
07409    } while (TRUE);
07410 }
07411 
07412 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07413 
07414 /**dox***************************************************************/
07415 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
07416 
07417 /********************************************************************/
07418 /**
07419 Calculates the size of a record.
07420 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
07421 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
07422 @param align Byte alignment calculated by the stub and
07423               passed to the rpc side to align data
07424               according to local machine. Must be zero
07425               when called from user level
07426 @param buf_size Size of record structure
07427 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH,
07428 DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH, DB_NO_KEY
07429 */
07430 INT db_get_record_size(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT align, INT * buf_size)
07431 {
07432    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
07433       align = ss_get_struct_align();
07434       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_RECORD_SIZE, hDB, hKey, align, buf_size);
07435    }
07436 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07437    {
07438       KEY key;
07439       INT status, max_align;
07440 
07441       if (!align)
07442          align = ss_get_struct_align();
07443 
07444       /* check if key has subkeys */
07445       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
07446       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
07447          return status;
07448 
07449       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
07450          /* just a single key */
07451          *buf_size = key.item_size * key.num_values;
07452          return DB_SUCCESS;
07453       }
07454 
07455       db_lock_database(hDB);
07456 
07457       /* determine record size */
07458       *buf_size = max_align = 0;
07459       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, NULL, buf_size, align, &max_align, 0, 0);
07460 
07461       /* correct for byte padding */
07462       *buf_size = VALIGN(*buf_size, max_align);
07463 
07464       db_unlock_database(hDB);
07465    }
07466 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07467 
07468    return DB_SUCCESS;
07469 }
07470 
07471 /********************************************************************/
07472 /**
07473 Copy a set of keys to local memory.
07474 
07475 An ODB sub-tree can be mapped to a C structure automatically via a
07476 hot-link using the function db_open_record() or manually with this function.
07477 Problems might occur if the ODB sub-tree contains values which don't match the
07478 C structure. Although the structure size is checked against the sub-tree size, no
07479 checking can be done if the type and order of the values in the structure are the
07480 same than those in the ODB sub-tree. Therefore it is recommended to use the
07481 function db_create_record() before db_get_record() is used which
07482 ensures that both are equivalent.
07483 \code
07484 struct {
07485   INT level1;
07486   INT level2;
07487 } trigger_settings;
07488 char *trigger_settings_str =
07489 "[Settings]\n\
07490 level1 = INT : 0\n\
07491 level2 = INT : 0";
07492 
07493 main()
07494 {
07495   HNDLE hDB, hkey;
07496   INT   size;
07497   ...
07498   cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
07499   db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger", trigger_settings_str);
07500   db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings", &hkey);
07501   size = sizeof(trigger_settings);
07502   db_get_record(hDB, hkey, &trigger_settings, &size, 0);
07503   ...
07504 }
07505 \endcode
07506 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
07507 @param hKey         Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
07508 @param data         Pointer to the retrieved data.
07509 @param buf_size     Size of data structure, must be obtained via sizeof(RECORD-NAME).
07510 @param align        Byte alignment calculated by the stub and
07511                     passed to the rpc side to align data
07512                     according to local machine. Must be zero
07513                     when called from user level.
07514 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH
07515 */
07516 INT db_get_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size, INT align)
07517 {
07518    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
07519       align = ss_get_struct_align();
07520       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_RECORD, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, align);
07521    }
07522 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07523    {
07524       KEY key;
07525       INT convert_flags, status;
07526       INT total_size;
07527       void *pdata;
07528       char str[256];
07529 
07530       convert_flags = 0;
07531 
07532       if (!align)
07533          align = ss_get_struct_align();
07534       else
07535          /* only convert data if called remotely, as indicated by align != 0 */
07536       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
07537          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
07538 
07539       /* check if key has subkeys */
07540       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
07541       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
07542          return status;
07543 
07544       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
07545          /* copy single key */
07546          if (key.item_size * key.num_values != *buf_size) {
07547             db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
07548             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_record", 
07549                    "struct size mismatch for \"%s\" (expected size: %d, size in ODB: %d", str, *buf_size, key.item_size * key.num_values);
07550             return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
07551          }
07552 
07553          db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, key.type);
07554 
07555          if (convert_flags) {
07556             if (key.num_values > 1)
07557                rpc_convert_data(data, key.type,
07558                                 RPC_OUTGOING | RPC_FIXARRAY, key.item_size * key.num_values, convert_flags);
07559             else
07560                rpc_convert_single(data, key.type, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07561          }
07562 
07563          return DB_SUCCESS;
07564       }
07565 
07566       /* check record size */
07567       db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &total_size);
07568       if (total_size != *buf_size) {
07569          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
07570          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_record",
07571                 "struct size mismatch for \"%s\" (expected size: %d, size in ODB: %d)", str, *buf_size, total_size);
07572          return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
07573       }
07574 
07575       /* get subkey data */
07576       pdata = data;
07577       total_size = 0;
07578 
07579       db_lock_database(hDB);
07580       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, &pdata, &total_size, align, NULL, FALSE, convert_flags);
07581       db_unlock_database(hDB);
07582 
07583    }
07584 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07585 
07586    return DB_SUCCESS;
07587 }
07588 
07589 /********************************************************************/
07590 /**
07591 Copy a set of keys from local memory to the database.
07592 
07593 An ODB sub-tree can be mapped to a C structure automatically via a
07594 hot-link using the function db_open_record() or manually with this function.
07595 Problems might occur if the ODB sub-tree contains values which don't match the
07596 C structure. Although the structure size is checked against the sub-tree size, no
07597 checking can be done if the type and order of the values in the structure are the
07598 same than those in the ODB sub-tree. Therefore it is recommended to use the
07599 function db_create_record() before using this function.
07600 \code
07601 ...
07602   memset(&lazyst,0,size);
07603   if (db_find_key(hDB, pLch->hKey, "Statistics",&hKeyst) == DB_SUCCESS)
07604     status = db_set_record(hDB, hKeyst, &lazyst, size, 0);
07605   else
07606     cm_msg(MERROR,"task","record %s/statistics not found", pLch->name)
07607 ...
07608 \endcode
07609 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
07610 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
07611 @param data Pointer where data is stored.
07612 @param buf_size Size of data structure, must be obtained via sizeof(RECORD-NAME).
07613 @param align  Byte alignment calculated by the stub and
07614               passed to the rpc side to align data
07615               according to local machine. Must be zero
07616               when called from user level.
07617 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH
07618 */
07619 INT db_set_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT buf_size, INT align)
07620 {
07621    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
07622       align = ss_get_struct_align();
07623       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_RECORD, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, align);
07624    }
07625 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07626    {
07627       KEY key;
07628       INT convert_flags;
07629       INT total_size;
07630       void *pdata;
07631 
07632       convert_flags = 0;
07633 
07634       if (!align)
07635          align = ss_get_struct_align();
07636       else
07637          /* only convert data if called remotely, as indicated by align != 0 */
07638       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
07639          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
07640 
07641       /* check if key has subkeys */
07642       db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
07643       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
07644          /* copy single key */
07645          if (key.item_size * key.num_values != buf_size) {
07646             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
07647             return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
07648          }
07649 
07650          if (convert_flags) {
07651             if (key.num_values > 1)
07652                rpc_convert_data(data, key.type, RPC_FIXARRAY, key.item_size * key.num_values, convert_flags);
07653             else
07654                rpc_convert_single(data, key.type, 0, convert_flags);
07655          }
07656 
07657          db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, key.total_size, key.num_values, key.type);
07658          return DB_SUCCESS;
07659       }
07660 
07661       /* check record size */
07662       db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &total_size);
07663       if (total_size != buf_size) {
07664          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
07665          return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
07666       }
07667 
07668       /* set subkey data */
07669       pdata = data;
07670       total_size = 0;
07671 
07672       db_lock_database(hDB);
07673       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, &pdata, &total_size, align, NULL, TRUE, convert_flags);
07674       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
07675       db_unlock_database(hDB);
07676    }
07677 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07678 
07679    return DB_SUCCESS;
07680 }
07681 
07682 /**dox***************************************************************/
07683 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
07684 
07685 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07686 INT db_add_open_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, WORD access_mode)
07687 /********************************************************************\
07688 
07689   Routine: db_add_open_record
07690 
07691   Purpose: Server part of db_open_record. Internal use only.
07692 
07693 \********************************************************************/
07694 {
07695    if (rpc_is_remote())
07696       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ADD_OPEN_RECORD, hDB, hKey, access_mode);
07697 
07698 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07699    {
07700       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
07701       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
07702       KEY *pkey;
07703       INT i;
07704 
07705       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
07706          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_add_open_record", "invalid database handle");
07707          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07708       }
07709 
07710       /* lock database */
07711       db_lock_database(hDB);
07712 
07713       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
07714       pclient = &pheader->client[_database[hDB - 1].client_index];
07715 
07716       /* check if key is already open */
07717       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_index; i++)
07718          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle == hKey)
07719             break;
07720 
07721       if (i < pclient->max_index) {
07722          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07723          return DB_SUCCESS;
07724       }
07725 
07726       /* not found, search free entry */
07727       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_index; i++)
07728          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle == 0)
07729             break;
07730 
07731       /* check if maximum number reached */
07732       if (i == MAX_OPEN_RECORDS) {
07733          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07734          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07735       }
07736 
07737       if (i == pclient->max_index)
07738          pclient->max_index++;
07739 
07740       pclient->open_record[i].handle = hKey;
07741       pclient->open_record[i].access_mode = access_mode;
07742 
07743       /* increment notify_count */
07744       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
07745 
07746       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
07747       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
07748          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07749          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07750       }
07751 
07752       pkey->notify_count++;
07753 
07754       pclient->num_open_records++;
07755 
07756       /* set exclusive bit if requested */
07757       if (access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
07758          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode | MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
07759 
07760       db_unlock_database(hDB);
07761    }
07762 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07763 
07764    return DB_SUCCESS;
07765 }
07766 
07767 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07768 INT db_remove_open_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, BOOL lock)
07769 /********************************************************************\
07770 
07771   Routine: db_remove_open_record
07772 
07773   Purpose: Gets called by db_close_record. Internal use only.
07774 
07775 \********************************************************************/
07776 {
07777    if (rpc_is_remote())
07778       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_REMOVE_OPEN_RECORD, hDB, hKey, lock);
07779 
07780 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07781    {
07782       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
07783       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
07784       KEY *pkey;
07785       INT i, idx;
07786 
07787       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
07788          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_remove_open_record", "invalid database handle");
07789          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07790       }
07791 
07792       if (lock)
07793          db_lock_database(hDB);
07794 
07795       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
07796       pclient = &pheader->client[_database[hDB - 1].client_index];
07797 
07798       /* search key */
07799       for (idx = 0; idx < pclient->max_index; idx++)
07800          if (pclient->open_record[idx].handle == hKey)
07801             break;
07802 
07803       if (idx == pclient->max_index) {
07804          if (lock)
07805             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07806 
07807          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07808       }
07809 
07810       /* decrement notify_count */
07811       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
07812 
07813       if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
07814          pkey->notify_count--;
07815 
07816       pclient->num_open_records--;
07817 
07818       /* remove exclusive flag */
07819       if (pclient->open_record[idx].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
07820          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
07821 
07822       memset(&pclient->open_record[idx], 0, sizeof(OPEN_RECORD));
07823 
07824       /* calculate new max_index entry */
07825       for (i = pclient->max_index - 1; i >= 0; i--)
07826          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle != 0)
07827             break;
07828       pclient->max_index = i + 1;
07829 
07830       if (lock)
07831          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07832    }
07833 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07834 
07835    return DB_SUCCESS;
07836 }
07837 
07838 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07839 
07840 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07841 
07842 INT db_notify_clients(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, BOOL bWalk)
07843 /********************************************************************\
07844 
07845   Routine: db_notify_clients
07846 
07847   Purpose: Gets called by db_set_xxx functions. Internal use only.
07848 
07849 \********************************************************************/
07850 {
07851    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
07852    DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
07853    KEY *pkey;
07854    KEYLIST *pkeylist;
07855    INT i, j;
07856    char str[80];
07857 
07858    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
07859       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_notify_clients", "invalid database handle");
07860       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07861    }
07862 
07863    pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
07864 
07865    /* check if key or parent has notify_flag set */
07866    pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
07867 
07868    do {
07869 
07870       /* check which client has record open */
07871       if (pkey->notify_count)
07872          for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++) {
07873             pclient = &pheader->client[i];
07874             for (j = 0; j < pclient->max_index; j++)
07875                if (pclient->open_record[j].handle == hKey) {
07876                   /* send notification to remote process */
07877                   sprintf(str, "O %d %d", hDB, hKey);
07878                   ss_resume(pclient->port, str);
07879                }
07880          }
07881 
07882       if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0 || !bWalk)
07883          return DB_SUCCESS;
07884 
07885       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
07886       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
07887       hKey = (POINTER_T) pkey - (POINTER_T) pheader;
07888    } while (TRUE);
07889 
07890 }
07891 
07892 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07893 
07894 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07895 void merge_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * pkey, INT level, void *info)
07896 {
07897    char full_name[256], buffer[10000];
07898    INT status, size;
07899    void *p;
07900    HNDLE hKeyInit;
07901    KEY initkey, key;
07902 
07903    /* avoid compiler warnings */
07904    status = level;
07905    p = info;
07906    p = pkey;
07907 
07908    /* compose name of init key */
07909    db_get_path(hDB, hKey, full_name, sizeof(full_name));
07910    *strchr(full_name, 'O') = 'I';
07911 
07912    /* if key in init record found, copy original data to init data */
07913    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, full_name, &hKeyInit);
07914    if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
07915       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyInit, &initkey);
07916       assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07917       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
07918       assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07919 
07920       if (initkey.type != TID_KEY && initkey.type == key.type) {
07921          /* copy data from original key to new key */
07922          size = sizeof(buffer);
07923          status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, buffer, &size, initkey.type);
07924          assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07925          status = db_set_data(hDB, hKeyInit, buffer, initkey.total_size, initkey.num_values, initkey.type);
07926          assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07927       }
07928    } else if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
07929       /* do nothing */
07930    } else if (status == DB_INVALID_LINK) {
07931       status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, full_name, &hKeyInit);
07932       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
07933          size = sizeof(full_name);
07934          db_get_data(hDB, hKeyInit, full_name, &size, TID_LINK);
07935       }
07936       cm_msg(MERROR, "merge_records", "Invalid link \"%s\"", full_name);
07937    } else {
07938       cm_msg(MERROR, "merge_records",
07939              "aborting on unexpected failure of db_find_key(%s), status %d", full_name, status);
07940       abort();
07941    }
07942 }
07943 
07944 static int open_count;
07945 
07946 void check_open_keys(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * pkey, INT level, void *info)
07947 {
07948    int i;
07949    void *p;
07950 
07951    /* avoid compiler warnings */
07952    i = hDB;
07953    i = hKey;
07954    i = level;
07955    p = info;
07956 
07957    if (pkey->notify_count)
07958       open_count++;
07959 }
07960 
07961 /**dox***************************************************************/
07962 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
07963 
07964 /********************************************************************/
07965 /**
07966 Create a record. If a part of the record exists alreay,
07967 merge it with the init_str (use values from the init_str only when they are
07968 not in the existing record).
07969 
07970 This functions creates a ODB sub-tree according to an ASCII
07971 representation of that tree. See db_copy() for a description. It can be used to
07972 create a sub-tree which exactly matches a C structure. The sub-tree can then
07973 later mapped to the C structure ("hot-link") via the function db_open_record().
07974 
07975 If a sub-tree exists already which exactly matches the ASCII representation, it is
07976 not modified. If part of the tree exists, it is merged with the ASCII representation
07977 where the ODB values have priority, only values not present in the ODB are
07978 created with the default values of the ASCII representation. It is therefore
07979 recommended that before creating an ODB hot-link the function
07980 db_create_record() is called to insure that the ODB tree and the C structure
07981 contain exactly the same values in the same order.
07982 
07983 Following example creates a record under /Equipment/Trigger/Settings,
07984 opens a hot-link between that record and a local C structure
07985 trigger_settings and registers a callback function trigger_update()
07986 which gets called each time the record is changed.
07987 \code
07988 struct {
07989   INT level1;
07990   INT level2;
07991 } trigger_settings;
07992 char *trigger_settings_str =
07993 "[Settings]\n\
07994 level1 = INT : 0\n\
07995 level2 = INT : 0";
07996 void trigger_update(INT hDB, INT hkey, void *info)
07997 {
07998   printf("New levels: %d %d\n",
07999     trigger_settings.level1,
08000     trigger_settings.level2);
08001 }
08002 main()
08003 {
08004   HNDLE hDB, hkey;
08005   char[128] info;
08006   ...
08007   cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
08008   db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger", trigger_settings_str);
08009   db_find_key(hDB, 0,"/Equipment/Trigger/Settings", &hkey);
08010   db_open_record(hDB, hkey, &trigger_settings,
08011     sizeof(trigger_settings), MODE_READ, trigger_update, info);
08012   ...
08013 }
08014 \endcode
08015 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
08016 @param hKey         Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
08017 @param orig_key_name     Name of key to search, can contain directories.
08018 @param init_str     Initialization string in the format of the db_copy/db_save functions.
08019 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_FULL, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_OPEN_RECORD
08020 */
08021 INT db_create_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *orig_key_name, const char *init_str)
08022 {
08023    char str[256], key_name[256], *buffer;
08024    INT status, size, i, buffer_size;
08025    HNDLE hKeyTmp, hKeyTmpO, hKeyOrig, hSubkey;
08026 
08027    if (rpc_is_remote())
08028       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CREATE_RECORD, hDB, hKey, orig_key_name, init_str);
08029 
08030    /* make this function atomic */
08031    db_lock_database(hDB);
08032 
08033    /* strip trailing '/' */
08034    strlcpy(key_name, orig_key_name, sizeof(key_name));
08035    if (strlen(key_name) > 1 && key_name[strlen(key_name) - 1] == '/')
08036       key_name[strlen(key_name) - 1] = 0;
08037 
08038    /* merge temporay record and original record */
08039    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, &hKeyOrig);
08040    if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
08041       assert(hKeyOrig != 0);
08042       /* check if key or subkey is opened */
08043       open_count = 0;
08044       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKeyOrig, 0, check_open_keys, NULL);
08045       if (open_count) {
08046          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08047          return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
08048       }
08049 
08050       /* create temporary records */
08051       sprintf(str, "/System/Tmp/%1dI", ss_gettid());
08052       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmp);
08053       if (hKeyTmp)
08054          db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmp, FALSE);
08055       db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
08056       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmp);
08057       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08058          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08059          return status;
08060       }
08061 
08062       sprintf(str, "/System/Tmp/%1dO", ss_gettid());
08063       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmpO);
08064       if (hKeyTmpO)
08065          db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmpO, FALSE);
08066       db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
08067       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmpO);
08068       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08069          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08070          return status;
08071       }
08072 
08073       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmp, init_str);
08074       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08075          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08076          return status;
08077       }
08078 
08079       buffer_size = 10000;
08080       buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
08081       do {
08082          size = buffer_size;
08083          status = db_copy(hDB, hKeyOrig, buffer, &size, "");
08084          if (status == DB_TRUNCATED) {
08085             buffer_size += 10000;
08086             buffer = (char *) realloc(buffer, buffer_size);
08087             continue;
08088          }
08089          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08090             db_unlock_database(hDB);
08091             return status;
08092          }
08093 
08094       } while (status != DB_SUCCESS);
08095 
08096       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmpO, buffer);
08097       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08098          free(buffer);
08099          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08100          return status;
08101       }
08102 
08103       /* merge temporay record and original record */
08104       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKeyTmpO, 0, merge_records, NULL);
08105 
08106       /* delete original record */
08107       for (i = 0;; i++) {
08108          db_enum_link(hDB, hKeyOrig, 0, &hSubkey);
08109          if (!hSubkey)
08110             break;
08111 
08112          status = db_delete_key(hDB, hSubkey, FALSE);
08113          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08114             free(buffer);
08115             db_unlock_database(hDB);
08116             return status;
08117          }
08118       }
08119 
08120       /* copy merged record to original record */
08121       do {
08122          size = buffer_size;
08123          status = db_copy(hDB, hKeyTmp, buffer, &size, "");
08124          if (status == DB_TRUNCATED) {
08125             buffer_size += 10000;
08126             buffer = (char *) realloc(buffer, buffer_size);
08127             continue;
08128          }
08129          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08130             free(buffer);
08131             db_unlock_database(hDB);
08132             return status;
08133          }
08134 
08135       } while (status != DB_SUCCESS);
08136 
08137       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyOrig, buffer);
08138       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08139          free(buffer);
08140          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08141          return status;
08142       }
08143 
08144       /* delete temporary records */
08145       db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmp, FALSE);
08146       db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmpO, FALSE);
08147 
08148       free(buffer);
08149    } else if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
08150       /* create fresh record */
08151       db_create_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, TID_KEY);
08152       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, &hKeyTmp);
08153       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08154          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08155          return status;
08156       }
08157 
08158       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmp, init_str);
08159       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08160          db_unlock_database(hDB);
08161          return status;
08162       }
08163    } else {
08164       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_record",
08165              "aborting on unexpected failure of db_find_key(%s), status %d", key_name, status);
08166       abort();
08167    }
08168 
08169    db_unlock_database(hDB);
08170 
08171    return DB_SUCCESS;
08172 }
08173 
08174 /********************************************************************/
08175 /**
08176 This function ensures that a certain ODB subtree matches
08177 a given C structure, by comparing the init_str with the
08178 current ODB structure. If the record does not exist at all,
08179 it is created with the default values in init_str. If it
08180 does exist but does not match the variables in init_str,
08181 the function returns an error if correct=FALSE or calls
08182 db_create_record() if correct=TRUE.
08183 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
08184 @param hKey     Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
08185 @param keyname  Name of key to search, can contain directories.
08186 @param rec_str  ASCII representation of ODB record in the format
08187 @param correct  If TRUE, correct ODB record if necessary
08188 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_KEY, DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH
08189 */
08190 INT db_check_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, const char *keyname, const char *rec_str, BOOL correct)
08191 {
08192    char line[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
08193    char title[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
08194    char key_name[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
08195    char info_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH + 50];
08196    char *pc;
08197    const char *pold, *rec_str_orig;
08198    DWORD tid;
08199    INT i, j, n_data, string_length, status;
08200    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKeyTest;
08201    KEY key;
08202    BOOL multi_line;
08203 
08204    if (rpc_is_remote())
08205       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CHECK_RECORD, hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str, correct);
08206 
08207    /* check if record exists */
08208    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, keyname, &hKeyRoot);
08209 
08210    /* create record if not */
08211    if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
08212       if (correct)
08213          return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str);
08214       return DB_NO_KEY;
08215    }
08216 
08217    assert(hKeyRoot);
08218 
08219    title[0] = 0;
08220    multi_line = FALSE;
08221    rec_str_orig = rec_str;
08222 
08223    db_get_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, &key);
08224    if (key.type == TID_KEY)
08225       /* get next subkey which is not of type TID_KEY */
08226       db_get_next_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, &hKeyTest);
08227    else
08228       /* test root key itself */
08229       hKeyTest = hKeyRoot;
08230 
08231    if (hKeyTest == 0 && *rec_str != 0) {
08232       if (correct)
08233          return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
08234 
08235       return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
08236    }
08237 
08238    do {
08239       if (*rec_str == 0)
08240          break;
08241 
08242       for (i = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str && i < MAX_STRING_LENGTH; i++)
08243          line[i] = *rec_str++;
08244 
08245       if (i == MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
08246          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record", "line too long");
08247          return DB_TRUNCATED;
08248       }
08249 
08250       line[i] = 0;
08251       if (*rec_str == '\n')
08252          rec_str++;
08253 
08254       /* check if it is a section title */
08255       if (line[0] == '[') {
08256          /* extract title and append '/' */
08257          strcpy(title, line + 1);
08258          if (strchr(title, ']'))
08259             *strchr(title, ']') = 0;
08260          if (title[0] && title[strlen(title) - 1] != '/')
08261             strcat(title, "/");
08262       } else {
08263          /* valid data line if it includes '=' and no ';' */
08264          if (strchr(line, '=') && line[0] != ';') {
08265             /* copy type info and data */
08266             pc = strchr(line, '=') + 1;
08267             while (*pc == ' ')
08268                pc++;
08269             strcpy(info_str, pc);
08270 
08271             /* extract key name */
08272             *strchr(line, '=') = 0;
08273 
08274             pc = &line[strlen(line) - 1];
08275             while (*pc == ' ')
08276                *pc-- = 0;
08277 
08278             strlcpy(key_name, line, sizeof(key_name));
08279 
08280             /* evaluate type info */
08281             strcpy(line, info_str);
08282             if (strchr(line, ' '))
08283                *strchr(line, ' ') = 0;
08284 
08285             n_data = 1;
08286             if (strchr(line, '[')) {
08287                n_data = atol(strchr(line, '[') + 1);
08288                *strchr(line, '[') = 0;
08289             }
08290 
08291             for (tid = 0; tid < TID_LAST; tid++)
08292                if (strcmp(tid_name[tid], line) == 0)
08293                   break;
08294 
08295             string_length = 0;
08296 
08297             if (tid == TID_LAST)
08298                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record", "found unknown data type \"%s\" in ODB file", line);
08299             else {
08300                /* skip type info */
08301                pc = info_str;
08302                while (*pc != ' ' && *pc)
08303                   pc++;
08304                while ((*pc == ' ' || *pc == ':') && *pc)
08305                   pc++;
08306 
08307                if (n_data > 1) {
08308                   info_str[0] = 0;
08309                   if (!*rec_str)
08310                      break;
08311 
08312                   for (j = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str; j++)
08313                      info_str[j] = *rec_str++;
08314                   info_str[j] = 0;
08315                   if (*rec_str == '\n')
08316                      rec_str++;
08317                }
08318 
08319                for (i = 0; i < n_data; i++) {
08320                   /* strip trailing \n */
08321                   pc = &info_str[strlen(info_str) - 1];
08322                   while (*pc == '\n' || *pc == '\r')
08323                      *pc-- = 0;
08324 
08325                   if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
08326                      if (!string_length) {
08327                         if (info_str[1] == '=')
08328                            string_length = -1;
08329                         else {
08330                            pc = strchr(info_str, '[');
08331                            if (pc != NULL)
08332                               string_length = atoi(pc + 1);
08333                            else
08334                               string_length = -1;
08335                         }
08336                         if (string_length > MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
08337                            string_length = MAX_STRING_LENGTH;
08338                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record", "found string exceeding MAX_STRING_LENGTH");
08339                         }
08340                      }
08341 
08342                      if (string_length == -1) {
08343                         /* multi-line string */
08344                         if (strstr(rec_str, "\n====#$@$#====\n") != NULL) {
08345                            string_length = (POINTER_T) strstr(rec_str, "\n====#$@$#====\n") - (POINTER_T) rec_str + 1;
08346 
08347                            rec_str = strstr(rec_str, "\n====#$@$#====\n") + strlen("\n====#$@$#====\n");
08348                         } else
08349                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record", "found multi-line string without termination sequence");
08350                      } else {
08351                         if (strchr(info_str, ']'))
08352                            pc = strchr(info_str, ']') + 1;
08353                         else
08354                            pc = info_str + 2;
08355                         while (*pc && *pc != ' ')
08356                            pc++;
08357                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
08358                            pc++;
08359 
08360                         /* limit string size */
08361                         *(pc + string_length - 1) = 0;
08362                      }
08363                   } else {
08364                      pc = info_str;
08365 
08366                      if (n_data > 1 && info_str[0] == '[') {
08367                         pc = strchr(info_str, ']') + 1;
08368                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
08369                            pc++;
08370                      }
08371                   }
08372 
08373                   if (i < n_data - 1) {
08374                      info_str[0] = 0;
08375                      if (!*rec_str)
08376                         break;
08377 
08378                      pold = rec_str;
08379 
08380                      for (j = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str; j++)
08381                         info_str[j] = *rec_str++;
08382                      info_str[j] = 0;
08383                      if (*rec_str == '\n')
08384                         rec_str++;
08385 
08386                      /* test if valid data */
08387                      if (tid != TID_STRING && tid != TID_LINK) {
08388                         if (info_str[0] == 0 || (strchr(info_str, '=')
08389                                                  && strchr(info_str, ':')))
08390                            rec_str = pold;
08391                      }
08392                   }
08393                }
08394 
08395                /* if rec_str contains key, but not ODB, return mismatch */
08396                if (!hKeyTest) {
08397                   if (correct)
08398                      return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
08399 
08400                   return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
08401                }
08402 
08403                status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyTest, &key);
08404                assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
08405 
08406                /* check rec_str vs. ODB key */
08407                if (!equal_ustring(key.name, key_name) || key.type != tid || key.num_values != n_data) {
08408                   if (correct)
08409                      return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
08410 
08411                   return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
08412                }
08413 
08414                /* get next key in ODB */
08415                db_get_next_link(hDB, hKeyTest, &hKeyTest);
08416             }
08417          }
08418       }
08419    } while (TRUE);
08420 
08421    return DB_SUCCESS;
08422 }
08423 
08424 /********************************************************************/
08425 /**
08426 Open a record. Create a local copy and maintain an automatic update.
08427 
08428 This function opens a hot-link between an ODB sub-tree and a local
08429 structure. The sub-tree is copied to the structure automatically every time it is
08430 modified by someone else. Additionally, a callback function can be declared
08431 which is called after the structure has been updated. The callback function
08432 receives the database handle and the key handle as parameters.
08433 
08434 Problems might occur if the ODB sub-tree contains values which don't match the
08435 C structure. Although the structure size is checked against the sub-tree size, no
08436 checking can be done if the type and order of the values in the structure are the
08437 same than those in the ODB sub-tree. Therefore it is recommended to use the
08438 function db_create_record() before db_open_record() is used which
08439 ensures that both are equivalent.
08440 
08441 The access mode might either be MODE_READ or MODE_WRITE. In read mode,
08442 the ODB sub-tree is automatically copied to the local structure when modified by
08443 other clients. In write mode, the local structure is copied to the ODB sub-tree if it
08444 has been modified locally. This update has to be manually scheduled by calling
08445 db_send_changed_records() periodically in the main loop. The system
08446 keeps a copy of the local structure to determine if its contents has been changed.
08447 
08448 If MODE_ALLOC is or'ed with the access mode, the memory for the structure is
08449 allocated internally. The structure pointer must contain a pointer to a pointer to
08450 the structure. The internal memory is released when db_close_record() is
08451 called.
08452 - To open a record in write mode.
08453 \code
08454 struct {
08455   INT level1;
08456   INT level2;
08457 } trigger_settings;
08458 char *trigger_settings_str =
08459 "[Settings]\n\
08460 level1 = INT : 0\n\
08461 level2 = INT : 0";
08462 main()
08463 {
08464   HNDLE hDB, hkey, i=0;
08465   ...
08466   cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
08467   db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger", trigger_settings_str);
08468   db_find_key(hDB, 0,"/Equipment/Trigger/Settings", &hkey);
08469   db_open_record(hDB, hkey, &trigger_settings, sizeof(trigger_settings)
08470                   , MODE_WRITE, NULL);
08471   do
08472   {
08473     trigger_settings.level1 = i++;
08474     db_send_changed_records()
08475     status = cm_yield(1000);
08476   } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN && status != SS_ABORT);
08477   ...
08478 }
08479 \endcode
08480 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
08481 @param hKey         Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
08482 @param ptr          If access_mode includes MODE_ALLOC:
08483                     Address of pointer which points to the record data after 
08484                     the call if access_mode includes not MODE_ALLOC:
08485                     Address of record if ptr==NULL, only the dispatcher is called.
08486 @param rec_size     Record size in bytes                    
08487 @param access_mode Mode for opening record, either MODE_READ or
08488                     MODE_WRITE. May be or'ed with MODE_ALLOC to
