08489                     let db_open_record allocate the memory for the record.
08490 @param (*dispatcher)   Function which gets called when record is updated.The
08491                     argument list composed of: HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *info
08492 @param info Additional info passed to the dispatcher.
08493 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_MEMORY, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH
08494 */
08495 INT db_open_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *ptr, INT rec_size,
08496                    WORD access_mode, void (*dispatcher) (INT, INT, void *), void *info)
08497 {
08498    INT idx, status, size;
08499    KEY key;
08500    void *data;
08501    char str[256];
08502 
08503    /* allocate new space for the local record list */
08504    if (_record_list_entries == 0) {
08505       _record_list = (RECORD_LIST *) malloc(sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
08506       memset(_record_list, 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
08507       if (_record_list == NULL) {
08508          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
08509          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
08510       }
08511 
08512       _record_list_entries = 1;
08513       idx = 0;
08514    } else {
08515       /* check for a deleted entry */
08516       for (idx = 0; idx < _record_list_entries; idx++)
08517          if (!_record_list[idx].handle)
08518             break;
08519 
08520       /* if not found, create new one */
08521       if (idx == _record_list_entries) {
08522          _record_list = (RECORD_LIST *) realloc(_record_list, sizeof(RECORD_LIST) * (_record_list_entries + 1));
08523          if (_record_list == NULL) {
08524             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
08525             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
08526          }
08527 
08528          memset(&_record_list[_record_list_entries], 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
08529 
08530          _record_list_entries++;
08531       }
08532    }
08533 
08534    db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
08535 
08536    /* check record size */
08537    status = db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &size);
08538    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08539       _record_list_entries--;
08540       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot get record size");
08541       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
08542    }
08543    if (size != rec_size && ptr != NULL) {
08544       _record_list_entries--;
08545       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
08546       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\" (%d instead of %d)", str, rec_size, size);
08547       return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
08548    }
08549 
08550    /* check for read access */
08551    if (((key.access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE) && (access_mode & MODE_WRITE))
08552        || (!(key.access_mode & MODE_WRITE) && (access_mode & MODE_WRITE))
08553        || (!(key.access_mode & MODE_READ) && (access_mode & MODE_READ))) {
08554       _record_list_entries--;
08555       return DB_NO_ACCESS;
08556    }
08557 
08558    if (access_mode & MODE_ALLOC) {
08559       data = malloc(size);
08560       memset(data, 0, size);
08561 
08562       if (data == NULL) {
08563          _record_list_entries--;
08564          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
08565          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
08566       }
08567 
08568       *((void **) ptr) = data;
08569    } else
08570       data = ptr;
08571 
08572    /* copy record to local memory */
08573    if (access_mode & MODE_READ && data != NULL) {
08574       status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, data, &size, 0);
08575       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08576          _record_list_entries--;
08577          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot get record");
08578          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
08579       }
08580    }
08581 
08582    /* copy local record to ODB */
08583    if (access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
08584       /* only write to ODB if not in MODE_ALLOC */
08585       if ((access_mode & MODE_ALLOC) == 0) {
08586          status = db_set_record(hDB, hKey, data, size, 0);
08587          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
08588             _record_list_entries--;
08589             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot set record");
08590             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
08591          }
08592       }
08593 
08594       /* init a local copy of the record */
08595       _record_list[idx].copy = malloc(size);
08596       if (_record_list[idx].copy == NULL) {
08597          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
08598          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
08599       }
08600 
08601       memcpy(_record_list[idx].copy, data, size);
08602    }
08603 
08604    /* initialize record list */
08605    _record_list[idx].handle = hKey;
08606    _record_list[idx].hDB = hDB;
08607    _record_list[idx].access_mode = access_mode;
08608    _record_list[idx].data = data;
08609    _record_list[idx].buf_size = size;
08610    _record_list[idx].dispatcher = dispatcher;
08611    _record_list[idx].info = info;
08612 
08613    /* add record entry in database structure */
08614    return db_add_open_record(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (access_mode & ~MODE_ALLOC));
08615 }
08616 
08617 /********************************************************************/
08618 /**
08619 Close a record previously opend with db_open_record.
08620 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
08621 @param hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
08622 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
08623 */
08624 INT db_close_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey)
08625 {
08626 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
08627    {
08628       INT i;
08629 
08630       for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++)
08631          if (_record_list[i].handle == hKey && _record_list[i].hDB == hDB)
08632             break;
08633 
08634       if (i == _record_list_entries)
08635          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
08636 
08637       /* remove record entry from database structure */
08638       db_remove_open_record(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
08639 
08640       /* free local memory */
08641       if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_ALLOC)
08642          free(_record_list[i].data);
08643 
08644       if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
08645          free(_record_list[i].copy);
08646 
08647       memset(&_record_list[i], 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
08648    }
08649 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
08650 
08651    return DB_SUCCESS;
08652 }
08653 
08654 /********************************************************************/
08655 /**
08656 Release local memory for open records.
08657 This routines is called by db_close_all_databases() and 
08658 cm_disconnect_experiment()
08659 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
08660 */
08661 INT db_close_all_records()
08662 {
08663    INT i;
08664 
08665    for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++) {
08666       if (_record_list[i].handle) {
08667          if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
08668             free(_record_list[i].copy);
08669 
08670          if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_ALLOC)
08671             free(_record_list[i].data);
08672 
08673          memset(&_record_list[i], 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
08674       }
08675    }
08676 
08677    if (_record_list_entries > 0) {
08678       _record_list_entries = 0;
08679       free(_record_list);
08680    }
08681 
08682    return DB_SUCCESS;
08683 }
08684 
08685 /********************************************************************/
08686 /**
08687 If called locally, update a record (hDB/hKey) and copy
08688 its new contents to the local copy of it.
08689 
08690 If called from a server, send a network notification to the client.
08691 @param hDB          ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
08692 @param hKey         Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
08693 @param s            optional server socket
08694 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
08695 */
08696 INT db_update_record(INT hDB, INT hKey, int s)
08697 {
08698    INT i, size, convert_flags, status;
08699    char buffer[32];
08700    NET_COMMAND *nc;
08701 
08702    /* check if we are the server */
08703    if (s) {
08704       convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
08705 
08706       if (convert_flags & CF_ASCII) {
08707          sprintf(buffer, "MSG_ODB&%d&%d", hDB, hKey);
08708          send_tcp(s, buffer, strlen(buffer) + 1, 0);
08709       } else {
08710          nc = (NET_COMMAND *) buffer;
08711 
08712          nc->header.routine_id = MSG_ODB;
08713          nc->header.param_size = 2 * sizeof(INT);
08714          *((INT *) nc->param) = hDB;
08715          *((INT *) nc->param + 1) = hKey;
08716 
08717          if (convert_flags) {
08718             rpc_convert_single(&nc->header.routine_id, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
08719             rpc_convert_single(&nc->header.param_size, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
08720             rpc_convert_single(&nc->param[0], TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
08721             rpc_convert_single(&nc->param[4], TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
08722          }
08723 
08724          /* send the update notification to the client */
08725          send_tcp(s, buffer, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + 2 * sizeof(INT), 0);
08726       }
08727 
08728       return DB_SUCCESS;
08729    }
08730 
08731    status = DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
08732 
08733    /* check all entries for matching key */
08734    for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++)
08735       if (_record_list[i].handle == hKey) {
08736          status = DB_SUCCESS;
08737 
08738          /* get updated data if record not opened in write mode */
08739          if ((_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE) == 0) {
08740             size = _record_list[i].buf_size;
08741             if (_record_list[i].data != NULL)
08742                db_get_record(hDB, hKey, _record_list[i].data, &size, 0);
08743 
08744             /* call dispatcher if requested */
08745             if (_record_list[i].dispatcher)
08746                _record_list[i].dispatcher(hDB, hKey, _record_list[i].info);
08747          }
08748       }
08749 
08750    return DB_SUCCESS;
08751 }
08752 
08753 /********************************************************************/
08754 /**
08755 Send all records to the ODB which were changed locally since the last
08756 call to this function.
08757 
08758 This function is valid if used in conjunction with db_open_record()
08759 under the condition the record is open as MODE_WRITE access code.
08760 
08761 - Full example dbchange.c which can be compiled as follow
08762 \code
08763 gcc -DOS_LINUX -I/midas/include -o dbchange dbchange.c
08764 /midas/linux/lib/libmidas.a -lutil}
08765 
08766 \begin{verbatim}
08767 //------- dbchange.c
08768 #include "midas.h"
08769 #include "msystem.h"
08770 \endcode
08771 
08772 \code
08773 //-------- BOF dbchange.c
08774 typedef struct {
08775     INT    my_number;
08776     float   my_rate;
08777 } MY_STATISTICS;
08778 
08779 MY_STATISTICS myrec;
08780 
08781 #define MY_STATISTICS(_name) char *_name[] = {\
08782 "My Number = INT : 0",\
08783 "My Rate = FLOAT : 0",\
08784 "",\
08785 NULL }
08786 
08787 HNDLE hDB, hKey;
08788 
08789 // Main
08790 int main(unsigned int argc,char **argv)
08791 {
08792   char      host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
08793   char      expt_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
08794   INT       lastnumber, status, msg;
08795   BOOL      debug=FALSE;
08796   char      i, ch;
08797   DWORD     update_time, mainlast_time;
08798   MY_STATISTICS (my_stat);
08799 
08800   // set default
08801   host_name[0] = 0;
08802   expt_name[0] = 0;
08803 
08804   // get default
08805   cm_get_environment(host_name, sizeof(host_name), expt_name, sizeof(expt_name));
08806 
08807   // get parameters
08808   for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
08809   {
08810     if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'd')
08811       debug = TRUE;
08812     else if (argv[i][0] == '-')
08813     {
08814       if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
08815         goto usage;
08816       if (strncmp(argv[i],"-e",2) == 0)
08817         strcpy(expt_name, argv[++i]);
08818       else if (strncmp(argv[i],"-h",2)==0)
08819         strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
08820     }
08821     else
08822     {
08823    usage:
08824       printf("usage: dbchange [-h <Hostname>] [-e <Experiment>]\n");
08825       return 0;
08826     }
08827   }
08828 
08829   // connect to experiment
08830   status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, expt_name, "dbchange", 0);
08831   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
08832     return 1;
08833 
08834   // Connect to DB
08835   cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
08836 
08837   // Create a default structure in ODB
08838   db_create_record(hDB, 0, "My statistics", strcomb(my_stat));
08839 
08840   // Retrieve key for that strucutre in ODB
08841   if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, "My statistics", &hKey) != DB_SUCCESS)
08842   {
08843     cm_msg(MERROR, "mychange", "cannot find My statistics");
08844     goto error;
08845   }
08846 
08847   // Hot link this structure in Write mode
08848   status = db_open_record(hDB, hKey, &myrec
08849                           , sizeof(MY_STATISTICS), MODE_WRITE, NULL, NULL);
08850   if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
08851   {
08852     cm_msg(MERROR, "mychange", "cannot open My statistics record");
08853     goto error;
08854   }
08855 
08856   // initialize ss_getchar()
08857   ss_getchar(0);
08858 
08859   // Main loop
08860   do
08861   {
08862     // Update local structure
08863     if ((ss_millitime() - update_time) > 100)
08864     {
08865       myrec.my_number += 1;
08866       if (myrec.my_number - lastnumber) {
08867         myrec.my_rate = 1000.f * (float) (myrec.my_number - lastnumber)
08868           / (float) (ss_millitime() - update_time);
08869       }
08870       update_time = ss_millitime();
08871       lastnumber = myrec.my_number;
08872     }
08873 
08874     // Publish local structure to ODB (db_send_changed_record)
08875     if ((ss_millitime() - mainlast_time) > 5000)
08876     {
08877       db_send_changed_records();                   // <------- Call
08878       mainlast_time = ss_millitime();
08879     }
08880 
08881     // Check for keyboard interaction
08882     ch = 0;
08883     while (ss_kbhit())
08884     {
08885       ch = ss_getchar(0);
08886       if (ch == -1)
08887         ch = getchar();
08888       if ((char) ch == '!')
08889         break;
08890     }
08891     msg = cm_yield(20);
08892   } while (msg != RPC_SHUTDOWN && msg != SS_ABORT && ch != '!');
08893 
08894  error:
08895   cm_disconnect_experiment();
08896   return 1;
08897 }
08898 //-------- EOF dbchange.c
08899 \endcode
08900 @return DB_SUCCESS
08901 */
08902 INT db_send_changed_records()
08903 {
08904    INT i;
08905 
08906    for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++)
08907       if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
08908          if (memcmp(_record_list[i].copy, _record_list[i].data, _record_list[i].buf_size) != 0) {
08909             /* switch to fast TCP mode temporarily */
08910             if (rpc_is_remote())
08911                rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
08912             db_set_record(_record_list[i].hDB,
08913                           _record_list[i].handle, _record_list[i].data, _record_list[i].buf_size, 0);
08914             if (rpc_is_remote())
08915                rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
08916             memcpy(_record_list[i].copy, _record_list[i].data, _record_list[i].buf_size);
08917          }
08918       }
08919 
08920    return DB_SUCCESS;
08921 }
08922 
08923 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
08924 
08925 /**dox***************************************************************/
08926                                                        /** @} *//* end of odbfunctionc */
08927 
08928 /**dox***************************************************************/
08929                                                        /** @} *//* end of odbcode */
